Question: How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket?
Answer: Steps To Integrate Prestashop With Shiprocket      Prestashop is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Prestashop account. Given below are the main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Prestashop with your Shiprocket account.        Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Prestashop with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Pending Orders from Prestashop panel into the system. By default we’ll fetch “Payment Accepted ” and “ remote payment accepted” status orders.        Automatic Status Sync – For the orders processed via Shiprocket panel the status will automatically be updated on Prestashop .        How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket     Step A: Setting at Prestashop End      Login to your Prestashop Admin Panel.   Go to Advanced Parameters -> Webservice.   Make sure the option “Enable PrestaShop’s Web Service” should be marked “Yes”.  Click on Sign (+) to add new API.            Step B: Generating API Key      Enter Key value and click to Generate.   Enter Key Description i.e. (API key, API name, other information)   Enable Status to Yes.   Check all Permissions.   Click on Save.            Step C: Settings in ShipRocket        1. Login to Shiprocket panel.      2. Go to Channels –> All Channels.     3. Click on “Add New Channel” Button as highlighted in the image below.             4. Click on Prestashop -> Integrate.             5. Switch “On” the Order Sync icon .        6. Enter Prestashop Store URL & Prestashop API Key (which has been already generated in Step B)             7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.
Answer_html:
Steps To Integrate Prestashop With Shiprocket 


Prestashop is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Prestashop account. Given below are the
main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Prestashop with your Shiprocket account.



Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Prestashop with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Pending Orders from Prestashop panel into the system. By default we’ll fetch “Payment Accepted ” and “ remote payment accepted” status orders.



Automatic Status Sync – For the orders processed via Shiprocket panel the status will automatically be updated on Prestashop .



How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket


Step A: Setting at Prestashop End


  1. Login to your Prestashop Admin Panel. 
  2. Go to Advanced Parameters -> Webservice. 
  3. Make sure the option “Enable PrestaShop’s Web Service” should be marked “Yes”.
  4. Click on Sign (+) to add new API.



 Step B: Generating API Key


  1. Enter Key value and click to Generate. 
  2. Enter Key Description i.e. (API key, API name, other information) 
  3. Enable Status to Yes. 
  4. Check all Permissions. 
  5. Click on Save.



 Step C: Settings in ShipRocket



1. Login to Shiprocket panel. 


2. Go to Channels –> All Channels.


3. Click on “Add New Channel” Button as highlighted in the image below.




4. Click on Prestashop -> Integrate.




5. Switch “On” the Order Sync icon .



6. Enter Prestashop Store URL & Prestashop API Key (which has been already generated in Step B)




7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.

Question: What Is a Pull Order Status Mapper?
Answer: A Pull Order Status Mapper allows you to match your eCommerce channel or website statuses with the Shiprocket's order processing status. For this;     1. Go to the Channels tab and, click on All Channels  3. Now, click on 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to pull order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.  4. On this page locate the 'Pull Order Statuses' header.  5. You can enter multiple statuses separated by "," . Please refer to the image below:        6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'        Note: By default, we import unfulfilled orders for Amazon. If you are connecting any other channel, please mention all your order statuses which you want to map with Shiprocket's order processing status.
Answer_html:
A Pull Order Status Mapper allows you to match your eCommerce channel or website statuses with the Shiprocket's order processing status. For this;


1. Go to the Channels tab and, click on All Channels

3. Now, click on 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to pull order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.

4. On this page locate the 'Pull Order Statuses' header.

5. You can enter multiple statuses separated by "," . Please refer to the image below:


 

6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'



Note: By default, we import unfulfilled orders for Amazon. If you are connecting any other channel, please mention all your order statuses which you want to map with Shiprocket's order processing status.

Question: What Is a Push Order Status Mapper?
Answer: A Push Order Status Mapper helps you match your channel or website statuses with the default statuses of Shiprocket. By turning it on, you can select or create an order status which you want to push on your channel. When the Push Order Status Mapper is disabled, default push status mapping will work on your channel.         1. Go to the Channels tab and click on All Channels.   3. Now, click on 'edit' button for the channel you wish to push order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.  4. Here, you will be able to locate the 'Push Order Statuses' header. Please turn the toggle on.  5. Now, you can either select from the drop-down or create your own custom statuses. Please refer to the image below:  Note: Make sure you only mention the statuses you have on your channel.          6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'. Question: What is a custom channel and how do I use it?
Answer: Custom channel can be created to manage offline/Store orders or to manage orders from channels which are not integrated with Shiprocket.     How to Add a Custom Channel     Step 1: Go to Channels and click on All Channels > Add a New Channel          Step 2: You will see a list of all the channels that can be integrated with Shiprocket. Now select Custom -> Click Integrate          Step 3: Fill in the Channel Name field -> Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”          Green icon indicates that the channel have been successfully configured.          (Note : Orders do not come into the system automatically via any channel and no inventory is updated to Custom channel. User have to import orders manually for Custom Channel via “Bulk import Order Sheet”)
Answer_html:
Custom channel can be created to manage offline/Store orders or to manage orders from channels which are not integrated with Shiprocket.


How to Add a Custom Channel


Step 1: Go to Channels and click on All Channels > Add a New Channel



Step 2: You will see a list of all the channels that can be integrated with Shiprocket. Now select Custom -> Click Integrate



Step 3: Fill in the Channel Name field -> Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”



Green icon indicates that the channel have been successfully configured.



(Note : Orders do not come into the system automatically via any channel and no inventory is updated to Custom channel. User have to import orders manually for Custom Channel via “Bulk import Order Sheet”)

Question: How do I integrate my Zoho website with Shiprocket?
Answer: You can now integrate your Zoho website with Shiprocket. This integration is really useful for Zoho sellers who want to automate their order fulfillment process.     To connect your website, please follow the steps below:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels. Here, click on the "All Channels" tab.     2. Go ahead and click on the "Add New Channel" button placed at the top-right corner of your screen.     3. Here, click on the "Zoho" channel. On the new page, click on the "Connect to Zoho" button.      4. You'll be diverted to the Zoho login page. Log in to your Zoho account by entering your username and password.    5. Once logged in, a pop up will open where you can verify your account integration with Shiprocket by clicking "Accept".    6. Now, you will be redirected to the Shiprocket "All Channels" page. Here you can edit your "Zoho" channel to modify it as per your preferences.       Note: On successful integration, we will automatically import your website orders to your Shiprocket account.     Ready to integrate? Log in to your Shiprocket account right now and say goodbye to manual order processing.     Need help? We're here if you need us. Reach out to us at support@shiprocket.in for any assistance.
Answer_html:
You can now integrate your Zoho website with Shiprocket. This integration is really useful for Zoho sellers who want to automate their order fulfillment process.


To connect your website, please follow the steps below:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels. Here, click on the "All Channels" tab.


2. Go ahead and click on the "Add New Channel" button placed at the top-right corner of your screen.


3. Here, click on the "Zoho" channel. On the new page, click on the "Connect to Zoho" button. 


4. You'll be diverted to the Zoho login page. Log in to your Zoho account by entering your username and password.

5. Once logged in, a pop up will open where you can verify your account integration with Shiprocket by clicking "Accept".

6. Now, you will be redirected to the Shiprocket "All Channels" page. Here you can edit your "Zoho" channel to modify it as per your preferences.


Note: On successful integration, we will automatically import your website orders to your Shiprocket account.


Ready to integrate? Log in to your Shiprocket account right now and say goodbye to manual order processing.


Need help? We're here if you need us. Reach out to us at support@shiprocket.in for any assistance.

Question: How do I integrate my Store Hippo account with Shiprocket?
Answer: It's time to focus more on growing your business by automating the shipping process. Use the following instructions to instantly import all your orders into your Shiprocket account:     A step-by-step guide to integrate your Store Hippo account with Shiprocket:        1. Generate an "Access Key"     a) Log in to your Store Hippo account  b) Go to "Advanced Settings" to create an access key     2. Integrate Store Hippo with Shiprocket     a) Log in to your Shiprocket account  b) Here, click on Channels > All Channels  c) Click on "Add New Channel" from your top-right corner. A new screen will open where you can find the list of all the channels that can be integrated with ShipRocket.  d) Click on the ‘Add’ option under Store Hippo.     e) Here, turn the toggle on to pull your order statuses in Shiprocket.   f) Next, enter your "Store URL" and "Access Key".       g) Finally, click on ‘Save Channel and Test Connection’.   If the details shared in the seller panel are valid, the Store Hippo channel will be enabled instantly and you would be able to fetch orders from the past 30 days.
Answer_html:
It's time to focus more on growing your business by automating the shipping process. Use the following instructions to instantly import all your orders into your Shiprocket account:


A step-by-step guide to integrate your Store Hippo account with Shiprocket:



1. Generate an "Access Key"

a) Log in to your Store Hippo account
b) Go to "Advanced Settings" to create an access key

2. Integrate Store Hippo with Shiprocket

a) Log in to your Shiprocket account

b) Here, click on Channels > All Channels

c) Click on "Add New Channel" from your top-right corner. A new screen will open where you can find the list of all the channels that can be integrated with ShipRocket.

d) Click on the ‘Add’ option under Store Hippo.


e) Here, turn the toggle on to pull your order statuses in Shiprocket. 

f) Next, enter your "Store URL" and "Access Key".


g) Finally, click on ‘Save Channel and Test Connection’.

If the details shared in the seller panel are valid, the Store Hippo channel will be enabled instantly and you would be able to fetch orders from the past 30 days.

Question: How to integrate Facebook Messenger with Shiprocket?
Answer: Please follow the steps to integrate Facebook Messenger with Shiprocket:     1. Go to messenger.com and log in to your registered Facebook account.  2. Now, use the search bar to search "Shipbot".           3. Click on "Get Started" to proceed with your integration.           4. You can now choose the option "Link Existing Login" to connect your Shiprocket account. Next, click on "Link Account".          5. Link with your registered Shiprocket credentials.          6. Here you go! You are now connected with ShipRocket. Start processing orders using our chat extension and shipping them easily.
Answer_html:
Please follow the steps to integrate Facebook Messenger with Shiprocket:


1. Go to messenger.com and log in to your registered Facebook account.

2. Now, use the search bar to search "Shipbot". 



3. Click on "Get Started" to proceed with your integration. 



4. You can now choose the option "Link Existing Login" to connect your Shiprocket account. Next, click on "Link Account".



5. Link with your registered Shiprocket credentials.



6. Here you go! You are now connected with ShipRocket. Start processing orders using our chat extension and shipping them easily.

Question: Channel Integration: How to import the weight and dimensions of each product?
Answer: Shiprocket does not import dimensions for any of your SKU. However, you can easily add shipping weight and dimensions to each product by following the instructions below:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels -> Channel Products.    2. You'll find an 'upload' icon at the top-right corner of your screen. Click on it and download a sample product file.        3. Replace the sample data with your products' information. It includes info like Channel Name, Product Name, SKU Code, Weight, Dimensions, etc.     4. Now, select the updated file using the 'Browse' option and click on 'Upload Products' to proceed.      Note: Adding actual/dead weight to the product file is optional but highly advisable. Shiprocket will take the default weight of your SKU if there's no information present in the product file.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket does not import dimensions for any of your SKU. However, you can easily add shipping weight and dimensions to each product by following the instructions below:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels -> Channel Products.

2. You'll find an 'upload' icon at the top-right corner of your screen. Click on it and download a sample product file. 


3. Replace the sample data with your products' information. It includes info like Channel Name, Product Name, SKU Code, Weight, Dimensions, etc. 

4. Now, select the updated file using the 'Browse' option and click on 'Upload Products' to proceed. 


Note: Adding actual/dead weight to the product file is optional but highly advisable. Shiprocket will take the default weight of your SKU if there's no information present in the product file.

Question: How to create an API user? Can I have more than one API users?
Answer: Yes, you can add up to 4 API users. Please read below to know how to create an API user in Shiprocket:      Go to Settings from the left menu and navigate to API menu.  Select Configure and then click on Create an API user button.  Please enter a Valid Email ID which is different from currently used registered email.  Input an appropriate password.  The next step will be to use the POST Authentication API in the given URL to Generate your Token for each request http://apidocs.shiprocket.in/      For more information, please refer to Shiprocket API Document Helpsheet.
Answer_html:
Yes, you can add up to 4 API users. Please read below to know how to create an API user in Shiprocket:


  1. Go to Settings from the left menu and navigate to API menu.
  2. Select Configure and then click on Create an API user button.
  3. Please enter a Valid Email ID which is different from currently used registered email.
  4. Input an appropriate password.
  5. The next step will be to use the POST Authentication API in the given URL to Generate your Token for each request http://apidocs.shiprocket.in/


For more information, please refer to Shiprocket API Document Helpsheet.

Question: How do I integrate Instamojo with Shiprocket?
Answer: You can now integrate your Instamojo website with Shiprocket. This integration is really useful for Instamojo sellers who want to automate their order fulfilment process.     Steps to be followed:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels. Here, click on the "All Channels" tab.     2. Go ahead and click on the "Add New Channel" button placed at the top-right corner of your screen.           3. Here, click on the "Instamojo" channel. On the new page, click on the "Connect to Instamojo" button.            4. You will be taken to the Instamojo seller login page. Enter your email address/username and password to access your Instamojo account.        5. Once logged in, a page titled "Authorize Shiprocket" will appear, where you can confirm your account integration with Shiprocket by clicking "Authorize."       6. After that, you'll be taken to the Shiprocket channel page. You can edit your Instamojo channel here to modify it to your liking.
Answer_html:
You can now integrate your Instamojo website with Shiprocket. This integration is really useful for Instamojo sellers who want to automate their order fulfilment process.


Steps to be followed:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels. Here, click on the "All Channels" tab.


2. Go ahead and click on the "Add New Channel" button placed at the top-right corner of your screen.




3. Here, click on the "Instamojo" channel. On the new page, click on the "Connect to Instamojo" button. 




4. You will be taken to the Instamojo seller login page. Enter your email address/username and password to access your Instamojo account.



5. Once logged in, a page titled "Authorize Shiprocket" will appear, where you can confirm your account integration with Shiprocket by clicking "Authorize."


6. After that, you'll be taken to the Shiprocket channel page. You can edit your Instamojo channel here to modify it to your liking.

Question: How do I integrate Ecwid as a channel with Shiprocket ?
Answer: Follow the steps below to integrate your Shiprocket account with Ecwid:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels.  2. Here, go to All Channels and click on the Add New Channel button.  3. Next, find the Ecwid channel and click on Integrate.          4. Fill in the required information and then click the 'Connect to Ecwid' button on your screen to continue.          5. You'll be directed to the Ecwid login page. To log in, enter your Ecwid username and password.          6. Once logged in, you'll see a pop-up on your screen asking you to 'Authorize Shiprocket'. To proceed, confirm your account integration details and click 'Authorize'.  7. When you click Authorize, you will be redirected to your Shiprocket account. Please click the 'Edit' button to customize your Ecwid channel to your preference.           Note: Shiprocket will begin importing your Ecwid orders into Shiprocket after 30-minutes of successful integration.
Answer_html:
Follow the steps below to integrate your Shiprocket account with Ecwid:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels.

2. Here, go to All Channels and click on the Add New Channel button.

3. Next, find the Ecwid channel and click on Integrate.



4. Fill in the required information and then click the 'Connect to Ecwid' button on your screen to continue.



5. You'll be directed to the Ecwid login page. To log in, enter your Ecwid username and password.



6. Once logged in, you'll see a pop-up on your screen asking you to 'Authorize Shiprocket'. To proceed, confirm your account integration details and click 'Authorize'.

7. When you click Authorize, you will be redirected to your Shiprocket account. Please click the 'Edit' button to customize your Ecwid channel to your preference. 



Note: Shiprocket will begin importing your Ecwid orders into Shiprocket after 30-minutes of successful integration.

Question: Shopify Integration: How long does it take for the order to be reflected in the SR panel?
Answer: We fetch Shopify orders in real-time.
Answer_html: We fetch Shopify orders in real-time.

Question: Shopify Integration: Will an order that has been cancelled in Shopify be updated in Shiprocket?
Answer: Yes, we update your Shopify orders in real-time. It means that even if the order is canceled after it has been fetched in the Shiprokcet system, it will still be marked as canceled.
Answer_html: Yes, we update your Shopify orders in real-time. It means that even if the order is canceled after it has been fetched in the Shiprokcet system, it will still be marked as canceled.

Question: Shopify Integration: Why is my prepaid order listed as COD in Shiprocket?
Answer: If the status of your payment is still pending at the time of fetching, your prepaid order will be listed as COD in Shiprocket.     However, if the payment is updated in Shopify, we will also update the payment status here and mark the order as Prepaid.     Note: Make sure the Payment status is updated before assigning the AWB.
Answer_html:
If the status of your payment is still pending at the time of fetching, your prepaid order will be listed as COD in Shiprocket.


However, if the payment is updated in Shopify, we will also update the payment status here and mark the order as Prepaid.


Note: Make sure the Payment status is updated before assigning the AWB.

Question: Shopify Integration: Will Shiprocket fetch the order's weight and dimensions?
Answer: Shiprocket only retrieves an order's weight from Shopify. Dimensions can be manually updated when orders are processed. Alternatively, you can use the Bulk Upload method to update the dimensions in bulk from the Channel Products.     Please follow the steps outlined below:     a) From the left menu, navigate to Channels and select Channel Products.     b) In the upper-right corner, click the Upload icon.     c) Save the sample products file and replace the data with your own.     d) Re-upload it to change the dimensions.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket only retrieves an order's weight from Shopify. Dimensions can be manually updated when orders are processed. Alternatively, you can use the Bulk Upload method to update the dimensions in bulk from the Channel Products.


Please follow the steps outlined below:


a) From the left menu, navigate to Channels and select Channel Products.


b) In the upper-right corner, click the Upload icon.


c) Save the sample products file and replace the data with your own.


d) Re-upload it to change the dimensions.

Question: Shopify Integration: Is it possible in Shiprocket to fetch only COD confirmed orders?
Answer: Yes, if you only want to fetch COD confirmed orders in Shiprocket, please follow these steps:     Select Channels from the left menu.  In front of your Shopify channel, click the Edit button.  Navigate to Pull Order Statuses.  In the field "Pull COD order with Tags," enter your COD order tag.
Answer_html:
Yes, if you only want to fetch COD confirmed orders in Shiprocket, please follow these steps:


Select Channels from the left menu.

In front of your Shopify channel, click the Edit button.

Navigate to Pull Order Statuses.

In the field "Pull COD order with Tags," enter your COD order tag.

Question: What are the necessary steps to be fulfilled for hassle free COD remittance?
Answer: To get a hassle-free COD remittance, ensure the following:   Bank details are updated in your Shiprocket panel in which you want the amount to get remitted.  Your Shiprocket wallet balance is always positive [only for prepaid sellers].  There is no freight invoice pending for more than 30 days.
Answer_html:
To get a hassle-free COD remittance, ensure the following:

  1. Bank details are updated in your Shiprocket panel in which you want the amount to get remitted.
  2. Your Shiprocket wallet balance is always positive [only for prepaid sellers].
  3. There is no freight invoice pending for more than 30 days.

Question: I want to check how much COD is pending to be remitted?
Answer: In ShipRocket, you can easily view the COD amount that is pending to be remitted. For this;     1. Go to the Billing tab and click on the COD Remittance tab. The top 5 sections as shown in the image below gives you the snapshot of your COD remittance amount till date with Shiprocket.           COD Available: Total COD amount yet to remit.  Last COD remitted: COD amount remitted most recently  Total COD Remitted ( In last 30 days): COD amount that has been remitted in the last 30 days  Total Reversal Amount: We took back the COD amount due to some specific reasons  Remittance Initiated: We have initiated the COD amount. It will be remitted in the next COD cycle
Answer_html:
In ShipRocket, you can easily view the COD amount that is pending to be remitted. For this;


1. Go to the Billing tab and click on the COD Remittance tab. The top 5 sections as shown in the image below gives you the snapshot of your COD remittance amount till date with Shiprocket.



  1. COD Available: Total COD amount yet to remit.
  2. Last COD remitted: COD amount remitted most recently
  3. Total COD Remitted ( In last 30 days): COD amount that has been remitted in the last 30 days
  4. Total Reversal Amount: We took back the COD amount due to some specific reasons
  5. Remittance Initiated: We have initiated the COD amount. It will be remitted in the next COD cycle

Question: I want to upgrade my Shiprocket plan. How do I do it?
Answer: ShipRocket offers a range of plans which fit any requirement that a user might have. If you wish to upgrade your plan, follow the steps given below:     1. Go to your left menu bar and click on the Billing tab   2. Now, click on Current Plan Details. Here you can see different plans which are available with ShipRocket.          3. Every Shiprocket plan has something different to offer. Select your plan and click on the Activate button.   4. Select your ideal duration and click on 'Pay Now'.     On successful payment, your Shiprocket plan gets upgraded to the selected plan and all the benefits are unlocked.
Answer_html:
ShipRocket offers a range of plans which fit any requirement that a user might have. If you wish to upgrade your plan, follow the steps given below:


1. Go to your left menu bar and click on the Billing tab 

2. Now, click on Current Plan Details. Here you can see different plans which are available with ShipRocket.



3. Every Shiprocket plan has something different to offer. Select your plan and click on the Activate button. 

4. Select your ideal duration and click on 'Pay Now'.


On successful payment, your Shiprocket plan gets upgraded to the selected plan and all the benefits are unlocked.

Question: How soon can I receive my COD amount in my bank account?
Answer: You can receive your COD amount in your bank account after 8 -9 days of order delivery. Alternatively, you can opt for our Early COD option, and receive COD payments in your bank account as soon as 2 days after delivery.
Answer_html: You can receive your COD amount in your bank account after 8 -9 days of order delivery. Alternatively, you can opt for our Early COD option, and receive COD payments in your bank account as soon as 2 days after delivery.

Question: What is Shiprocket Postpaid? How do I activate it?
Answer: The Postpaid plan is an effective way for the seller to get more transparent reconciliations, uninterrupted shipping, and benefit from faster COD remittance process. It gives the seller more power over their money and enables them to utilize it for shipping while their COD remittance is processing.     Benefits of Postpaid     1. Dynamic Shipping Limit - With the Postpaid feature, a seller gets a daily dynamic shipping limit based on his/her COD delivered shipments.      2. No worries about low balance or inability to recharge    3. Convenience of auto-recharge        How to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid?      Go to the Settings on the ShipRocket Panel and click on Company.         2. Here, click on the Remittance Settings          3. Turn the toggle on to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid.      4. After opting for the Postpaid setting, you’ll be required to upload the image of your signature and accept the Agreement.     5. Click on Submit to proceed.
Answer_html:
The Postpaid plan is an effective way for the seller to get more transparent reconciliations, uninterrupted shipping, and benefit from faster COD remittance process. It gives the seller more power over their money and enables them to utilize it for shipping while their COD remittance is processing.


Benefits of Postpaid


1. Dynamic Shipping Limit - With the Postpaid feature, a seller gets a daily dynamic shipping limit based on his/her COD delivered shipments. 


2. No worries about low balance or inability to recharge

3. Convenience of auto-recharge

 


How to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid?


  1. Go to the Settings on the ShipRocket Panel and click on Company.


   2. Here, click on the Remittance Settings



3. Turn the toggle on to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid. 


4. After opting for the Postpaid setting, you’ll be required to upload the image of your signature and accept the Agreement.


5. Click on Submit to proceed.

Question: How to generate invoice and label for single and bulk order?
Answer: I) Generating Label/Invoice for a Single Order:     1. Click on the Orders tab. 2. Now, click on the Ready to Ship tab. Select the order for which you need to generate the label/invoice.  3. Now click on the little 'Print' button to download your label/invoice.             II)   A. Generating Label/Invoice for a Bulk Order:     1. Click on the Orders tab.  2. Likewise, select all orders for which you need to generate bulk label/invoice.  3. Click on the 'Print' button and download your label/invoice in bulk.           B. Generating Label/Invoice in Bulk from Bulk Actions     1. Go to 'Tools' from your left-menu and click on 'Bulk Actions'  2. Enter the Order ID(s) or the tracking numbers for which you would like to print label or invoice in bulk  3. Select print label/invoice and click on 'Submit' to proceed.
Answer_html:
I) Generating Label/Invoice for a Single Order:


1. Click on the Orders tab.
2. Now, click on the Ready to Ship tab. Select the order for which you need to generate the label/invoice.

3. Now click on the little 'Print' button to download your label/invoice.




II) 

A. Generating Label/Invoice for a Bulk Order:


1. Click on the Orders tab.

2. Likewise, select all orders for which you need to generate bulk label/invoice.

3. Click on the 'Print' button and download your label/invoice in bulk. 



B. Generating Label/Invoice in Bulk from Bulk Actions


1. Go to 'Tools' from your left-menu and click on 'Bulk Actions'

2. Enter the Order ID(s) or the tracking numbers for which you would like to print label or invoice in bulk

3. Select print label/invoice and click on 'Submit' to proceed.

Question: How many times do I get freight invoices in a month?
Answer: We bill our customers twice in a month, therefore you would receive freight invoices at the mid and end of every month.
Answer_html: We bill our customers twice in a month, therefore you would receive freight invoices at the mid and end of every month.

Question: How to print eway bill number on the shipping label?
Answer: Eway Bill Number: Under GST Act, It is mandatory to enter Ewaybill number for shipping of goods from one place to another, either inter-state or intra-state and of value more than INR 50,000. You can easily enter your Eway bill number while creating a manual order in Shiprocket. To generate eway bill, please visit https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/Others/EBPrintnew.aspx     Note: The e-way bill number will be printed on the label and will be shared with the courier partner in the pick up API.
Answer_html:
Eway Bill Number: Under GST Act, It is mandatory to enter Ewaybill number for shipping of goods from one place to another, either inter-state or intra-state and of value more than INR 50,000. You can easily enter your Eway bill number while creating a manual order in Shiprocket. To generate eway bill, please visit https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/Others/EBPrintnew.aspx


Note: The e-way bill number will be printed on the label and will be shared with the courier partner in the pick up API.

Question: What happens if I don't pay my invoice?
Answer: If a Freight invoice is pending:     Here, we hold 1.5x of your COD remittance. We will transfer the pending remittance to your bank account as soon as you clear your invoice.      If a SaaS invoice is pending:     If your invoice is still overdue after the last date, you get 10 extra days to clear your invoice. After this, your account will be suspended. You can then downgrade to our Lite plan or renew your existing plan as required.        If you have any further query, you can call our customer support team at +91-9266623006.
Answer_html:
If a Freight invoice is pending:


Here, we hold 1.5x of your COD remittance. We will transfer the pending remittance to your bank account as soon as you clear your invoice. 


If a SaaS invoice is pending:


If your invoice is still overdue after the last date, you get 10 extra days to clear your invoice. After this, your account will be suspended. You can then downgrade to our Lite plan or renew your existing plan as required.  


If you have any further query, you can call our customer support team at +91-9266623006.

Question: How does a domestic shipping rate calculator work?
Answer: A domestic shipping rate calculator works by calculating the estimated cost of your shipment before shipping. You can calculate this cost by entering the pick-up and delivery pin codes along with the approximate weight of your shipment.      ShipRocket charges for the higher of the two weights, the actual weight and volumetric weight. We display rates for half a kilogram for most of our courier partners. Also, you can get an estimate of the cost, both with and without Cash On Delivery option.          For COD shipments, fixed COD charge or COD% of the order value whichever is higher will be taken while calculating the COD fee.          E.g. For a shipment weighing 0.5 Kg from New Delhi to Chennai, a courier partner charges a fee of Rs. 36 and COD % at 2.50%. Then the value of your shipments can be calculated as below-     Order Value   Rs. 750   COD % (2.5%)   Rs. 18.75   COD Fixed Charges  Volumetric Weight   Rs. 36  10x10x10/5000 = 0.02kg  *All Values shown are for illustration purpose only.           Hence, in this case, Shiprocket will charge COD fees of Rs. 36 apart from the collection of Rs. 750 at the time of delivery.  You can calculate the estimated cost to be charged on your domestic and international shipments, based on DIM (Dimensional weight) by logging into your Shiprocket Dashboard and locating the ‘Rate Calculator’ on the left panel.
Answer_html:
A domestic shipping rate calculator works by calculating the estimated cost of your shipment before shipping. You can calculate this cost by entering the pick-up and delivery pin codes along with the approximate weight of your shipment. 


ShipRocket charges for the higher of the two weights, the actual weight and volumetric weight. We display rates for half a kilogram for most of our courier partners. Also, you can get an estimate of the cost, both with and without Cash On Delivery option.



For COD shipments, fixed COD charge or COD% of the order value whichever is higher will be taken while calculating the COD fee.



E.g. For a shipment weighing 0.5 Kg from New Delhi to Chennai, a courier partner charges a fee of Rs. 36 and COD % at 2.50%. Then the value of your shipments can be calculated as below-


Order Value
Rs. 750
COD % (2.5%)
Rs. 18.75
COD Fixed Charges

Volumetric Weight
Rs. 36

10x10x10/5000 = 0.02kg
*All Values shown are for illustration purpose only.


Hence, in this case, Shiprocket will charge COD fees of Rs. 36 apart from the collection of Rs. 750 at the time of delivery.

You can calculate the estimated cost to be charged on your domestic and international shipments, based on DIM (Dimensional weight) by logging into your Shiprocket Dashboard and locating the ‘Rate Calculator’ on the left panel.

Question: What do we mean by shipment forward charges and  RTO charges?
Answer: Forward shipment and RTO charges are incurred on shipments, shipped through different courier partners.     Shipment forward charges: When an order is being delivered from seller to the customer’s address it is called a forward delivery and shipping charges incurred for the same shipment are called forward charges.     RTO backward charges: When a courier partner is unable to deliver the shipment to the end customer, it is marked as Return To Origin (RTO) i.e return the shipment back to the pickup address. The charges incurred for shipping the parcel back to the seller’s pick up address are called RTO backward charges.     To know about the details of forward and RTO charges for your shipments, you can refer to the rate calculator in the panel. To access the rate calculator-   Login to the Shiprocket panel  Go to Rate Calculator on the left panel
Answer_html:
Forward shipment and RTO charges are incurred on shipments, shipped through different courier partners.


Shipment forward charges: When an order is being delivered from seller to the customer’s address it is called a forward delivery and shipping charges incurred for the same shipment are called forward charges.


RTO backward charges: When a courier partner is unable to deliver the shipment to the end customer, it is marked as Return To Origin (RTO) i.e return the shipment back to the pickup address. The charges incurred for shipping the parcel back to the seller’s pick up address are called RTO backward charges.


To know about the details of forward and RTO charges for your shipments, you can refer to the rate calculator in the panel. To access the rate calculator-

  • Login to the Shiprocket panel
  • Go to Rate Calculator on the left panel

Question: Explaining shipping zones: How shipment zones affect order fulfillment and rates?
Answer: Courier companies have divided all serviceable pin codes into multiple shipping zones. Each shipping zone has multiple sets of pin codes and a definite definition. Your shipping metrics like Freight (Forward & RTO) Charges and Delivery Time depends on the shipping zone in which your selected pin codes falls.    How courier companies define shipping zones in Shiprocket:   Zone A (Within City) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same city.  Zone B (Within State/region) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same state/region.  Zone C (Metro to Metro) - If both Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in metro cities  Zone D (Rest of India) - If any or both pickup and delivery pin codes are in India. This excludes any pin code of North East region and J&K region.   Zone E - If one or both cities are in the North East region or in J&K.
Answer_html:
Courier companies have divided all serviceable pin codes into multiple shipping zones. Each shipping zone has multiple sets of pin codes and a definite definition. Your shipping metrics like Freight (Forward & RTO) Charges and Delivery Time depends on the shipping zone in which your selected pin codes falls. 


How courier companies define shipping zones in Shiprocket:


Zone A (Within City) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same city.

Zone B (Within State/region) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same state/region.

Zone C (Metro to Metro) - If both Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in metro cities

Zone D (Rest of India) - If any or both pickup and delivery pin codes are in India. This excludes any pin code of North East region and J&K region. 

Zone E - If one or both cities are in the North East region or in J&K.

Question: How does an international shipping rate calculator work?
Answer: An international shipping rate calculator works by calculating the cost of your shipments prior to shipping. You can calculate the cost incurred for shipping your orders across the world by entering the pick-up PIN code from India and delivery pin code of the destination country along with the approximate weight and dimensions of your shipment.     ShipRocket charges for the higher of the two weights out of approximate weight and volumetric weight. We display rates for half a kilogram for most of our courier partners.          You can view the cost charged on your domestic and international shipments, based on DIM (Dimensional weight) by logging into your ShipRocket Dashboard and locating the ‘Rate Calculator’ on the left panel.
Answer_html:
An international shipping rate calculator works by calculating the cost of your shipments prior to shipping. You can calculate the cost incurred for shipping your orders across the world by entering the pick-up PIN code from India and delivery pin code of the destination country along with the approximate weight and dimensions of your shipment.


ShipRocket charges for the higher of the two weights out of approximate weight and volumetric weight. We display rates for half a kilogram for most of our courier partners.



You can view the cost charged on your domestic and international shipments, based on DIM (Dimensional weight) by logging into your ShipRocket Dashboard and locating the ‘Rate Calculator’ on the left panel.

Question: My Bank Verification Got Failed. What Now?
Answer: After submission of details, Shiprocket team checks your entries within 24 - 48 business hours & approves or rejects your application based on what they find.     Here’s why your bank verification may have failed:      Your account number and ‘re-enter account number’ fields must match.    Make sure you select the correct account type as per your business.    Enter the correct IFSC code. In case you are unable to remember your IFSC details, please use the IFSC lookup option in the panel.    Your entered account number and IFSC must be the same as printed on the cancelled cheque.    Upload a clear photograph of your cancelled cheque.    In case you’re uploading the image of your passbook, please upload a picture which clearly shows your bank stamp and your photograph.      If your bank verification has failed because of the above reasons, we request you to submit your documents again. Our team will cross-check your details again and get back to you within 48 business hours.
Answer_html:
After submission of details, Shiprocket team checks your entries within 24 - 48 business hours & approves or rejects your application based on what they find.


Here’s why your bank verification may have failed:


  1. Your account number and ‘re-enter account number’ fields must match.

  2. Make sure you select the correct account type as per your business.

  3. Enter the correct IFSC code. In case you are unable to remember your IFSC details, please use the IFSC lookup option in the panel.

  4. Your entered account number and IFSC must be the same as printed on the cancelled cheque.

  5. Upload a clear photograph of your cancelled cheque.

  6. In case you’re uploading the image of your passbook, please upload a picture which clearly shows your bank stamp and your photograph. 



If your bank verification has failed because of the above reasons, we request you to submit your documents again. Our team will cross-check your details again and get back to you within 48 business hours.

Question: What is Order verification? How do I enable it for my account?
Answer: Order verification is a shipment setting that allows you to verify COD and Prepaid orders before shipping them. You should enable it for your account if;     - You want to have better control over your RTOs    - You are using the SRF warehouse as it gives you the ability to verify your orders before moving them to the warehouse.         Note: This setting is available for all Shiprocket plans.         How to enable it?     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Shipment Features.     2. Under Shipment Features, you'll find the "Order Verification" button.    3. Now, simply turn the toggle on to enable COD and Prepaid Order verification.         Note: You can verify your orders from the Process Orders screen:
Answer_html:
Order verification is a shipment setting that allows you to verify COD and Prepaid orders before shipping them. You should enable it for your account if;


- You want to have better control over your RTOs

- You are using the SRF warehouse as it gives you the ability to verify your orders before moving them to the warehouse. 



Note: This setting is available for all Shiprocket plans. 



How to enable it?


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Shipment Features.


2. Under Shipment Features, you'll find the "Order Verification" button.

3. Now, simply turn the toggle on to enable COD and Prepaid Order verification. 



Note: You can verify your orders from the Process Orders screen:

Question: How to add your customer care number in the shipping label?
Answer: You can now show your support or any alternate number in your shipping label. It will help your customers reach you directly in case they have any questions regarding their order. You can add this number to both new and existing pickup addresses. Here’s how you do it:  Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Pickup Address.  Go to Manage pick up addresses -> Add Pickup Address and add your alternate number.    For an existing pickup address, click on the edit button to add your alternate number.  Note: You have to repeat the process for all new and existing pickup addresses.
Answer_html:
You can now show your support or any alternate number in your shipping label. It will help your customers reach you directly in case they have any questions regarding their order. You can add this number to both new and existing pickup addresses. Here’s how you do it:

Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Pickup Address.

Go to Manage pick up addresses -> Add Pickup Address and add your alternate number.

For an existing pickup address, click on the edit button to add your alternate number.

Note: You have to repeat the process for all new and existing pickup addresses.

Question: How do I add multiple pickup addresses in the panel?
Answer: Yes, you can add multiple pickup addresses in the panel. Please follow the steps mentioned below to do so-      1. You can add multiple pickup addresses in the panel using the following steps-  1) Go to Settings→ Company from the left menu.  2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.  3) Towards the right you will find the option to ‘Add new pickup address’. Click on it and fill in your details.  4) In case you want to make it your default address, switch on the primary address toggle button.  2. To upload multiple pick up addresses in bulk  1) Go to Settings→ Company from the left menu.  2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.  3) Click on Upload file Icon and download the sample File from the pop-up.  4) Fill in the details as per the given format without making any changes/addition in the header.  5) Upload the file by clicking on the same icon.      NOTE: The location Id for each address is system generated and cannot be edited. Orders when assigned in bulk or individually, will be picked up from the primary address.     Steps to edit Pickup up address:     To edit a pickup address, please follow the steps mentioned below-  1) Go to Settings >> Pickup Address >> Manage Pickup Addresses.  2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.  3) You will find all your pickup addresses on the screen. Click on the edit icon beside a pickup address to change the pickup name and contact details.
Answer_html:
Yes, you can add multiple pickup addresses in the panel. Please follow the steps mentioned below to do so-


  • 1. You can add multiple pickup addresses in the panel using the following steps-
  • 1) Go to Settings→ Company from the left menu.
  • 2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.
  • 3) Towards the right you will find the option to ‘Add new pickup address’. Click on it and fill in your details.
  • 4) In case you want to make it your default address, switch on the primary address toggle button.
  • 2. To upload multiple pick up addresses in bulk
  • 1) Go to Settings→ Company from the left menu.
  • 2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.
  • 3) Click on Upload file Icon and download the sample File from the pop-up.
  • 4) Fill in the details as per the given format without making any changes/addition in the header.
  • 5) Upload the file by clicking on the same icon.


NOTE: The location Id for each address is system generated and cannot be edited. Orders when assigned in bulk or individually, will be picked up from the primary address.


Steps to edit Pickup up address:


To edit a pickup address, please follow the steps mentioned below-

1) Go to Settings >> Pickup Address >> Manage Pickup Addresses.

2) A new window of company information will open in front of you. Click on the Pickup address option on the screen.

3) You will find all your pickup addresses on the screen. Click on the edit icon beside a pickup address to change the pickup name and contact details.

Question: What is Courier Priority? What is the best way to set courier priority?
Answer: Your success begins with a strategy. That’s why it’s important to choose a courier partner which offers you the best deal. With our courier recommendation engine, you can choose the right courier partner based on cost, courier performance, and delivery performance. If you want us to decide, then choose the Recommended by Shiprocket option.    Want to set a custom courier priority?      These factors will help you choose the best fulfilment partner to surpass your customers’ expectations.    Coverage - How many pin codes does it cover?    Budget - What’s your per shipment budget?    Specialization - What are their areas of expertise? Modes of transport, return pickup, payment modes, years of experience, etc.     Speed - How much time they take to deliver a shipment?    Reviews - What real people say about their services?                 To set your courier priority, follow the steps below:     1. Go to the 'Settings' tab and click on 'Courier Priority'.  2. Here, you have five options. Choose one that best fits your needs. You can select the Best Rated, Cheapest, Fastest option, or go with Our Recommendation.      Similarly, you can also set your own custom courier priority. For this;     - Click on the 'Custom' option. This will open up all couriers for you. Simply, drag your favourite courier one by one and place them in the order of your preference.      3. Click on 'Ok' to finalize your priority.
Answer_html:
Your success begins with a strategy. That’s why it’s important to choose a courier partner which offers you the best deal. With our courier recommendation engine, you can choose the right courier partner based on cost, courier performance, and delivery performance. If you want us to decide, then choose the Recommended by Shiprocket option.

Want to set a custom courier priority? 


These factors will help you choose the best fulfilment partner to surpass your customers’ expectations.

  1. Coverage - How many pin codes does it cover?

  2. Budget - What’s your per shipment budget?

  3. Specialization - What are their areas of expertise? Modes of transport, return pickup, payment modes, years of experience, etc. 

  4. Speed - How much time they take to deliver a shipment?

  5. Reviews - What real people say about their services? 





To set your courier priority, follow the steps below:


1. Go to the 'Settings' tab and click on 'Courier Priority'.

2. Here, you have five options. Choose one that best fits your needs. You can select the Best Rated, Cheapest, Fastest option, or go with Our Recommendation. 


Similarly, you can also set your own custom courier priority. For this;


- Click on the 'Custom' option. This will open up all couriers for you. Simply, drag your favourite courier one by one and place them in the order of your preference. 


3. Click on 'Ok' to finalize your priority.

Question: Shiprocket: How to set courier rules?
Answer: It's a great feature for those who want to split their courier view based on specific conditions. Courier Rules feature is only available in Enterprise and higher plans.        To add a courier rule, please follow the steps below:      Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings.  Here, select Courier Rules from the Courier block.  Now click on the Add New Rule button to start adding your custom courier rules.  Enter a name for your new courier rule. It is just for your understanding.  Next, define your shipment conditions from the following:    Payment Mode  Weight  Zone Wise  Order Value  State  Pincode  City  Dangerous Goods  Product SKU  Channel ID   To add a shipment condition, simply select a condition from the drop-down and click on the '+' icon to add the specific condition.          Click on Proceed when you are happy with your conditions.     Note: Courier rules cannot be changed or deleted. If you are no longer using a courier rule, you can deactivate it.      Next, drag and set the couriers that you would like to see first when the previously added condition matches.           Finally, click on Save to proceed.
Answer_html:
It's a great feature for those who want to split their courier view based on specific conditions. Courier Rules feature is only available in Enterprise and higher plans.



To add a courier rule, please follow the steps below:


  1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings.
  2. Here, select Courier Rules from the Courier block.
  3. Now click on the Add New Rule button to start adding your custom courier rules.
  4. Enter a name for your new courier rule. It is just for your understanding.
  5. Next, define your shipment conditions from the following:
  • Payment Mode
  • Weight
  • Zone Wise
  • Order Value
  • State
  • Pincode
  • City
  • Dangerous Goods
  • Product SKU
  • Channel ID

To add a shipment condition, simply select a condition from the drop-down and click on the '+' icon to add the specific condition.



Click on Proceed when you are happy with your conditions.


Note: Courier rules cannot be changed or deleted. If you are no longer using a courier rule, you can deactivate it.


Next, drag and set the couriers that you would like to see first when the previously added condition matches.




Finally, click on Save to proceed.

Question: How Shiprocket works?
What is Shiprocket Early COD? Should I opt for it?
Answer: Online sellers in India largely depend on Cash-on-Delivery for purchases made from their website or through a marketplace. While everything about Cash-on-delivery orders is great, delayed payment makes business hard to grow.      Introducing, Shiprocket Early COD - Now, take control of your cash flow and receive payments with no hold      How does it work?     You get 3 different plans under Early COD:         Plan 1: Delivery + 2 Days     Opt for this plan if you wish to receive your COD payment within 2 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.99% of your total COD amount.      Plan 2: Delivery + 3 Days     This plan will get you your COD payment within 3 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.69% of your total COD amount.      Plan 3: Delivery + 4 Days     Get this plan to receive your COD payment within 4 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.49% of your total COD amount.         Please note: Once activated you cannot change or deactivate your plan for the next 30 days.         Why should I opt for it?     It's a great option if you want to take control of your money by receiving daily COD remittance.     There are more benefits as well:       With Early COD you get your remittance in 2-4 days of order delivery as compared to the standard remittance cycle of 9 days.     You get your COD remittance daily without any hold.    Improved cash flow ultimately helps your business grow better.          Read: Know how you can activate Early COD for your account
Answer_html:
Online sellers in India largely depend on Cash-on-Delivery for purchases made from their website or through a marketplace. While everything about Cash-on-delivery orders is great, delayed payment makes business hard to grow. 


Introducing, Shiprocket Early COD - Now, take control of your cash flow and receive payments with no hold



How does it work?


You get 3 different plans under Early COD:




Plan 1: Delivery + 2 Days


Opt for this plan if you wish to receive your COD payment within 2 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.99% of your total COD amount. 


Plan 2: Delivery + 3 Days


This plan will get you your COD payment within 3 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.69% of your total COD amount. 


Plan 3: Delivery + 4 Days


Get this plan to receive your COD payment within 4 days from the date of delivery. In this, we take a transaction charge of 0.49% of your total COD amount. 



Please note: Once activated you cannot change or deactivate your plan for the next 30 days. 



Why should I opt for it?


It's a great option if you want to take control of your money by receiving daily COD remittance.


There are more benefits as well:


  1. With Early COD you get your remittance in 2-4 days of order delivery as compared to the standard remittance cycle of 9 days. 

  2. You get your COD remittance daily without any hold.

  3. Improved cash flow ultimately helps your business grow better.



Read: Know how you can activate Early COD for your account

  5. Select your preferred plan and accept the T&C to activate Early COD for your account.

Question: What is Split Shipment? How do I enable it for my account?
Answer: In eCommerce, it's a common scenario to not have all SKU's at the same time or the same place. This results in late shipping and customers' dissatisfaction. By enabling "Split Shipment" for your account, you'll be able to:             1. Fulfill Orders partially based on the SKU's availability in your warehouse  2. Provide faster deliveries to your customers by reducing order processing time  3. Ship different products from different warehouses       How do I enable it?          1. Log in to your panel and go to "Company" settings.    2. Turn the toggle on to activate "split shipment" for your account.      Note: Split Shipment functionality only works for manual orders. We'll notify you as soon as we launch this for "Channel Orders" as well.       Feel free to reach out to us at support@shiprocket.in for any further assistance.
Answer_html:
In eCommerce, it's a common scenario to not have all SKU's at the same time or the same place. This results in late shipping and customers' dissatisfaction. By enabling "Split Shipment" for your account, you'll be able to:




1. Fulfill Orders partially based on the SKU's availability in your warehouse

2. Provide faster deliveries to your customers by reducing order processing time

3. Ship different products from different warehouses


How do I enable it?



1. Log in to your panel and go to "Company" settings.

2. Turn the toggle on to activate "split shipment" for your account.



Note: Split Shipment functionality only works for manual orders. We'll notify you as soon as we launch this for "Channel Orders" as well. 



Feel free to reach out to us at support@shiprocket.in for any further assistance.

Question: What is Multi Packet Shipment?
Answer: We now allow you to ship an order in more than one package under a single AWB number. Enable "Multi Packet Shipment" to reduce the stress of shipping and tracking several small packages.     Important: A single order can have a maximum of 5 items or 30kg weight. The order will have one Master AWB or tracking number which will help your track all items of that order.           Note: In order to activate this functionality for your account, please raise a request with your dedicated Key Account Manager. You can also drop an email at support@shiprocket.in. Thanks.
Answer_html:
We now allow you to ship an order in more than one package under a single AWB number. Enable "Multi Packet Shipment" to reduce the stress of shipping and tracking several small packages.


Important: A single order can have a maximum of 5 items or 30kg weight. The order will have one Master AWB or tracking number which will help your track all items of that order. 



Note: In order to activate this functionality for your account, please raise a request with your dedicated Key Account Manager. You can also drop an email at support@shiprocket.in. Thanks.

Over 50,000 sellers including WhatsApp, Instagram sellers, SMB brands, or even large enterprises trust us to ship their products. We provide a single platform to our sellers for shipping, order management, order tracking, NDR management, etc.

Question: Which products are prohibited/dangerous to ship via Shiprocket?
Answer: Dangerous Goods are items that may endanger the safety of an aircraft or persons on board it as there are potential adverse effects of temperature, pressure and humidity variations. When DG goods are shipped by air, they are also vulnerable to damage due to vibrations and improper handling. At Shiprocket, shipments that come under the category of 'Dangerous Goods' can only be shipped via Surface Mode.
Answer_html: Dangerous Goods are items that may endanger the safety of an aircraft or persons on board it as there are potential adverse effects of temperature, pressure and humidity variations. When DG goods are shipped by air, they are also vulnerable to damage due to vibrations and improper handling. At Shiprocket, shipments that come under the category of 'Dangerous Goods' can only be shipped via Surface Mode.

Question: How to raise a complaint for delivery delay?
Answer: In case the EDD (Estimated delivery date) is crossed and shipment is still not delivered, we request you to raise the issue to our logistic operations team via expedite delivery option.        If an order crosses the EDD, an escalate button gets activated under the expedite delivery column in the Shipments >>> Track Tab.        You can click on this escalate button to raise a concern for delayed delivery. Once you click ‘Escalate’, you will get a pop-up stating that your concern has been escalated to the team.          Upon receiving the request, we will get the delivery expedited by connecting to the concerned logistics partner.    To view the action taken on the complaint, Click on ‘Show History’
Answer_html:
In case the EDD (Estimated delivery date) is crossed and shipment is still not delivered, we request you to raise the issue to our logistic operations team via expedite delivery option. 


  1. If an order crosses the EDD, an escalate button gets activated under the expedite delivery column in the Shipments >>> Track Tab.



  2. You can click on this escalate button to raise a concern for delayed delivery. Once you click ‘Escalate’, you will get a pop-up stating that your concern has been escalated to the team.





  3. Upon receiving the request, we will get the delivery expedited by connecting to the concerned logistics partner.

  4. To view the action taken on the complaint, Click on ‘Show History’

Question: Can I change the delivery date for my order?
Answer: You can only change the delivery date of your shipment, in case it is undelivered (NDR status) due to some reason.      You can select the delivery date within 7 days since your order was marked undelivered and it can be done at the NDR Panel and the customizable tracking page.   To change the delivery date of your undelivered order from the NDR Panel-      Go to Rate Calculator--> NDR  Click on the Re-attempt button
Answer_html:
You can only change the delivery date of your shipment, in case it is undelivered (NDR status) due to some reason. 


You can select the delivery date within 7 days since your order was marked undelivered and it can be done at the NDR Panel and the customizable tracking page. 

To change the delivery date of your undelivered order from the NDR Panel-


  • Go to Rate Calculator--> NDR
  • Click on the Re-attempt button

Question: What do you mean by the expected delivery date?
Answer: Expected delivery date is the tentative date by which your order will reach your customer's doorstep. It is visible on the customized tracking page sent to the customer.
Answer_html: Expected delivery date is the tentative date by which your order will reach your customer's doorstep. It is visible on the customized tracking page sent to the customer.

Question: How to download POD for my order?
Answer: What is POD?     Proof of Delivery or POD is an important part of the logistics process as it determines the delivery of the package to the customer.      How to download POD?     POD is only available in two statuses: Delivered and RTO Delivered        To download, you first need to raise a request from the panel by following the steps below:      1. Go to the "Orders" tab from the left menu and click on "All Orders"    2. Select Delivered/RTO Delivered from the order status filter  3. Click on the "Request POD" icon as shown in the image below:          4. Once you raise the request, it will be available in the next 3-5 business days. You can download the POD from your registered email id, or by following the same steps.     please refer to the image shown below:          Important: Please request for POD before 7 days of the delivered/RTO delivered status of your shipment.
Answer_html:
What is POD?


Proof of Delivery or POD is an important part of the logistics process as it determines the delivery of the package to the customer. 


How to download POD?


POD is only available in two statuses: Delivered and RTO Delivered



To download, you first need to raise a request from the panel by following the steps below: 
 
1. Go to the "Orders" tab from the left menu and click on "All Orders"

2. Select Delivered/RTO Delivered from the order status filter

3. Click on the "Request POD" icon as shown in the image below:



4. Once you raise the request, it will be available in the next 3-5 business days. You can download the POD from your registered email id, or by following the same steps.


please refer to the image shown below:



Important: Please request for POD before 7 days of the delivered/RTO delivered status of your shipment.

Question: How to raise an escalation against a fake POD?
Answer: POD or Proof of Delivery is an essential document of eCommerce deliveries. However, sometimes couriers share incomplete or invalid PODs that could hamper the validation of customer response. You can now raise an escalation against a POD that is incomplete as per your business needs.      Here is how you can raise an escalation for an updated POD:     1. Go to Orders from the left menu and click on "All Orders"  2. From the filters, select your order for which you want to raise an escalation  3. You'll find a "Raise POD Dispute" button under the POD Details column        4. Click on it to open a pop up where you can select the reason for raising a dispute. We recommend you upload a file if you have received a fake or empty POD.            5. Submit your request.     Note: You can raise a POD dispute within 3 days of receiving the POD.        We’ll share your concern with the courier partner and arrange an updated POD for your shipment.
Answer_html:
POD or Proof of Delivery is an essential document of eCommerce deliveries. However, sometimes couriers share incomplete or invalid PODs that could hamper the validation of customer response. You can now raise an escalation against a POD that is incomplete as per your business needs. 


Here is how you can raise an escalation for an updated POD:


1. Go to Orders from the left menu and click on "All Orders"

2. From the filters, select your order for which you want to raise an escalation

3. You'll find a "Raise POD Dispute" button under the POD Details column



4. Click on it to open a pop up where you can select the reason for raising a dispute. We recommend you upload a file if you have received a fake or empty POD. 




5. Submit your request.


Note: You can raise a POD dispute within 3 days of receiving the POD.



We’ll share your concern with the courier partner and arrange an updated POD for your shipment.

Question: Do you offer shipment security? Is there any maximum coverage amount?
Answer: Yes, Shiprocket offers shipment security to its customers. All domestic shipments are secured up to an amount of Rs 5000.
Answer_html: Yes, Shiprocket offers shipment security to its customers. All domestic shipments are secured up to an amount of Rs 5000.

Question: What documents are required for International shipping?
Answer: You need an IE code for shipping your orders internationally.      Import Export Code (also known as IEC) is a 10 digit identification number that is issued by the DGFT (Director General of Foreign Trade), Department of Commerce, Government of India. It is also known as Importer Exporter Code. It is mandatory for companies and businesses to obtain this code to start a business that deals with import and export in the Indian Territory. It is not possible to deal with export or import business without this code.     You can get it from the nearest zonal or regional office.     To know more about IE code, read our detailed guide here
Answer_html:
You need an IE code for shipping your orders internationally. 


Import Export Code (also known as IEC) is a 10 digit identification number that is issued by the DGFT (Director General of Foreign Trade), Department of Commerce, Government of India. It is also known as Importer Exporter Code. It is mandatory for companies and businesses to obtain this code to start a business that deals with import and export in the Indian Territory. It is not possible to deal with export or import business without this code.


You can get it from the nearest zonal or regional office.


To know more about IE code, read our detailed guide here

Question: How can I check if an international pincode is serviceable?
Answer: To check the serviceability of an international PIN code-      Click on the “Settings” option from the left panel and go to the ‘International’ tab. You will then be taken to the International process page where you can see the process of the international shipment.  If you've uploaded your International shipping documents, you will be able to see the process of International shipment here. Uploading documents is a one-time process.  Once the documents are uploaded, you will receive the access from this page to the International Details page.  The target pin code should match with the serviceable list of pin codes of the courier companies we have for international shipment.  You should follow this check each time you come on to the process page until international shipping is activated.  If the pin code is not serviceable, then a popup will appear saying that your pin code is not serviceable by the courier company. The upload button will be disabled, as shown in the image below.
Answer_html:
To check the serviceability of an international PIN code-


  • Click on the “Settings” option from the left panel and go to the ‘International’ tab. You will then be taken to the International process page where you can see the process of the international shipment.
  • If you've uploaded your International shipping documents, you will be able to see the process of International shipment here. Uploading documents is a one-time process.
  • Once the documents are uploaded, you will receive the access from this page to the International Details page.
  • The target pin code should match with the serviceable list of pin codes of the courier companies we have for international shipment.
  • You should follow this check each time you come on to the process page until international shipping is activated.
  • If the pin code is not serviceable, then a popup will appear saying that your pin code is not serviceable by the courier company. The upload button will be disabled, as shown in the image below.

Question: How many days it take to complete and verify the whole international documentation process?

Question: How to add product recommendations on Tracking Page?
Answer: The branded tracking page provided by Shiprocket is an effective tool for easy shipment tracking. To promote your brand and involve customers after the sale, you can add product recommendations to the branded tracking page. With the help of Shiprocket's product recommendations, you may present Best Sellers, Trending, Newest, or Custom Products and boost sales.     Step 1: Go to Buyer Experience from the left Menu.  Step 2: Click on Tracking Page  Step 3: Click on product recommendations  Step 4: Click on add carousel button  Step 5: Select a channel  Step 6: Select a recommendation type. You can choose any of the following recommendation types:    Best sellers: Shows products which has the maximum number of sales in last 30 days    Trending: Shows products which has the maximum number of sales in last 15 days     Newest: Shows products which has been added to your catalog recently    Custom: Search and select any products you want to add from your catalog.    Step 7: Add a section name to your carousel for eg. What’s New, You might also like etc.  Step 8: Choose the number of products for your carouse. You can show a minimum of 2 products and add up to 8 products.  Step 9: Check the carousel preview and click save.     Note: If you don’t want the product price to be shown on the tracking page. You can enable the hide product price toggle button.
Answer_html:
The branded tracking page provided by Shiprocket is an effective tool for easy shipment tracking. To promote your brand and involve customers after the sale, you can add product recommendations to the branded tracking page. With the help of Shiprocket's product recommendations, you may present Best Sellers, Trending, Newest, or Custom Products and boost sales.


Step 1: Go to Buyer Experience from the left Menu.

Step 2: Click on Tracking Page

Step 3: Click on product recommendations

Step 4: Click on add carousel button

Step 5: Select a channel

Step 6: Select a recommendation type. You can choose any of the following recommendation types:

  • Best sellers: Shows products which has the maximum number of sales in last 30 days

  • Trending: Shows products which has the maximum number of sales in last 15 days 

  • Newest: Shows products which has been added to your catalog recently

  • Custom: Search and select any products you want to add from your catalog.

Step 7: Add a section name to your carousel for eg. What’s New, You might also like etc.

Step 8: Choose the number of products for your carouse. You can show a minimum of 2 products and add up to 8 products.

Step 9: Check the carousel preview and click save.


Note: If you don’t want the product price to be shown on the tracking page. You can enable the hide product price toggle button.

Question: What is NPS?
Answer: Net Promoter Score (NPS) is a customer satisfaction index that measures the willingness of customers to recommend your products or services to others.     How do we calculate:   We subtract the percentage of detractors from the percentage of promoters to find out your Net Promoter Score.         This is where your buyers can rate you:
Answer_html:
Net Promoter Score (NPS) is a customer satisfaction index that measures the willingness of customers to recommend your products or services to others.

 

How do we calculate: 

We subtract the percentage of detractors from the percentage of promoters to find out your Net Promoter Score. 

 

 

This is where your buyers can rate you:

Question: How can I check my NPS report?
Answer: On your panel, Go to Buyer experience → tracking page → NPS score     Here, You can check total promoters (in green), passives (in yellow), detractors (in red)  You can also get a detailed view of customer details, their score & their remarks and also download the report to get the full data.
Answer_html:
On your panel, Go to Buyer experience → tracking page → NPS score


Here, You can check total promoters (in green), passives (in yellow), detractors (in red)

You can also get a detailed view of customer details, their score & their remarks and also download the report to get the full data.
