Question: How do I enable ‘Returns’ on my Post Ship tracking page?
Answer: Shiprocket sellers can now accept returns for their products directly from their Post Ship tracking page.     How to set up your own tracking page?       Setup your returns page       Go to the Settings page from the left menu and select Return Settings.             Customize your returns page       First, turn the toggle on if you wish to allow ‘returns’ on your tracking page.       Next, select the number of days for which you allow return on your products. This can be any no. from 1 to 30.          Now, please turn the toggle on if you allow ‘return’ on all your products.          Similarly, you can turn off the toggle if you do not allow return on all your products. In this case, you will be required to upload a list of SKUs for which return is not applicable.          Please verify all the details and click on ‘Submit’.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket sellers can now accept returns for their products directly from their Post Ship tracking page.


How to set up your own tracking page?


  1. Setup your returns page


Go to the Settings page from the left menu and select Return Settings.




  1. Customize your returns page


First, turn the toggle on if you wish to allow ‘returns’ on your tracking page.


Next, select the number of days for which you allow return on your products. This can be any no. from 1 to 30.



Now, please turn the toggle on if you allow ‘return’ on all your products.



Similarly, you can turn off the toggle if you do not allow return on all your products. In this case, you will be required to upload a list of SKUs for which return is not applicable.



Please verify all the details and click on ‘Submit’.

Question: How to activate “refund” on my post ship tracking page?
Answer: The new refund option is an advancement and a final step in our already existing return flow. It facilitates you to capture your customers' refund preferences i.e. refund to the wallet, refund to source account, or directly refund in their bank account. This module will help you optimize your customers' return experience by making the whole process seamless and hasslefree.     Please follow the instructions below to set up refunds:       Go to the Settings page from the left menu and select Return Settings.      Turn the toggle ON if you allow refunds on your COD orders. Please note this step will enable your customers to enter their bank account details at the time of placing a return request.       Next, turn the toggle ON for your Prepaid orders. Choose the mode of refund for your returns:               Allow opt-in for your store credits    Allow customers to opt-in for a refund to the source payment mode    Allow customers to leave bank account details for manual processing      Once done, click “Submit” to proceed.
Answer_html:
The new refund option is an advancement and a final step in our already existing return flow. It facilitates you to capture your customers' refund preferences i.e. refund to the wallet, refund to source account, or directly refund in their bank account. This module will help you optimize your customers' return experience by making the whole process seamless and hasslefree.


Please follow the instructions below to set up refunds:


  1. Go to the Settings page from the left menu and select Return Settings.

  2. Turn the toggle ON if you allow refunds on your COD orders. Please note this step will enable your customers to enter their bank account details at the time of placing a return request.


  3. Next, turn the toggle ON for your Prepaid orders. Choose the mode of refund for your returns:




  • Allow opt-in for your store credits

  • Allow customers to opt-in for a refund to the source payment mode

  • Allow customers to leave bank account details for manual processing

Once done, click “Submit” to proceed.

Question: How to enable QC functionality for my return orders?
Answer: Recently, Shiprocket has launched a new functionality for sellers who want to have a quality examination of the product provided by the customer at the time of pickup.     Why is it beneficial for you?     - It reduces the effort of quality examination of products at your end.   - It verifies that the product is unused and in good condition. Thus, saves you from losing freight charges and product cost too.   - It saves you from spending several hours on return product approval.           How to enable QC for your return orders?     A. From Post Ship tracking page     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and click on "Post Ship" from the left menu.     2. Here, click on the "Returns" tab.          3. On the next page, turn the toggle on if you want to enable QC functionality for your return orders.          4. Click on Submit to save your preference.         B. Enable it while creating a new return order     This option is beneficial for those who do not want to enable QC for all return orders. Please follow the steps below to know how to enable QC for specific return order:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go Returns from the left menu.  2. Click on "Add Return" to create a new return order.  3. Enter the required details. At the "Quality Check" step, tick the box if you want a quality examination of the product provided by your customer at the time of pickup.  5. Enter the remaining steps and click on "Add Return Order" to proceed.        Note: After enabling quality check on your return orders, you'll only see QC couriers at the time of return initiation.
Answer_html:
Recently, Shiprocket has launched a new functionality for sellers who want to have a quality examination of the product provided by the customer at the time of pickup.


Why is it beneficial for you?


- It reduces the effort of quality examination of products at your end. 

- It verifies that the product is unused and in good condition. Thus, saves you from losing freight charges and product cost too. 

- It saves you from spending several hours on return product approval.




How to enable QC for your return orders?


A. From Post Ship tracking page


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and click on "Post Ship" from the left menu.


2. Here, click on the "Returns" tab.



3. On the next page, turn the toggle on if you want to enable QC functionality for your return orders.



4. Click on Submit to save your preference. 



B. Enable it while creating a new return order


This option is beneficial for those who do not want to enable QC for all return orders. Please follow the steps below to know how to enable QC for specific return order:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go Returns from the left menu.

2. Click on "Add Return" to create a new return order.

3. Enter the required details. At the "Quality Check" step, tick the box if you want a quality examination of the product provided by your customer at the time of pickup.

5. Enter the remaining steps and click on "Add Return Order" to proceed.



Note: After enabling quality check on your return orders, you'll only see QC couriers at the time of return initiation.

Question: What are the criteria of Quality Examination for return shipments?
Answer: As of now, we do not provide any specific criteria but the courier will check the product as per the SOP for both serialized and non-serialized products. However, if you choose Delivery QC as your courier partner, they will examine the product on certain criteria such as brand, color, IMEI number, etc.
Answer_html: As of now, we do not provide any specific criteria but the courier will check the product as per the SOP for both serialized and non-serialized products. However, if you choose Delivery QC as your courier partner, they will examine the product on certain criteria such as brand, color, IMEI number, etc.

Question: How to Process an NDR?
Answer: When an NDR raised on the panel, you have two options to process it:     1. Opt for a Reattempt  2. Opt for RTO (Return to Origin)          1. When you opt for 'Reattempt'        CASE A:     The reason given by the courier company is incorrect:          In this case, please choose one of the options below to provide more information:        a) Upload an audio conversation with your buyer -  Get a verbal confirmation from your buyer where the buyer is requesting for the delivery reattempt.    b) Upload a screenshot of your conversation with your buyer - Get a written confirmation from your buyer via Whatsapp or SMS where your buyer is requesting for the delivery reattempt.    c) Send SMS via Shiprocket - On opting this, we'll send an SMS to receive a delivery reattempt request from your buyer. Your buyer can also opt to update his/her contact details or address using this link.  d) Get a missed call from your buyer - Get a missed call from your buyer's registered mobile number on the displayed phone number. We will consider this "missed call" as a reattempt verification response.         Finally, submit your response.            CASE B:     The reason given by the Courier company is correct:          In this case, you can update the buyer details such as an address, and contact number. Please select the reattempt date before clicking on 'Reattempt'.     Note: Below details are mandatory in case:     a) Customer not contactable: Kindly provide us with an active number on which the courier can contact your buyer.  b) Wrong/Incomplete Address: Please enter the correct/complete address here. You should also provide a landmark in this case.  c) Customer asked for future delivery: Please provide a specific date for delivery by selecting it from the calendar.     2. When you opt for 'RTO'     In this case, your order will be returned to the original pickup location. You can also add remarks if you have any.              Please Note: Courier partners only make 3 attempts to deliver your order to the end customer post which they will mark your order as RTO.
Answer_html:
When an NDR raised on the panel, you have two options to process it:


1. Opt for a Reattempt

2. Opt for RTO (Return to Origin)



1. When you opt for 'Reattempt'



CASE A:


The reason given by the courier company is incorrect:



In this case, please choose one of the options below to provide more information:



a) Upload an audio conversation with your buyer -  Get a verbal confirmation from your buyer where the buyer is requesting for the delivery reattempt.

b) Upload a screenshot of your conversation with your buyer - Get a written confirmation from your buyer via Whatsapp or SMS where your buyer is requesting for the delivery reattempt.

c) Send SMS via Shiprocket - On opting this, we'll send an SMS to receive a delivery reattempt request from your buyer. Your buyer can also opt to update his/her contact details or address using this link.

d) Get a missed call from your buyer - Get a missed call from your buyer's registered mobile number on the displayed phone number. We will consider this "missed call" as a reattempt verification response. 



Finally, submit your response. 




CASE B:


The reason given by the Courier company is correct:



In this case, you can update the buyer details such as an address, and contact number. Please select the reattempt date before clicking on 'Reattempt'.


Note: Below details are mandatory in case:


a) Customer not contactable: Kindly provide us with an active number on which the courier can contact your buyer.

b) Wrong/Incomplete Address: Please enter the correct/complete address here. You should also provide a landmark in this case.

c) Customer asked for future delivery: Please provide a specific date for delivery by selecting it from the calendar.


2. When you opt for 'RTO'


In this case, your order will be returned to the original pickup location. You can also add remarks if you have any. 




Please Note: Courier partners only make 3 attempts to deliver your order to the end customer post which they will mark your order as RTO.

Question: What is the process time for NDR?
Answer: We request you to take action on your NDR shipments at the earliest or within 24 hours. It will help in forwarding your information to the courier in real-time, which will result in faster response time.     Case 1: No one takes an action     Here, we will try to take action on the seller’s behalf and request the courier partner to reattempt the delivery.     Case 2: Second attempt fails     Here, the order will again come in the NDR panel where a seller can take an action over it. If we receive none action, we will again try to request the courier partner for a re-attempt. However, the reattempt depends on the courier partner.     Case 3: Buyer does not want the order     Let’s suppose a buyer said no to his/her order at the time of delivery. Here, the order will again come in the NDR panel where a seller can take an action over it.
Answer_html:
We request you to take action on your NDR shipments at the earliest or within 24 hours. It will help in forwarding your information to the courier in real-time, which will result in faster response time.


Case 1: No one takes an action


Here, we will try to take action on the seller’s behalf and request the courier partner to reattempt the delivery.


Case 2: Second attempt fails


Here, the order will again come in the NDR panel where a seller can take an action over it. If we receive none action, we will again try to request the courier partner for a re-attempt. However, the reattempt depends on the courier partner.


Case 3: Buyer does not want the order


Let’s suppose a buyer said no to his/her order at the time of delivery. Here, the order will again come in the NDR panel where a seller can take an action over it.

Question: How to escalate my NDR reattempt request?
Answer: If you want to escalate your NDR reattempt request, please follow the steps below:     1. Log in to your account and go to "Shipments" from the left menu bar.  2. Now, click on Process NDR.  3. Here, under the "Action Required" tab, you will find an "Escalate" button against your undelivered AWB.     Please refer to the image below:        4. Go ahead and click on the Escalate button.   5. A pop up will open on your screen, where if you want you can attach any proof in the form of call recording, or chat screenshots.      Important: Proofs are not mandatory at the time of escalation. However, it is advisable to always escalate your reattempt request with valid proof.      Please refer to the image below:       5. Finally, click on the submit button to proceed with your escalation.         Important Points to Remember:     1. Proofs are not mandatory at the time of escalation. However, it is advisable to always escalate your reattempt request with valid proofs to increase the chances of delivery.   2. You have 6 attempts to escalate/re-escalate an NDR reattempt request.   3. If you experience a delay in getting a response, please use the re-escalate button to escalate your NDR request.
Answer_html:
If you want to escalate your NDR reattempt request, please follow the steps below:


1. Log in to your account and go to "Shipments" from the left menu bar.

2. Now, click on Process NDR.

3. Here, under the "Action Required" tab, you will find an "Escalate" button against your undelivered AWB.


Please refer to the image below:



4. Go ahead and click on the Escalate button. 

5. A pop up will open on your screen, where if you want you can attach any proof in the form of call recording, or chat screenshots. 


Important: Proofs are not mandatory at the time of escalation. However, it is advisable to always escalate your reattempt request with valid proof. 


Please refer to the image below:


5. Finally, click on the submit button to proceed with your escalation. 



Important Points to Remember:


1. Proofs are not mandatory at the time of escalation. However, it is advisable to always escalate your reattempt request with valid proofs to increase the chances of delivery. 

2. You have 6 attempts to escalate/re-escalate an NDR reattempt request. 

3. If you experience a delay in getting a response, please use the re-escalate button to escalate your NDR request.

Question: How many attempts will be made by the courier company to deliver my order?
Answer: We provide a maximum of three attempts to deliver your order. However, it also depends on the selected courier partner and NDR reason. In general, most courier partners make three attempts before the order is marked RTO. However, few couriers mark RTO after the 1st attempt.
Answer_html: We provide a maximum of three attempts to deliver your order. However, it also depends on the selected courier partner and NDR reason. In general, most courier partners make three attempts before the order is marked RTO. However, few couriers mark RTO after the 1st attempt.

Question: How long does it take for an action to be implemented on my undelivered shipment?
Answer: Generally, courier takes action within 24 to 48 hours on your undelivered shipment.
Answer_html: Generally, courier takes action within 24 to 48 hours on your undelivered shipment.

Question: How does the Contact Buyer functionality work?
Answer: You can now contact your buyer directly from your Shiprocket account to ask if they want a reattempt for their undelivered order or not. You can also use this opportunity to learn why the customer has denied the delivery in the first place. Follow the steps below to know how to make this call:     a) Go to Shipments from your left-menu and click on Process NDR.     b) Here, you can see all undelivered orders where an action is pending.     c) Select the order for which you want to contact your buyer. Click on the action icon and select the Contact Buyer option.          d) Click on Initiate Call to receive a call on your registered mobile number.             e) As soon as you pick the phone, we will connect your call to your buyer.      f) Once completed, you will be able to see the call history in the NDR history section.      g) Next, click on the Reattempt button to send a request to the concerned courier partner. No need to attach any proof here as we will consider your call history for the same.         Important points to remember:       Please note you will be able to make one successful call in each NDR attempt.    Disable DND services on your network to connect this call
Answer_html:
You can now contact your buyer directly from your Shiprocket account to ask if they want a reattempt for their undelivered order or not. You can also use this opportunity to learn why the customer has denied the delivery in the first place. Follow the steps below to know how to make this call:


a) Go to Shipments from your left-menu and click on Process NDR.


b) Here, you can see all undelivered orders where an action is pending.


c) Select the order for which you want to contact your buyer. Click on the action icon and select the Contact Buyer option.



d) Click on Initiate Call to receive a call on your registered mobile number. 



e) As soon as you pick the phone, we will connect your call to your buyer.


f) Once completed, you will be able to see the call history in the NDR history section. 


g) Next, click on the Reattempt button to send a request to the concerned courier partner. No need to attach any proof here as we will consider your call history for the same. 



Important points to remember:


  1. Please note you will be able to make one successful call in each NDR attempt.

  2. Disable DND services on your network to connect this call

Question: What is NDR Buyer Flow?
Answer: NDR Buyer Flow is an automated service that helps you achieve maximum delivery success rate. There could be multiple reasons behind an undelivered order. Some of them are:  - Buyer is not contactable  - The delivery address is not reachable/closed  - Customer refused delivery  - COD amount was not ready at the time of delivery  - Customer asked for future delivery  - Customer not available, and more.     On activation of NDR Buyer Flow, your buyer receives an IVR call from Shiprocket requesting them for their feedback and response in real-time. With this, we also send an automated SMS with a form to your buyer, where we ask them if the courier's response is right. They can also correct their delivery address and contact details here if required.     The form looks something like this:             How to activate NDR Buyer Flow?     To activate NDR Buyer Flow, go to;     1. Your Shiprocket panel and click on Shipments --> Process NDR     2. Here, click on the "Activate NDR Buyer Flow" button on your top-right corner.          3. On clicking, a pop up will open. To activate NDR Buyer flow for your account, simply click on "Activate".           Here you go, activate and witness a decrease in your RTOs for yourself.
Answer_html:
NDR Buyer Flow is an automated service that helps you achieve maximum delivery success rate. There could be multiple reasons behind an undelivered order. Some of them are:

- Buyer is not contactable

- The delivery address is not reachable/closed

- Customer refused delivery

- COD amount was not ready at the time of delivery

- Customer asked for future delivery

- Customer not available, and more.


On activation of NDR Buyer Flow, your buyer receives an IVR call from Shiprocket requesting them for their feedback and response in real-time. With this, we also send an automated SMS with a form to your buyer, where we ask them if the courier's response is right. They can also correct their delivery address and contact details here if required.


The form looks something like this:




How to activate NDR Buyer Flow?


To activate NDR Buyer Flow, go to;


1. Your Shiprocket panel and click on Shipments --> Process NDR


2. Here, click on the "Activate NDR Buyer Flow" button on your top-right corner.



3. On clicking, a pop up will open. To activate NDR Buyer flow for your account, simply click on "Activate". 



Here you go, activate and witness a decrease in your RTOs for yourself.

Question: What is Shiprocket Fulfillment?
Answer: Shiprocket Fulfillment is a service that provides storage, packaging, and shipping assistance to sellers. There are various benefits of having a warehouse integrated with your shipping platform:        A single place to manage everything - It helps you manage all your logistics processes, including inventory management, packaging, order fulfilment, returns, etc.          Better organization of inventory - We regularly monitor and track your inventory to make sure it's accurate and is placed at the right picking location. Whenever a movement happens, our system automatically updates the current inventory count, making the whole process seamless and error-free.          A stress-free shipping experience - It's hard to focus on anything when there are too many things on your plate. Reduce your stress by delegating the most stressful steps of eCommerce to us.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket Fulfillment is a service that provides storage, packaging, and shipping assistance to sellers. There are various benefits of having a warehouse integrated with your shipping platform: 


  1. A single place to manage everything - It helps you manage all your logistics processes, including inventory management, packaging, order fulfilment, returns, etc. 


  1. Better organization of inventory - We regularly monitor and track your inventory to make sure it's accurate and is placed at the right picking location. Whenever a movement happens, our system automatically updates the current inventory count, making the whole process seamless and error-free. 


  1. A stress-free shipping experience - It's hard to focus on anything when there are too many things on your plate. Reduce your stress by delegating the most stressful steps of eCommerce to us.

Question: How does SRF work?
Answer: An overview of how Shiprocket Fulfillment works:       Start by registering yourself for Shiprocket Fulfillment       a) First, create a Shiprocket account. In case you already have one, log in to your account.      b) Next, you need to fill the below documents to complete your registration for SRF:     1. Warehouse state's GST registration  2. Shiprocket-Seller Agreement  3. Additional place of business registration  4. Meteorology certificate for selected products     c) Post-approval, we'll mark our warehouse as your primary pickup address.       Drop your products at our warehouse       a) Now, create a consignment and drop your products at our warehouse.     b) Once received, we'll conduct a quality check based on your set preferences. If passed, we'll store the products in our warehouse.        Shipping and Order Management by SRF       Now, whenever you get an order, SRF will pack and deliver it to your buyers.
Answer_html:
An overview of how Shiprocket Fulfillment works:


  • Start by registering yourself for Shiprocket Fulfillment


a) First, create a Shiprocket account. In case you already have one, log in to your account. 


b) Next, you need to fill the below documents to complete your registration for SRF:


1. Warehouse state's GST registration

2. Shiprocket-Seller Agreement

3. Additional place of business registration

4. Meteorology certificate for selected products


c) Post-approval, we'll mark our warehouse as your primary pickup address.


  • Drop your products at our warehouse


a) Now, create a consignment and drop your products at our warehouse.


b) Once received, we'll conduct a quality check based on your set preferences. If passed, we'll store the products in our warehouse. 


  • Shipping and Order Management by SRF


Now, whenever you get an order, SRF will pack and deliver it to your buyers.

Question: How do you add products to your Shiprocket Fulfillment Account?
Answer: To add your products to Shiprocket, simply follow the steps below:       Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.     Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Products" from the drop-down menu.        3. Download the sample sheet and remove the sample data and add your own product data before uploading the sheet.    4. Finally, upload the file and then click Finish to proceed.         Note: You can also add HSN code for each product using this file.
Answer_html:
To add your products to Shiprocket, simply follow the steps below:


  1. Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.

  2. Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Products" from the drop-down menu.


3. Download the sample sheet and remove the sample data and add your own product data before uploading the sheet. 

4. Finally, upload the file and then click Finish to proceed. 



Note: You can also add HSN code for each product using this file.

Download and Print Barcode

Question: What is GRN?
Answer: GRN or Goods Received Note is a record that confirms the receiving of goods at the warehouse. It's a process where we allot a unique number to each receiving after comparing them with the respective ASN.     By clicking on the ASN ID in the SR dashboard QC Passed and Fail can be viewed for each SKU.     A GRN ID will be allotted to the respective ASN and the same will be visible in the dashboard.
Answer_html:
GRN or Goods Received Note is a record that confirms the receiving of goods at the warehouse. It's a process where we allot a unique number to each receiving after comparing them with the respective ASN.


By clicking on the ASN ID in the SR dashboard QC Passed and Fail can be viewed for each SKU.


A GRN ID will be allotted to the respective ASN and the same will be visible in the dashboard.

Question: What happens when the product goes out of stock?

Answer_html: Shiprocket sends an automatic alert to your account as soon as your inventory levels fall below the limit that you have set.

Question: What are Active, On-Hold, Back and Completed Orders?
Answer: Your fulfilment account has 4 types of orders:     Active Orders: Orders which are currently getting processed in the warehouse.      On-Hold Orders: Orders that have been put on hold due to inventory shortage or some other technical issue.     On-hold reasons:       Insufficient wallet balance    Pincode not serviceable    Customer name or phone number with a special character    Courier refused to shipment because the weight was exceeded    The name and address of the customer are not in the supported language (English).    Technical Issues    In the region selection settings, the region is disabled    Others       Note: If order verification is enabled, your orders will remain in Orders>On-Hold Orders until manually verified.        Back Orders: When we receive orders for items that have an ASN but are currently out of stock. We treat them as backorders and try to fulfil them as soon as the items arrive in our warehouse.     Completed Orders: Orders that have been shipped and delivered successfully.
Answer_html:
Your fulfilment account has 4 types of orders:


Active Orders: Orders which are currently getting processed in the warehouse. 


On-Hold Orders: Orders that have been put on hold due to inventory shortage or some other technical issue.


On-hold reasons:


  • Insufficient wallet balance

  • Pincode not serviceable

  • Customer name or phone number with a special character

  • Courier refused to shipment because the weight was exceeded

  • The name and address of the customer are not in the supported language (English).

  • Technical Issues

  • In the region selection settings, the region is disabled

  • Others


Note: If order verification is enabled, your orders will remain in Orders>On-Hold Orders until manually verified.



Back Orders: When we receive orders for items that have an ASN but are currently out of stock. We treat them as backorders and try to fulfil them as soon as the items arrive in our warehouse.


Completed Orders: Orders that have been shipped and delivered successfully.

Question: How do I map products in Shiprocket Fulfillment?
Answer: Product mapping is the process of mapping a channel product to a different master and channel SKU.     Here's how you do it:     Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.     Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Mapping" from the drop-down menu.       Download the sample sheet and remove the sample data and add your own product data before uploading the sheet.        Finally, upload the file and then click Finish to proceed.
Answer_html:
Product mapping is the process of mapping a channel product to a different master and channel SKU.


Here's how you do it:


Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.


Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Mapping" from the drop-down menu.


Download the sample sheet and remove the sample data and add your own product data before uploading the sheet. 


Finally, upload the file and then click Finish to proceed.

Question: What exactly is 30-days free storage?
Answer: Under our 30 days free storage policy, you don't need to pay any cost on your products until 30days from your storage date in the warehouse.
Answer_html: Under our 30 days free storage policy, you don't need to pay any cost on your products until 30days from your storage date in the warehouse.

Question: How do you calculate the volume of my products?
Answer: We use a 3D volumetric laser scanner to calculate the volume of your shipments.
Answer_html: We use a 3D volumetric laser scanner to calculate the volume of your shipments.

Question: What criteria are you using to evaluate the quality of inventory?
Answer: We do a complete quality check of your inventory by matching every product with the uploaded image and MRP sticker.
Answer_html: We do a complete quality check of your inventory by matching every product with the uploaded image and MRP sticker.

Question: What happens to my QC failed items?
Answer: We store your QC failed items in a separate bin. As a seller, you can either ask us to ship all QC failed items back to you or opt for demolition.
Answer_html: We store your QC failed items in a separate bin. As a seller, you can either ask us to ship all QC failed items back to you or opt for demolition.

Question: Who pays for RTO?
Answer: RTO charges have to be paid by the seller.
Answer_html: RTO charges have to be paid by the seller.

Question: Can I request RTO to my home/office instead of the warehouse?
Answer: Yes
Answer_html: Yes

Question: What happens if a customer cancels the order?
Answer: We do not process shipments in case of order cancellation.
Answer_html: We do not process shipments in case of order cancellation.

Question: Can I cancel an ASN?
Answer: No. However, you can create a new ASN if there's an issue with the previously created ASN.
Answer_html: No. However, you can create a new ASN if there's an issue with the previously created ASN.

Question: How much inventory do you need for SRF?
Answer: There’s no minimum quantity required for SRF.
Answer_html: There’s no minimum quantity required for SRF.

Question: What happens in the case of multi-item order?
Answer: Order will be fulfilled from the SRF warehouse if all items are available. In case of unavailability, we'll move the order to your home location.
Answer_html: Order will be fulfilled from the SRF warehouse if all items are available. In case of unavailability, we'll move the order to your home location.

Question: What is ASN? How do I generate ASN for my shipments?
Answer: ASN or Advanced Shipping Notice is an electronic document that a seller sends to the warehouse informing an upcoming goods delivery.     To know how to generate ASN from your Shiprocket panel, follow these steps:       Go to Fulfillment Center from the left menu and select ASN from the drop-down.      To create a new ASN, click Create New.      ASN creation is a five-step process. The first step is to choose a pickup location. You can select an existing pickup location or add a new one based on your needs.      Then, add your products. You can do this by searching for and adding products from your inventory or by uploading a new CSV file.     After selecting a product, you have the option to edit or remove it.    You don't have to create your ASN all at once. Simply click the Finish Later button, and we'll save your ASN in draft for future use.    In the following step, you will see your barcode type and the identifier for each selected SKU.     After that, configure the boxes in which you'll be sending your products. You can select as many boxes as you want here.    Next, select whether the inventory is for B2B or B2C commerce.    After that, select a day and time for sending your inventory. Please note that you will not be able to set up an appointment for the same day.      However, you can always go back and reschedule your appointment based on the available slots.    Finally, click on the Complete button to create an ASN.         You'll be able to view and download your ASN once you've finished.
Answer_html:
ASN or Advanced Shipping Notice is an electronic document that a seller sends to the warehouse informing an upcoming goods delivery.


To know how to generate ASN from your Shiprocket panel, follow these steps:


  • Go to Fulfillment Center from the left menu and select ASN from the drop-down.

  • To create a new ASN, click Create New.

  • ASN creation is a five-step process. The first step is to choose a pickup location. You can select an existing pickup location or add a new one based on your needs.


  • Then, add your products. You can do this by searching for and adding products from your inventory or by uploading a new CSV file. 

  • After selecting a product, you have the option to edit or remove it.

  • You don't have to create your ASN all at once. Simply click the Finish Later button, and we'll save your ASN in draft for future use.

  • In the following step, you will see your barcode type and the identifier for each selected SKU.


  • After that, configure the boxes in which you'll be sending your products. You can select as many boxes as you want here.

  • Next, select whether the inventory is for B2B or B2C commerce.

  • After that, select a day and time for sending your inventory. Please note that you will not be able to set up an appointment for the same day.


     
  • However, you can always go back and reschedule your appointment based on the available slots.

  • Finally, click on the Complete button to create an ASN. 


You'll be able to view and download your ASN once you've finished.

Question: How can I make product combos in my Shiprocket Fulfillment Account?
Answer: If you run online deals on product bundles or sell different SKUs in a single pack, 'Combos' is a great option. This feature is available to all Shiprocket Fulfillment users for free.     a) Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.      b) Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Combo" from the drop-down menu.     c) Enter the Combo SKU into the search bar and select it.      d) Then, enter the SKUs you want to include in this Combo. You can enter as many SKUs as you want here.      e) After reviewing your combo, click 'Finish' to create your Combo.
Answer_html:
If you run online deals on product bundles or sell different SKUs in a single pack, 'Combos' is a great option. This feature is available to all Shiprocket Fulfillment users for free.


a) Log in to your account and navigate to the "Fulfillment Center," then select "Products" from the drop-down menu.



b) Go to the top-right corner and click "Add New" to choose "Combo" from the drop-down menu.


c) Enter the Combo SKU into the search bar and select it.



d) Then, enter the SKUs you want to include in this Combo. You can enter as many SKUs as you want here.



e) After reviewing your combo, click 'Finish' to create your Combo.

Question: What are the benefits of enabling the cost price feature for SKUs obtained from different vendors?
Answer: Enabling the cost price feature allows you to add multiple cost prices for the same SKU, even if they are obtained from different vendors. This feature makes it easier to track inventory, and the updated cost prices will be visible in the ASN report downloaded from the panel.      Note: Each ASN is at a vendor level and can only contain a single cost price for any given SKU.
Answer_html:
Enabling the cost price feature allows you to add multiple cost prices for the same SKU, even if they are obtained from different vendors. This feature makes it easier to track inventory, and the updated cost prices will be visible in the ASN report downloaded from the panel. 


Note: Each ASN is at a vendor level and can only contain a single cost price for any given SKU.

Question: What kind of packaging is available with Shiprocket Fulfillment?
Answer: 5 types of packaging and its combination available at Shiprocket fulfilment centre:     1. Box  2. Polybag  3. Box + Bubble Wrap  4. Polybag + Bubble Wrap 5. Box + Filler
Answer_html:
5 types of packaging and its combination available at Shiprocket fulfilment centre:


1. Box

2. Polybag

3. Box + Bubble Wrap

4. Polybag + Bubble Wrap
5. Box + Filler

Question: How to select the best packaging for my products?
Answer: Follow the steps below to make sure you get the right packaging for your products:       Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels >> All Products.    Click on the 'Upload' icon and download the sample ‘Products’ file.     Fill your packaging preference in the below columns:   Packaging Material and Additional Material.         Note: Add your main package types like Box or Polybag in the ‘Packaging Material’ column and secondary package types like Bubble Wrap or Filler in the ‘Additional Material’ column. In case you don’t want to use our packaging, you can simply write ‘Self’ in Packaging Material column.        Save the file and upload it on the same page.        Your packaging preference is now saved with us, and you can check the same on ‘All Orders’ screen.
Answer_html:
Follow the steps below to make sure you get the right packaging for your products:


  1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels >> All Products.

  2. Click on the 'Upload' icon and download the sample ‘Products’ file. 

  3. Fill your packaging preference in the below columns: 

    Packaging Material and Additional Material.


Note: Add your main package types like Box or Polybag in the ‘Packaging Material’ column and secondary package types like Bubble Wrap or Filler in the ‘Additional Material’ column. In case you don’t want to use our packaging, you can simply write ‘Self’ in Packaging Material column. 


  1. Save the file and upload it on the same page. 


Your packaging preference is now saved with us, and you can check the same on ‘All Orders’ screen.

Question: Can I use my packaging?
Answer: Yes, you can. If you don’t want to use our packaging, simply mention ‘Self’ in the Packaging Material column, or you can leave the cell empty.
Answer_html: Yes, you can. If you don’t want to use our packaging, simply mention ‘Self’ in the Packaging Material column, or you can leave the cell empty.

Question: I want to edit or modify my packaging. How do I do it?
Answer: To edit or modify your packaging, follow the steps below:       Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels >> All Products.    Download the ‘Products’ file from the top-right corner.     We have added two new columns in this file: Packaging Material and Additional Material.       Note: Add your main package types like Box or Polybag in the ‘Packaging Material’ column and secondary package types like Bubble Wrap or Filler in the ‘Additional Material’ column. In case you don’t want to use our packaging, you can simply write ‘Self’ in Packaging Material column.      4. Save the file and upload it on the same page.      Your packaging preference is now saved with us, and you can check the same on ‘All Orders’ screen.
Answer_html:
To edit or modify your packaging, follow the steps below:


  1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Channels >> All Products.

  2. Download the ‘Products’ file from the top-right corner. 

  3. We have added two new columns in this file: Packaging Material and Additional Material.


Note: Add your main package types like Box or Polybag in the ‘Packaging Material’ column and secondary package types like Bubble Wrap or Filler in the ‘Additional Material’ column. In case you don’t want to use our packaging, you can simply write ‘Self’ in Packaging Material column. 


4. Save the file and upload it on the same page. 


Your packaging preference is now saved with us, and you can check the same on ‘All Orders’ screen.

Question: What happens in case of a multi-item order?
Answer: We select the final packaging by checking weight, dimensions, and quality (fragile/non-fragile) of your products. It helps in picking the most suitable packaging for your order in terms of sturdiness and affordability.
Answer_html: We select the final packaging by checking weight, dimensions, and quality (fragile/non-fragile) of your products. It helps in picking the most suitable packaging for your order in terms of sturdiness and affordability.

Answer_html: No, you can simply mention the packaging type for products you are shipping with Shiprocket Fulfillment. For other products, you can leave the cell empty.

Question: How to Create a COD/Prepaid Order in Shiprocket?
Answer: Welcome to Shiprocket! To create or add orders, please follow the steps below:     I) Log in to your registered account. Go to the left-side bar and click on 'Orders'.   II) Now, click on the 'Add Order' button located on the top-right corner of your screen. Please take the reference from the image given below:          II) Here you'll see two options:  Forward Order - An order you create to ship your product(s) to the buyer. This happens when a customer places an order at your website/eCommerce page.  Return Order - An order you create to get your product back from the customer. This happens when a customer places a return request.    Select the option as per your requirement.     For Forward Order: The information required for creating a forward order is given below:   Buyer Details  Order Details  Pickup Address  Package Weight  Other Details, if any         Add your Buyer Details          While entering your buyer details, please make sure you are entering the correct phone number and email ID. We will use this information in all future shipment tracking communication with your buyer.     Enter your buyer’s complete address    Please enter the correct address of your buyer here. We suggest you add the ‘landmark’ to help the courier executive easily locate the buyer’s address.   Note: Mention the company name if it’s a B2B order.    Next, enter the billing address    Please select the field ‘Billing Address is Same as Delivery Address’ if both addresses are the same. You can enter a different billing address as well.     Review the information and click next to proceed.     Fill your Order Details             Start by filling your order details like; Order ID (Generate an Order ID if you don’t have one), Order Date (the date on which you have received the order), and Order Channel (For e.g; your website, marketplaces, social media, etc).     Next, add your product details     Please enter the product name, quantity and per-unit price. We’ll recommend you to add the discounted amount and tax rate if any applicable.    Now, select your payment mode and other charges    In the payment mode, select ‘Prepaid’ if you have already received the payment from your customer. Please select ‘COD’ if you need to collect the cash amount from your customer at the time of delivery.  Other than this, enter any other charges you would want to include in the buyer shipping invoice.   Please check the total amount before clicking ‘Next’ to proceed.           Choose your pickup address           Pickup address is your business location or from where the shipment originates. Select the one you have already provided or add a new one.           Things to remember while entering your Package’s Weight and Dimensions     a) Weigh your package with its packaging.    b) Enter the correct weight and dimensions to avoid any weight dispute.    c) The final shipment weight is calculated by comparing the actual weight with the dimensional weight, whichever is higher.    d) Put your shipment’s actual weight in kilograms and dimensions in centimetres only.         Enter Additional Details if you have any       These details are seller specific and optional to enter:    Reseller Name: You can enter the reseller name if you are shipping on someone’s behalf.    Eway Bill Number: If your shipment’s value is greater than Rs. 50000, you need to enter the Eway bill number.     GSTIN Number: If your buyer has provided his/her GSTIN, then you can enter the same here.           Finally, click on ‘Add Order’ to complete the process.
Answer_html:
Welcome to Shiprocket! To create or add orders, please follow the steps below:


I) Log in to your registered account. Go to the left-side bar and click on 'Orders'. 

II) Now, click on the 'Add Order' button located on the top-right corner of your screen. Please take the reference from the image given below:



II) Here you'll see two options:

Forward Order - An order you create to ship your product(s) to the buyer. This happens when a customer places an order at your website/eCommerce page.

Return Order - An order you create to get your product back from the customer. This happens when a customer places a return request. 


Select the option as per your requirement.


For Forward Order: The information required for creating a forward order is given below:

  1. Buyer Details
  2. Order Details
  3. Pickup Address
  4. Package Weight
  5. Other Details, if any



Add your Buyer Details



While entering your buyer details, please make sure you are entering the correct phone number and email ID. We will use this information in all future shipment tracking communication with your buyer.


Enter your buyer’s complete address

Please enter the correct address of your buyer here. We suggest you add the ‘landmark’ to help the courier executive easily locate the buyer’s address. 

Note: Mention the company name if it’s a B2B order.

Next, enter the billing address

Please select the field ‘Billing Address is Same as Delivery Address’ if both addresses are the same. You can enter a different billing address as well.


Review the information and click next to proceed.


Fill your Order Details




Start by filling your order details like; Order ID (Generate an Order ID if you don’t have one), Order Date (the date on which you have received the order), and Order Channel (For e.g; your website, marketplaces, social media, etc).


Next, add your product details


Please enter the product name, quantity and per-unit price. We’ll recommend you to add the discounted amount and tax rate if any applicable.

Now, select your payment mode and other charges

In the payment mode, select ‘Prepaid’ if you have already received the payment from your customer. Please select ‘COD’ if you need to collect the cash amount from your customer at the time of delivery.

Other than this, enter any other charges you would want to include in the buyer shipping invoice. 

Please check the total amount before clicking ‘Next’ to proceed.




Choose your pickup address




Pickup address is your business location or from where the shipment originates. Select the one you have already provided or add a new one.




Things to remember while entering your Package’s Weight and Dimensions


a) Weigh your package with its packaging.

b) Enter the correct weight and dimensions to avoid any weight dispute.

c) The final shipment weight is calculated by comparing the actual weight with the dimensional weight, whichever is higher.

d) Put your shipment’s actual weight in kilograms and dimensions in centimetres only.




Enter Additional Details if you have any




These details are seller specific and optional to enter:

Reseller Name: You can enter the reseller name if you are shipping on someone’s behalf.

Eway Bill Number: If your shipment’s value is greater than Rs. 50000, you need to enter the Eway bill number. 

GSTIN Number: If your buyer has provided his/her GSTIN, then you can enter the same here.




Finally, click on ‘Add Order’ to complete the process.

Question: What Is an Order ID?
Answer: An Order ID is a unique number which helps you identify and search orders within your Shiprocket account. Each order receives its own Order ID that will not be duplicated.
Answer_html: An Order ID is a unique number which helps you identify and search orders within your Shiprocket account. Each order receives its own Order ID that will not be duplicated.

Question: What Is a SKU, HSN Code, and Eway Bill Number?
Answer: 1. SKU - SKU stands for Stock Keeping Unit. It is a unique code of letters and numbers that help to effectively identify and organize your inventory.     2. HSN codes - HSN stands for Harmonized System of Nomenclature. It is used to classify goods to calculate GST. It helps in determining the tax slab (NIL, 5%, 12%, 18%, & 28%) of your product.     You can find both of them in the 'Product Details' section of 'Create Forward Order' page.          3. Eway Bill  - Under GST Act, it is mandatory to enter Eway bill number for shipping of goods from one place to another, either inter-state or intra-state and of value more than INR 50,000. You can easily enter your Eway bill number while creating a manual order in Shiprocket.      To generate an Eway bill, please visit https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/Others/EBPrintnew.aspx
Answer_html:
1. SKU - SKU stands for Stock Keeping Unit. It is a unique code of letters and numbers that help to effectively identify and organize your inventory.


2. HSN codes - HSN stands for Harmonized System of Nomenclature. It is used to classify goods to calculate GST. It helps in determining the tax slab (NIL, 5%, 12%, 18%, & 28%) of your product.


You can find both of them in the 'Product Details' section of 'Create Forward Order' page.



3. Eway Bill  - Under GST Act, it is mandatory to enter Eway bill number for shipping of goods from one place to another, either inter-state or intra-state and of value more than INR 50,000. You can easily enter your Eway bill number while creating a manual order in Shiprocket. 


To generate an Eway bill, please visit https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/Others/EBPrintnew.aspx

Question: How to File a Delivery Dispute for a Missing or Incorrectly Delivered Shipment?
Answer: Shipment not delivered or received in an improper, partial, empty, or damaged state?      You can now file a dispute with your Shiprocket panel within 3 days of its Delivered/RTO Delivered/RTO Acknowledged status. To know how to file a delivery dispute, follow the steps below:     a) Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Orders >> All Orders.     b) The "POD Actions" button is located against your order in the POD Details column. Please keep in mind that you can only file a delivery dispute against Delivered or RTO Delivered shipments.          c) To proceed, select the reason for the delivery dispute and click Submit.          Note: There are no changes in the POD workflow and you can still request a POD within 7 days for documentation and other purposes.
Answer_html:
Shipment not delivered or received in an improper, partial, empty, or damaged state? 


You can now file a dispute with your Shiprocket panel within 3 days of its Delivered/RTO Delivered/RTO Acknowledged status. To know how to file a delivery dispute, follow the steps below:


a) Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Orders >> All Orders.


b) The "POD Actions" button is located against your order in the POD Details column. Please keep in mind that you can only file a delivery dispute against Delivered or RTO Delivered shipments.



c) To proceed, select the reason for the delivery dispute and click Submit.



Note: There are no changes in the POD workflow and you can still request a POD within 7 days for documentation and other purposes.

Question: How do I automatically sync my orders ?
Answer: In order to automatically sync your orders, you first need to sync your sales channels with Shiprocket. We provide channel integration service with multiple channels like; Amazon, WooCommerce, Shopify, Magento, etc.           To know how to integrate your channel, please click here.     For all the channels integrated with ShipRocket, there is an Auto Status update that runs every 30 minutes where we push the order status from Shiprocket to the respective channel. We update orders in real time for Shopify.     Or, go to the processing screen and click on the sync orders from channels button to sync your order immediately.       Just make sure that for your integrated channel, the Order Sync is On          Note: In case your Channel Connector is broken, the Order sync will not work.      Image Reference:
Answer_html:
In order to automatically sync your orders, you first need to sync your sales channels with Shiprocket. We provide channel integration service with multiple channels like; Amazon, WooCommerce, Shopify, Magento, etc. 



To know how to integrate your channel, please click here.


For all the channels integrated with ShipRocket, there is an Auto Status update that runs every 30 minutes where we push the order status from Shiprocket to the respective channel. We update orders in real time for Shopify.


Or, go to the processing screen and click on the sync orders from channels button to sync your order immediately.  


Just make sure that for your integrated channel, the Order Sync is On



Note: In case your Channel Connector is broken, the Order sync will not work. 


Image Reference:
