Answer: By default, all new orders, whether added manually or imported through sales channels, will be visible in the Orders screen's New tab.     Ship a Single Order       1) To see all available courier options, click the Ship Now button.     2) You can view each courier's rating, expected pickup and delivery dates, charged weight, and final charges here. If you haven't already, you can choose to secure your high-value shipment at this point.       3) Click the Ship Now button to have your order delivered by your preferred courier partner.       4) Once you've assigned the AWB, you'll be prompted to schedule a pickup for your order. You have the option of scheduling the pickup right away or later.        Ship Bulk Orders     1) Select all orders that you want to ship at once.     2) Navigate to the top-right corner and select Bulk Actions. Here, you must select the Ship Now option.    3) Based on the priority setting, a courier will be assigned to each of the selected orders.. Once completed, you will receive an email informing you of the status of your assigned orders.    4) When the process is finished, all labels for your orders will be downloaded automatically.
Answer_html:
By default, all new orders, whether added manually or imported through sales channels, will be visible in the Orders screen's New tab.


Ship a Single Order


1) To see all available courier options, click the Ship Now button.


2) You can view each courier's rating, expected pickup and delivery dates, charged weight, and final charges here. If you haven't already, you can choose to secure your high-value shipment at this point.


3) Click the Ship Now button to have your order delivered by your preferred courier partner.


4) Once you've assigned the AWB, you'll be prompted to schedule a pickup for your order. You have the option of scheduling the pickup right away or later.



Ship Bulk Orders


1) Select all orders that you want to ship at once.


2) Navigate to the top-right corner and select Bulk Actions. Here, you must select the Ship Now option.

3) Based on the priority setting, a courier will be assigned to each of the selected orders.. Once completed, you will receive an email informing you of the status of your assigned orders.

4) When the process is finished, all labels for your orders will be downloaded automatically.

Question: How do I update orders in bulk?
Answer: Follow the steps below if you would like to update orders in bulk:     1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will bring you to the New tab, where you can view all of your pending/new orders.    2) Select all the orders for which you want to update details and click on the Bulk Order Update button.       3) Next, download the sample CSV file and update it with your order data.    4) Upload the modified CSV file again and click on the Upload File button.     5) If updated correctly, your orders will be updated within x seconds.
Answer_html:
Follow the steps below if you would like to update orders in bulk:


1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will bring you to the New tab, where you can view all of your pending/new orders.

2) Select all the orders for which you want to update details and click on the Bulk Order Update button.



3) Next, download the sample CSV file and update it with your order data.

4) Upload the modified CSV file again and click on the Upload File button.

5) If updated correctly, your orders will be updated within x seconds.

Question: How to upload Eway Bill for my RTO order?
Answer: Uploading an Eway Bill for your RTO shipment is mandatory if the order value is more than Rs. 50000.      Steps to be followed:    Go to 'Orders' from the left-menu and select RTO.      Go to RTO initiated orders and look for your order. You'll find an Upload Eway Bill button against your order.        Click on the button to add your required details and upload Eway bill.      Click on the Upload Documents button to complete the process
Answer_html:
Uploading an Eway Bill for your RTO shipment is mandatory if the order value is more than Rs. 50000. 


Steps to be followed:

  1. Go to 'Orders' from the left-menu and select RTO.

  2. Go to RTO initiated orders and look for your order. You'll find an Upload Eway Bill button against your order.


  3. Click on the button to add your required details and upload Eway bill.

  4. Click on the Upload Documents button to complete the process

Question: Shiprocket: How to download shipping invoices and labels?
Answer: Download Shipping Invoices:     1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will take you to the New tab, where you will be able to see all of your orders.     2) For a Single Order - Click on the Horizontal Dots (Meatballs) menu located near the Ship Now button to download the invoice for your order.     3) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the invoice to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Invoice button.        Download Shipping Labels:     1) From the left menu, select Orders. Here go to the Ready to Ship tab.  2) For a Single Order - Click on the Horizontal Dots (Meatballs) menu located near the Ship Now button to download the label for your order.    3) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the label to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Label button.
Answer_html:
Download Shipping Invoices:


1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will take you to the New tab, where you will be able to see all of your orders.


2) For a Single Order - Click on the Horizontal Dots (Meatballs) menu located near the Ship Now button to download the invoice for your order.


3) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the invoice to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Invoice button.



Download Shipping Labels:


1) From the left menu, select Orders. Here go to the Ready to Ship tab.

2) For a Single Order - Click on the Horizontal Dots (Meatballs) menu located near the Ship Now button to download the label for your order.

3) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the label to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Label button.

Question: How to verify my orders in Shiprocket?
Answer: Order verification is a shipment setting that allows you to verify COD and Prepaid orders before shipping them. You should enable it for your account if;     - You want to have better control over your RTOs    - You are using Shiprocket Fulfillment and want to verify your orders before moving them to the warehouse.         Note: This setting is available for all Shiprocket plans.         How to enable Order Verification setting?        1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Shipment Features.     2. Under Shipment Features, you'll find the "Order Verification" button.    3. Now, simply turn the toggle on to enable COD and Prepaid Order verification.         Here's how you can verify your orders:     1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will bring you to the New tab, where you can view all of your pending/new orders.     2) For Single Order:      a) Go to the more (...) icon, which is located right next to the Ship Now button, and click on it.    b) Click on the Mark as Verified button to verify your order for shipping.        c) Once verified, a Verified tag will be applied to your order. This will help you identify all verified orders that are eligible for shipping.       3) For Bulk Orders:     a) Select all orders that you would like to verify. Next, click on the Bulk Actions button.     b) Click on Verify Orders button to verify all selected orders.     c) Once verified, a Verified tag will be applied to your order. This will help you identify all verified orders that are eligible for shipping.
Answer_html:
Order verification is a shipment setting that allows you to verify COD and Prepaid orders before shipping them. You should enable it for your account if;


- You want to have better control over your RTOs

- You are using Shiprocket Fulfillment and want to verify your orders before moving them to the warehouse. 



Note: This setting is available for all Shiprocket plans. 



How to enable Order Verification setting?



1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Settings -> Shipment Features.


2. Under Shipment Features, you'll find the "Order Verification" button.

3. Now, simply turn the toggle on to enable COD and Prepaid Order verification. 



Here's how you can verify your orders:


1) From the left menu, select Orders. This will bring you to the New tab, where you can view all of your pending/new orders.


2) For Single Order: 


a) Go to the more (...) icon, which is located right next to the Ship Now button, and click on it.

b) Click on the Mark as Verified button to verify your order for shipping.



c) Once verified, a Verified tag will be applied to your order. This will help you identify all verified orders that are eligible for shipping.


3) For Bulk Orders:


a) Select all orders that you would like to verify. Next, click on the Bulk Actions button.

b) Click on Verify Orders button to verify all selected orders.


c) Once verified, a Verified tag will be applied to your order. This will help you identify all verified orders that are eligible for shipping.

Question: Why do I need to upload package images?
Answer: Uploading photographs of your package is not required, but highly recommended. This allows us to determine the size and shape of your package.     Note: Upload a minimum of three and a maximum of five package images. Please take pictures from various angles to give us a good idea of the dimensions and shape of your package.
Answer_html:
Uploading photographs of your package is not required, but highly recommended. This allows us to determine the size and shape of your package.

Note: Upload a minimum of three and a maximum of five package images. Please take pictures from various angles to give us a good idea of the dimensions and shape of your package.

Question: How to download a manifest?
Answer: There are two methods for generating and downloading a manifest:     Option 1: Select "Pickup Scheduled" Orders and Download Manifest  Option 2: Scan/Paste AWBs and Print Manifest        1. Select "Pickup Scheduled" Orders and Download Manifest  Click on Orders from your left menu and navigate to the Ready to Ship tab or the Pickups tab.     a) For a Single Order - Look for your order and click the Download Manifest button. A pop-up window will appear, from which you can download the manifest.            b) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the manifest to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Manifest button.     Note: The Pickups tab does not have a Bulk Manifest Download option.           2. Scan/Paste AWBs and Print Manifest  Click on Orders from your left menu and navigate to the Ready to Ship tab or the Pickups tab.     a) Use the Scan icon in the top bar to scan orders one by one. Or, simply copy and paste all AWBs with the status 'Pickup Scheduled'.     b) Choose the Manifest format and click on the Download Manifest button.
Answer_html:
There are two methods for generating and downloading a manifest:


Option 1: Select "Pickup Scheduled" Orders and Download Manifest

Option 2: Scan/Paste AWBs and Print Manifest



1. Select "Pickup Scheduled" Orders and Download Manifest

Click on Orders from your left menu and navigate to the Ready to Ship tab or the Pickups tab.


a) For a Single Order - Look for your order and click the Download Manifest button. A pop-up window will appear, from which you can download the manifest.





b) For Bulk Orders - Simply select all of your orders for which you want the manifest to be downloaded. Once you've made your selection, navigate to the Bulk Actions menu and click the Download Manifest button. 

Note: The Pickups tab does not have a Bulk Manifest Download option.




2. Scan/Paste AWBs and Print Manifest

Click on Orders from your left menu and navigate to the Ready to Ship tab or the Pickups tab.


a) Use the Scan icon in the top bar to scan orders one by one. Or, simply copy and paste all AWBs with the status 'Pickup Scheduled'.


b) Choose the Manifest format and click on the Download Manifest button.

Question: How to upload and change Eway Bill for forward orders?
Answer: Uploading an Eway Bill is mandatory for shipping goods worth more than Rs. 50000. In Shiprocket, you can upload your Eway Bill from:       Ready to Ship Tab, or    All Tab          Upload Eway Bill     For a Single Order:  Go to your order and click the Request Pickup button, which is located right next to your order. A pop-up window will appear where you can enter the necessary information and upload your Eway Bill.            For Bulk Orders:  a) Select the Upload Eway Bill icon, which is located next to the Bulk Actions button. A pop-up window will appear on your screen, allowing you to download a list of all orders for which an Eway Bill is required.     b) After that, download the sample CSV file, replace the dummy data with your data, and upload it again.      Note: The All tab does not support bulk Eway bill upload.        Change Eway bill     If you've already uploaded the Eway Bill but want to change it, simply navigate to the Ready to Ship or All tabs and follow the steps below:     1) Click the More (...) button next to your order.       2) Click on the Change Eway Bill option to open a pop-up window where you can enter the Eway Bill Number, Upload Eway Bill, and Invoice.        3) To proceed, click Download Documents.
Answer_html:
Uploading an Eway Bill is mandatory for shipping goods worth more than Rs. 50000. In Shiprocket, you can upload your Eway Bill from:


  1. Ready to Ship Tab, or

  2. All Tab



Upload Eway Bill


For a Single Order:

Go to your order and click the Request Pickup button, which is located right next to your order. A pop-up window will appear where you can enter the necessary information and upload your Eway Bill.



For Bulk Orders:

a) Select the Upload Eway Bill icon, which is located next to the Bulk Actions button. A pop-up window will appear on your screen, allowing you to download a list of all orders for which an Eway Bill is required.


b) After that, download the sample CSV file, replace the dummy data with your data, and upload it again. 


Note: The All tab does not support bulk Eway bill upload.



Change Eway bill


If you've already uploaded the Eway Bill but want to change it, simply navigate to the Ready to Ship or All tabs and follow the steps below:


1) Click the More (...) button next to your order.


2) Click on the Change Eway Bill option to open a pop-up window where you can enter the Eway Bill Number, Upload Eway Bill, and Invoice.



3) To proceed, click Download Documents.

Question: Can I change the payment mode of my COD order?
Answer: Here's how you can change the payment mode of your COD order:       Activate the Change Payment Mode setting for your account. Click here to learn how.       Go to Orders from the left menu and go to the New tab.      Select the order for which you want to update the payment mode and click on the more icon.      Next, click on the Edit Order button. Here you can change the payment mode from COD to Prepaid.      Note: This setting will only work if you have activated COD to Prepaid setting for your account.       Click on Update to proceed with the changes.
Answer_html:
Here's how you can change the payment mode of your COD order:


  1. Activate the Change Payment Mode setting for your account. Click here to learn how. 

  2. Go to Orders from the left menu and go to the New tab.

  3. Select the order for which you want to update the payment mode and click on the more icon.

  4. Next, click on the Edit Order button. Here you can change the payment mode from COD to Prepaid. 

    Note: This setting will only work if you have activated COD to Prepaid setting for your account. 

  5. Click on Update to proceed with the changes.

Question: Can I change the payment mode of my order if it’s in the out for delivery status?
Answer: You cannot change the payment mode if your order is in any of the following statuses:     1. Out for Delivery  2. RTO or Return to Origin  3. Delivered  4. Lost/Damaged/Destroyed     Note: You can change the payment mode of your shipment if it's in the NDR status.
Answer_html:
You cannot change the payment mode if your order is in any of the following statuses:


1. Out for Delivery

2. RTO or Return to Origin

3. Delivered

4. Lost/Damaged/Destroyed


Note: You can change the payment mode of your shipment if it's in the NDR status.

Question: How do I add order tag?
Answer: Adding tags to your order is an optional but recommended step. Multiple tags can be added to your order to help in identification. You can also use order tags to filter your orders.     Here's how you can add tags to your orders:     1. Navigate to Orders from the left menu and select the New or All tab.    2. Click on the more icon (...) and select Add Order Tag.     3. Then, type the order tag you want to use and press enter. You can add as many order tags as you want.   4. Click on Save to proceed.
Answer_html:
Adding tags to your order is an optional but recommended step. Multiple tags can be added to your order to help in identification. You can also use order tags to filter your orders.


Here's how you can add tags to your orders:


1. Navigate to Orders from the left menu and select the New or All tab.

2. Click on the more icon (...) and select Add Order Tag.


3. Then, type the order tag you want to use and press enter. You can add as many order tags as you want.


4. Click on Save to proceed.

Question: How to download my orders report?
Answer: Here's how you can download your orders re1) From the left menu, select the Orders tab. Because the Orders report is tab-specific, each tab generates a report for its own orders.      Select a tab and go to the top-right corner of your screen and click the download icon.  The report will be emailed to your registered email address, but you can also download it from the Reports section of your Shiprocket account.
Answer_html:
Here's how you can download your orders re1) From the left menu, select the Orders tab. Because the Orders report is tab-specific, each tab generates a report for its own orders.


  1. Select a tab and go to the top-right corner of your screen and click the download icon.
  2. The report will be emailed to your registered email address, but you can also download it from the Reports section of your Shiprocket account.

Question: How to raise a delivery dispute in Shiprocket?
Answer: Shiprocket gives you the option to raise a dispute against your shipment delivery in case you are facing any issues with it.      You can raise a delivery dispute from:    Orders Screen    Help & Support Screen       Delivery Disputes can be raised under the following conditions:    Delivered Not Received - If the status of your shipment shows Delivered/RTO Delivered but you haven’t received the shipment physically    Wrong/Partial/Damaged/Empty Shipment Received - If the received shipment is either damaged/ incorrect/empty/incomplete.     Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Not Updated - If the shipment is physically delivered but the status indicates otherwise       Let’s take a look at each of them one by one!     Orders Screen: A) Delivered Not Received or Wrong/Partial/Damaged/Empty Shipment Received     Follow the steps below to raise a dispute for your shipment:     Step 1: Go to the Order option from the left menu.          Step 2: Search the AWB Number for which you want to raise the dispute.           Step 3: Click on the more option from Action.           Step 4: Click on the Raise Dispute option to proceed.           Step 5: If your concern is ‘Order not delivered’ then select that option and you can add your alternate contact number which is optional. Now, click submit to raise your dispute.           Step 6: If your concern is ‘Wrong/ Damaged/ Partial/ Empty Package Delivered’ then select that option and select your exact dispute reason from the drop down.           Step 7: Now, upload the proof of your dispute which will be the images or videos of your shipment. We ask for proof in the form of an image in order to have concrete evidence to back up a delivery dispute in front of the courier. This allows us to accurately assess the situation and determine the appropriate resolution. Without an image, it can be difficult to accurately determine what occurred during the delivery process and make a fair decision.     Step 8: After uploading the images or videos, Submit your dispute.                 Orders Screen: B) Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Shows RTO Initiated     If your concern is Shipment physically Delivered but the Status is marked as RTO Initiated then,      Step 1: Click on the RTO Tab from the header menu and search for your shipment using AWB number.      Step 2: Click on the more option and select raise dispute.           Step 3: Upload the post shipped package images where the shipping label and inner contents are clearly visible. Click on Submit to proceed.          Once raised, the status of your shipment will be changed to Dispute Raised. You can see our internal team's updates on this shipment by clicking the View History button.             Help & Support Screen: A) Raise Delivery Dispute     Step 1: Go to the Help and Support option from the left menu and click on Help Center.          Step 2: Click on the Raise Dispute option available in the Shipment Delivery Dispute section.           Step 3: Add your AWB Number and click on proceed.           Step 4: Confirm the AWBs to raise a dispute and click on proceed.           NOTE: Please note that we will be able to investigate a Delivery Dispute if a request for the investigation has been raised within 72 hours of package delivery.     Step 5: Click on the Raise Dispute button.           Step 6: Select your exact dispute reason from the drop down, upload shipment images, and click on the Submit button.  We ask you to upload shipment images if the package appears to be damaged or tampered with, or if the contents of the shipment are missing or incorrect.              Note: You will receive an update on your dispute within 10 business days. A dispute can be raised a maximum of two times.     Help & Support Screen: B) Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Not Updated     Step 1: Click on the Shipment Physically Delivered but Status not Updated’ option available in the Shipment Delivery Dispute section.           Step 2: Enter, paste, or upload your AWBs here for which you want to raise a dispute.           Step 3: Confirm the AWB numbers of shipments that are Physically Delivered but whose status is not Updated. Click on ‘Proceed’ to view the latest details of these shipments and raise a ticket.          Step 10: Follow the same steps when ‘Shipment Physically RTO/Return Delivered but Status Not Updated’.          Step 11: Select an order and click on ‘submit’ to raise a ticket for further assistance.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket gives you the option to raise a dispute against your shipment delivery in case you are facing any issues with it. 


You can raise a delivery dispute from:

  1. Orders Screen

  2. Help & Support Screen


Delivery Disputes can be raised under the following conditions:

  1. Delivered Not Received - If the status of your shipment shows Delivered/RTO Delivered but you haven’t received the shipment physically

  2. Wrong/Partial/Damaged/Empty Shipment Received - If the received shipment is either damaged/ incorrect/empty/incomplete. 

  3. Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Not Updated - If the shipment is physically delivered but the status indicates otherwise


Let’s take a look at each of them one by one!


Orders Screen: A) Delivered Not Received or Wrong/Partial/Damaged/Empty Shipment Received


Follow the steps below to raise a dispute for your shipment:


Step 1: Go to the Order option from the left menu.



Step 2: Search the AWB Number for which you want to raise the dispute. 



Step 3: Click on the more option from Action. 



Step 4: Click on the Raise Dispute option to proceed. 



Step 5: If your concern is ‘Order not delivered’ then select that option and you can add your alternate contact number which is optional. Now, click submit to raise your dispute. 



Step 6: If your concern is ‘Wrong/ Damaged/ Partial/ Empty Package Delivered’ then select that option and select your exact dispute reason from the drop down. 



Step 7: Now, upload the proof of your dispute which will be the images or videos of your shipment. We ask for proof in the form of an image in order to have concrete evidence to back up a delivery dispute in front of the courier. This allows us to accurately assess the situation and determine the appropriate resolution. Without an image, it can be difficult to accurately determine what occurred during the delivery process and make a fair decision.


Step 8: After uploading the images or videos, Submit your dispute. 





Orders Screen: B) Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Shows RTO Initiated


If your concern is Shipment physically Delivered but the Status is marked as RTO Initiated then, 


Step 1: Click on the RTO Tab from the header menu and search for your shipment using AWB number. 


Step 2: Click on the more option and select raise dispute. 



Step 3: Upload the post shipped package images where the shipping label and inner contents are clearly visible. Click on Submit to proceed.



Once raised, the status of your shipment will be changed to Dispute Raised. You can see our internal team's updates on this shipment by clicking the View History button.




Help & Support Screen: A) Raise Delivery Dispute


Step 1: Go to the Help and Support option from the left menu and click on Help Center.



Step 2: Click on the Raise Dispute option available in the Shipment Delivery Dispute section. 



Step 3: Add your AWB Number and click on proceed. 



Step 4: Confirm the AWBs to raise a dispute and click on proceed. 



NOTE: Please note that we will be able to investigate a Delivery Dispute if a request for the investigation has been raised within 72 hours of package delivery.


Step 5: Click on the Raise Dispute button. 



Step 6: Select your exact dispute reason from the drop down, upload shipment images, and click on the Submit button.  We ask you to upload shipment images if the package appears to be damaged or tampered with, or if the contents of the shipment are missing or incorrect. 




Note: You will receive an update on your dispute within 10 business days. A dispute can be raised a maximum of two times.


Help & Support Screen: B) Shipment Physically Delivered but Status Not Updated


Step 1: Click on the Shipment Physically Delivered but Status not Updated’ option available in the Shipment Delivery Dispute section. 



Step 2: Enter, paste, or upload your AWBs here for which you want to raise a dispute. 



Step 3: Confirm the AWB numbers of shipments that are Physically Delivered but whose status is not Updated. Click on ‘Proceed’ to view the latest details of these shipments and raise a ticket.



Step 10: Follow the same steps when ‘Shipment Physically RTO/Return Delivered but Status Not Updated’.



Step 11: Select an order and click on ‘submit’ to raise a ticket for further assistance.

Question: What is a pickup ID?
Answer: Pickup ID is an alphanumeric unique ID that is generated to group all your shipments together based on the pickup address ID, courier, and scheduled date. Simply click on the pickup ID to view your shipments.     Case 1: Five shipments with the same courier partner are scheduled for the following day: In this case, a single pickup ID will be generated for all five shipments.     Case 2: Five shipments are scheduled for the following day with different courier partners: In this case, a unique pickup ID will be generated for each shipment.
Answer_html:
Pickup ID is an alphanumeric unique ID that is generated to group all your shipments together based on the pickup address ID, courier, and scheduled date. Simply click on the pickup ID to view your shipments.


Case 1: Five shipments with the same courier partner are scheduled for the following day: In this case, a single pickup ID will be generated for all five shipments.


Case 2: Five shipments are scheduled for the following day with different courier partners: In this case, a unique pickup ID will be generated for each shipment.

Question: How do I find my pickup ID?
Answer: To find pickup ID, follow the steps below:     a) Log in to your account  b) Click on Orders and click on the Pickup Tab.  c) Here, you'll find the unique pickup ID against your scheduled pickups.
Answer_html:
To find pickup ID, follow the steps below:


a) Log in to your account

b) Click on Orders and click on the Pickup Tab.

c) Here, you'll find the unique pickup ID against your scheduled pickups.

Question: Can shipments be moved from one pickup ID to another?
Answer: Yes, under certain conditions, this is possible. Assume you have two pickup IDs:     SRPID-1001 - Five shipments are scheduled for pickup on the same day.  SRPID-1002 - Three shipments are scheduled for next-day pickup.     When the courier arrives to pick up the shipments with pickup SRPID - 1001, he also picks up two shipments with pickup SRPID-1002 because they were also ready at the time. In this particular case, two of the three shipments from SRPID-1002 will be moved to SRPID- 1001.
Answer_html:
Yes, under certain conditions, this is possible. Assume you have two pickup IDs:


SRPID-1001 - Five shipments are scheduled for pickup on the same day.

SRPID-1002 - Three shipments are scheduled for next-day pickup.


When the courier arrives to pick up the shipments with pickup SRPID - 1001, he also picks up two shipments with pickup SRPID-1002 because they were also ready at the time. In this particular case, two of the three shipments from SRPID-1002 will be moved to SRPID- 1001.

Question: Can I still use Manifest ID to escalate pickup delays?
Answer: No New escalations will be available on Manifest ID. To report any pickup delays, please use Pickup ID.
Answer_html: No New escalations will be available on Manifest ID. To report any pickup delays, please use Pickup ID.

Question: What is the difference between a pickup ID and a Manifest ID?
Answer: In Shiprocket, we recently added pickup ID, which allows you to escalate pickup delays. Manifest ID will now be used to report any post-pickup disputes.
Answer_html: In Shiprocket, we recently added pickup ID, which allows you to escalate pickup delays. Manifest ID will now be used to report any post-pickup disputes.

Question: What happens to a pickup ID if all shipments are canceled?
Answer: The pickup ID will be automatically removed from the system if all shipments in that pickup ID are canceled.
Answer_html: The pickup ID will be automatically removed from the system if all shipments in that pickup ID are canceled.

Question: What are the various Pick up ID statuses?
Answer: The following are the various statuses:     a) Pick up Scheduled: Pickup of shipments has been scheduled.  b) Pick up Completed: All shipments were picked up.  c) Pick up Canceled: All shipments associated with a pick up ID are canceled.  d) Partially completed: Only a few shipments were picked up from a specific pickup ID.  e) Pickup Exception: When a courier company attempted pickup but was unable to complete it due to unforeseen circumstances.
Answer_html:
The following are the various statuses:


a) Pick up Scheduled: Pickup of shipments has been scheduled.

b) Pick up Completed: All shipments were picked up.

c) Pick up Canceled: All shipments associated with a pick up ID are canceled.

d) Partially completed: Only a few shipments were picked up from a specific pickup ID.

e) Pickup Exception: When a courier company attempted pickup but was unable to complete it due to unforeseen circumstances.

Question: In what circumstances can different pickup IDs be generated?
Answer: Your shipments can have two different pickup IDs if;    One is scheduled before the pickup cut-off time, and the other is scheduled after pickup cut-off time on a given day.    The pickup addresses for both shipments are different.    Both shipments are scheduled to be delivered by different courier companies.
Answer_html:
Your shipments can have two different pickup IDs if;

  • One is scheduled before the pickup cut-off time, and the other is scheduled after pickup cut-off time on a given day.

  • The pickup addresses for both shipments are different.

  • Both shipments are scheduled to be delivered by different courier companies.

Question: What will be the role of Manifest ID?
Answer: The Manifest and Manifest ID are still valid for pickup and are required when handing shipments over to the pickup executive. Furthermore, except for pickup escalation, a Manifest ID is required to raise all other pickup-related issues.
Answer_html: The Manifest and Manifest ID are still valid for pickup and are required when handing shipments over to the pickup executive. Furthermore, except for pickup escalation, a Manifest ID is required to raise all other pickup-related issues.

Question: Will this have an impact on the pickup process in the Shiprocket mobile apps as well?
Answer: Yes, from now on, pickup escalation in Shiprocket Mobile Apps will be based on the pickup ID rather than the Manifest ID. When you raise an escalation, you'll be able to see the pickup ID.
Answer_html: Yes, from now on, pickup escalation in Shiprocket Mobile Apps will be based on the pickup ID rather than the Manifest ID. When you raise an escalation, you'll be able to see the pickup ID.

Question: Can I modify the order details after I've scheduled pickup?
Answer: Please keep in mind that once a courier has been assigned to your order, you will not be able to modify the details.
Answer_html: Please keep in mind that once a courier has been assigned to your order, you will not be able to modify the details.

Question: How do I handle pickup delays in my Shiprocket account?
Answer: Please be assured that if there is a delay, the Shiprocket team has already escalated it. However, if you are dissatisfied and wish to escalate, please follow the steps outlined below:     1. From the left menu, select Orders and then the Pickups tab.  2. There is an Escalate button next to the Pickup ID that has not been picked up.  3. Select your escalation reason by clicking the escalate button.   4. Next, add your remarks and click Escalate button to proceed.
Answer_html:
Please be assured that if there is a delay, the Shiprocket team has already escalated it. However, if you are dissatisfied and wish to escalate, please follow the steps outlined below:


1. From the left menu, select Orders and then the Pickups tab.

2. There is an Escalate button next to the Pickup ID that has not been picked up.

3. Select your escalation reason by clicking the escalate button. 

4. Next, add your remarks and click Escalate button to proceed.

Question: What are the steps from order creation to pick up?
Answer: Follow the listed below steps to decide your journey from creating an order to pickup:     Step 1: Go to the Orders tab from the left menu.           Step 2: Click on Add Order Tab.          Step 3: Add your buyer details and click Next to proceed.           Step 4: Select or add your Pickup address and click Next.           Step 5: Fill in your order details and click Next.          Step 6: Add your package details and click on Add Order.           Step 7: Once your order is successfully created, click on Ship Now button in the next tab.           Step 8: Choose your courier partner and click on Ship Now.          Step 9: Now, schedule your pickup accordingly by choosing the day.          Step 10: Click on Schedule Pickup.
Answer_html:
Follow the listed below steps to decide your journey from creating an order to pickup:


Step 1: Go to the Orders tab from the left menu. 



Step 2: Click on Add Order Tab.



Step 3: Add your buyer details and click Next to proceed. 



Step 4: Select or add your Pickup address and click Next. 



Step 5: Fill in your order details and click Next.



Step 6: Add your package details and click on Add Order. 



Step 7: Once your order is successfully created, click on Ship Now button in the next tab. 



Step 8: Choose your courier partner and click on Ship Now.



Step 9: Now, schedule your pickup accordingly by choosing the day.



Step 10: Click on Schedule Pickup.

Question: What is a Pickup error and how to solve it?
Answer: Pickup error occurs when the courier refuses to accept the pickup request. This could happen due to multiple reasons.      For example: A pickup error usually comes up when either the order details are incorrect or the courier company API is showing an error response due to some specific reasons.      How to solve?     Each pickup error will have a specific pickup error reason associated with it. To fix this issue, you can either reassign the courier or retry with the same courier by correcting the buyer's details.          Steps to fix Pickup Error:     Step 1: Click on Ship Now.  Step 2: Select your preferred courier partner and then date.  Step 3: Now, schedule pickup and after this, your order will be moved to the Ready to Ship tab.
Answer_html:
Pickup error occurs when the courier refuses to accept the pickup request. This could happen due to multiple reasons. 


For example: A pickup error usually comes up when either the order details are incorrect or the courier company API is showing an error response due to some specific reasons. 


How to solve?


Each pickup error will have a specific pickup error reason associated with it. To fix this issue, you can either reassign the courier or retry with the same courier by correcting the buyer's details.



Steps to fix Pickup Error:


Step 1: Click on Ship Now.

Step 2: Select your preferred courier partner and then date.

Step 3: Now, schedule pickup and after this, your order will be moved to the Ready to Ship tab.

Question: What is a pickup exception?
Answer: The status Pickup exception is marked when the courier company attempted pickup and couldn't complete it due to some reason. It can also occur in cases when pickup executive doesn’t attempt pickup.           To deal with pickup exceptions, you can schedule pickup for different day and time.     Steps to Schedule Pickup:     Step 1: Click on Ship Now button.  Step 2: Select your preferred courier partner and date.  Step 3:  Click on Schedule Pickup.
Answer_html:
The status Pickup exception is marked when the courier company attempted pickup and couldn't complete it due to some reason. It can also occur in cases when pickup executive doesn’t attempt pickup. 



To deal with pickup exceptions, you can schedule pickup for different day and time.


Steps to Schedule Pickup:


Step 1: Click on Ship Now button.

Step 2: Select your preferred courier partner and date.

Step 3:  Click on Schedule Pickup.

Question: Can I cancel a picked up shipment?
Answer: You can’t cancel a shipment that is picked up. Shipments can only be canceled before handover to couriers.
Answer_html: You can’t cancel a shipment that is picked up. Shipments can only be canceled before handover to couriers.

Question: What do I do in case of a fake pickup attempt?
Answer: Escalation is the way by which Shiprocket provides a shield to its sellers against fake courier remarks. If you feel the pickup exception reason was incorrect you can raise escalation.     Follow the steps to raise escalation:     Step 1: Go to the Pickup tab and select Escalate.          Step 2: Select Escalation reason.          Step 3: Click on Escalate.          Step 4: Now, you can check the status where your escalation status moved to pending.     Note: Shiprocket team will revert back within 24 hours!
Answer_html:
Escalation is the way by which Shiprocket provides a shield to its sellers against fake courier remarks. If you feel the pickup exception reason was incorrect you can raise escalation.


Follow the steps to raise escalation:


Step 1: Go to the Pickup tab and select Escalate.



Step 2: Select Escalation reason.



Step 3: Click on Escalate.



Step 4: Now, you can check the status where your escalation status moved to pending.


Note: Shiprocket team will revert back within 24 hours!

Question: Can I update the details of an already picked shipment?
Answer: There is no such option available to update the details of your already picked shipments.
Answer_html: There is no such option available to update the details of your already picked shipments.

Question: Can I schedule shipment for a future date?
Answer: Yes, you can schedule your shipment for a future date.     Steps to schedule a future pickup date:     Step 1: Choose your courier partner and click on Ship Now.          Step 2: Now, schedule your pickup accordingly by choosing the future date.          Step 3: Click on Schedule Pickup.
Answer_html:
Yes, you can schedule your shipment for a future date.


Steps to schedule a future pickup date:


Step 1: Choose your courier partner and click on Ship Now.



Step 2: Now, schedule your pickup accordingly by choosing the future date.



Step 3: Click on Schedule Pickup.

Question: How do I get KYC verified?
Answer: Know Your Customer, commonly known as KYC, enables us to validate the identity of its customers. You only need to do this once as a first-time customer.     Follow the steps below to know how to complete your KYC verification:     You can access the KYC screen directly from the homepage or from Settings.     For Individual:     1. Complete Your Photo Identification        For this, switch on your webcam and allow Shiprocket to take your selfie image. Make sure your selfie is clear and visible. Click on "Save Image" to proceed.     2. Express KYC or Manual KYC     a) Express KYC - Get KYC verified in 30 seconds     Simply enter your 12-digit Aadhaar number to generate an OTP. Enter this OTP to complete your KYC verification in less than 30 seconds.     b) Manual KYC - Get KYC verified in 2-3 business days       Select your document type and upload its image(s). Make sure all images are correct and belong to you. Images should be clear to read.      Finally, click on Submit and Verify Documents to proceed with your verification.         For Company     1. Select your company type from the drop-down.    2. Complete Your Photo Identification    Switch on your webcam and allow Shiprocket to take your selfie image. Make sure your selfie is clear and visible. Click on "Save Image" to proceed.     3. Express KYC or Manual KYC     a) Express KYC - Get KYC verified in 30 seconds    Enter your 15-digit GST number to generate OTP for KYC verification. Enter the OTP received on your registered mobile number and verify your KYC in 30 seconds.     Note: For Sole Proprietors: You can also choose to verify your KYC using your Aadhaar details.     b) Manual KYC - Get KYC verified in 2-3 business days       Select your document type and upload its image(s). Make sure all images are correct and belong to you. Images should be clear to read.   Note: PAN Card is mandatory for company KYC except in the case of a Sole Proprietorship.     Finally, click on Submit and Verify Documents to proceed with your verification.
Answer_html:
Know Your Customer, commonly known as KYC, enables us to validate the identity of its customers. You only need to do this once as a first-time customer.


Follow the steps below to know how to complete your KYC verification:


You can access the KYC screen directly from the homepage or from Settings.


For Individual:


1. Complete Your Photo Identification



For this, switch on your webcam and allow Shiprocket to take your selfie image. Make sure your selfie is clear and visible. Click on "Save Image" to proceed.


2. Express KYC or Manual KYC


a) Express KYC - Get KYC verified in 30 seconds


Simply enter your 12-digit Aadhaar number to generate an OTP. Enter this OTP to complete your KYC verification in less than 30 seconds.


b) Manual KYC - Get KYC verified in 2-3 business days  


Select your document type and upload its image(s). Make sure all images are correct and belong to you. Images should be clear to read. 


Finally, click on Submit and Verify Documents to proceed with your verification. 



For Company


1. Select your company type from the drop-down.

2. Complete Your Photo Identification

Switch on your webcam and allow Shiprocket to take your selfie image. Make sure your selfie is clear and visible. Click on "Save Image" to proceed.


3. Express KYC or Manual KYC


a) Express KYC - Get KYC verified in 30 seconds

Enter your 15-digit GST number to generate OTP for KYC verification. Enter the OTP received on your registered mobile number and verify your KYC in 30 seconds.


Note: For Sole Proprietors: You can also choose to verify your KYC using your Aadhaar details.


b) Manual KYC - Get KYC verified in 2-3 business days


Select your document type and upload its image(s). Make sure all images are correct and belong to you. Images should be clear to read. 

Note: PAN Card is mandatory for company KYC except in the case of a Sole Proprietorship.


Finally, click on Submit and Verify Documents to proceed with your verification.

Question: Shiprocket: What documents are required for KYC verification?
Answer: At Shiprocket, we have a simple process for KYC verification. For this, you need:     KYC For Individual: Complete your KYC by using the automated process of Aadhar OTP verification. You can also do it manually by uploading any of the two documents listed below:     - Aadhaar Card  - PAN Card  - Passport  - Voter ID Card  - Driving License      KYC For Company:      A) In case of a Sole Proprietorship business, please submit the following documents-         a. Upload your photo or selfie         b. Complete your KYC details using automated Aadhaar or GSTIN OTP verification, or using a manual method by submitting any of the two documents listed below:    - Aadhar Card  - PAN card  - DL  - Voter card  - Passport  - GST Certificate  - Company Incorporation Doc    B) In case you are registering as a Company, please submit the following documents-                a. Upload your photo or selfie               b. Complete your KYC using the GSTIN OTP verification. or using a manual method by submitting any of the two documents listed below:     - PAN Card ( Mandatory )     - GST Certificate ( all 3 pages of the GST certificate are required), or Company Incorporated Document.     We request you to upload clear documents regarding your KYC in the panel to avoid any rejection or failure.         NOTE: For manual KYC verification, it takes 2 - 3 working days to verify the documents.
Answer_html:
At Shiprocket, we have a simple process for KYC verification. For this, you need:


KYC For Individual: Complete your KYC by using the automated process of Aadhar OTP verification. You can also do it manually by uploading any of the two documents listed below:


- Aadhaar Card

- PAN Card

- Passport

- Voter ID Card

- Driving License



KYC For Company: 


A) In case of a Sole Proprietorship business, please submit the following documents-


    a. Upload your photo or selfie


    b. Complete your KYC details using automated Aadhaar or GSTIN OTP verification, or using a manual method by submitting any of the two documents listed below:

- Aadhar Card

- PAN card

- DL

- Voter card

- Passport

- GST Certificate

- Company Incorporation Doc

B) In case you are registering as a Company, please submit the following documents-


           a. Upload your photo or selfie

           b. Complete your KYC using the GSTIN OTP verification. or using a manual method by submitting any of the two documents listed below:


- PAN Card ( Mandatory )


- GST Certificate ( all 3 pages of the GST certificate are required), or Company Incorporated Document.


We request you to upload clear documents regarding your KYC in the panel to avoid any rejection or failure. 



NOTE: For manual KYC verification, it takes 2 - 3 working days to verify the documents.

Question: My KYC verification failed. What should I do now?
Answer: After submission of details, Shiprocket team manually checks your entries within 24 - 48 business hours & approves or rejects your application based on what they find.     Here's why your KYC verification may have failed:     1. Name on both documents does not match 2. Uploaded images are not clear 3. Uploaded photocopy image does not match with the original document image 4. Mentioned document ID is Incorrect 5. Uploaded documents are not valid ones 6. Same document image uploaded for both documents 7. Document belong to an underage person 8. Selfie is invalid
Answer_html:
After submission of details, Shiprocket team manually checks your entries within 24 - 48 business hours & approves or rejects your application based on what they find.


Here's why your KYC verification may have failed:


1. Name on both documents does not match
2. Uploaded images are not clear
3. Uploaded photocopy image does not match with the original document image
4. Mentioned document ID is Incorrect
5. Uploaded documents are not valid ones
6. Same document image uploaded for both documents
7. Document belong to an underage person
8. Selfie is invalid

Question: How do I integrate Amazon as a channel?
Answer: Steps to Integrate Amazon as Channel:     There are three main synchronizations as you connect Amazon with your Shiprocket account. These are-    Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Amazon with the Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Unfulfilled (Self Ship) Orders from the Amazon panel into the system.    Automatic Status Sync – For the Amazon self-ship orders that are processed via Shiprocket, the order status will automatically be updated as Fulfilled on your Amazon seller central.    Catalog & inventory Sync – All the active products on the Amazon panel will automatically be fetched into the Shiprocket panel, where you can easily manage your inventory.       Mentioned below are the detailed steps to integrate your Amazon channel with Shiprocket-     Step A:  1. log in to your Amazon Seller panel.          2. Locate 'Third-Party Developer and Apps' under the 'Permissions' tab. Now click on the 'Visit Manage your Apps' button on this page.           3. A new tab will open. You can either click on the 'Authorize a new Developer' to generate a new token or 'View MWS Auth token' to view your existing token.           4. Make sure that you enter the following developer credentials for generating the MWS Auth token, then click 'Next'-:    Developer’s Name: KartRocket    Developer Account Number: 1469-7463-9584            5. Accept the Amazon MWS License Agreement and click “Next”          6. Copy the credentials (Merchant ID and MWS Auth Token) and keep them safe. You will need it when you edit the details of Amazon as a channel in your Shiprocket panel.             Step B:  1. Now login to your Shiprocket panel and go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  2. Click on the “Add New Channel” button.       3. Click on Amazon >> Integrate.          4. Enter the Channel Name.     5. Switch on the Order and Inventory Sync as per your requirement.     6. Fill in the required information as saved from the Amazon Seller Panel.     Merchant ID – This is the ID that you need to fill into your Shiprocket account.  MWS Authentication Token – Merchant Specific key generated for Shiprocket to access your APIs     7. Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”.          8. Green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.
Answer_html:
Steps to Integrate Amazon as Channel:


There are three main synchronizations as you connect Amazon with your Shiprocket account. These are-

  • Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Amazon with the Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Unfulfilled (Self Ship) Orders from the Amazon panel into the system.

  • Automatic Status Sync – For the Amazon self-ship orders that are processed via Shiprocket, the order status will automatically be updated as Fulfilled on your Amazon seller central.

  • Catalog & inventory Sync – All the active products on the Amazon panel will automatically be fetched into the Shiprocket panel, where you can easily manage your inventory.

 

Mentioned below are the detailed steps to integrate your Amazon channel with Shiprocket-

 

Step A:

1. log in to your Amazon Seller panel.



2. Locate 'Third-Party Developer and Apps' under the 'Permissions' tab. Now click on the 'Visit Manage your Apps' button on this page.

 


 3. A new tab will open. You can either click on the 'Authorize a new Developer' to generate a new token or 'View MWS Auth token' to view your existing token. 



4. Make sure that you enter the following developer credentials for generating the MWS Auth token, then click 'Next'-:

  • Developer’s Name: KartRocket

  • Developer Account Number: 1469-7463-9584



5. Accept the Amazon MWS License Agreement and click “Next”



6. Copy the credentials (Merchant ID and MWS Auth Token) and keep them safe. You will need it when you edit the details of Amazon as a channel in your Shiprocket panel.




Step B:

1. Now login to your Shiprocket panel and go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

2. Click on the “Add New Channel” button.


3. Click on Amazon >> Integrate.


 

4. Enter the Channel Name.

 

5. Switch on the Order and Inventory Sync as per your requirement.

 

6. Fill in the required information as saved from the Amazon Seller Panel.


Merchant ID – This is the ID that you need to fill into your Shiprocket account.

MWS Authentication Token – Merchant Specific key generated for Shiprocket to access your APIs


7. Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”.



8. Green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.

Question: How Do I integrate Opencart with Shiprocket?
Answer: Integrating Opencart with ShipRocket     Following are the ways to integrate Opencart with ShipRocket. Before you proceed with these steps, please make sure that you have installed the Shiprocket plugin on your Opencart account.     Supported Version: 3.0*      Next, please download the shiprocket extension from Opencart according to your platform version:     Download Extension Here     Step I – Configuration at Opencart Extension      Login to your Opencart admin panel.           2. Go to Extensions Tab -> Extension Installer. Upload the extension file downloaded from the link given above.          3. Once the file is successfully uploaded. Go to Extensions Tab -> Modules.          4. Add OpenCart Rest API.          5. Once the APIs are installed, click on the Add New button, enter the title as ShipRocket and click Save          6. Now you will get Public Key & Private Key for Opencart. Copy and save them.          Step II – Configuration at ShipRocket panel     1. Log in to your account and go Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.     2. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button.          3. Click on Opencart -> Integrate.          4. Switch “On” the Order and Inventory Sync as per your requirement.     5. Fill in the Parameters i.e Store Url,  public Hash, Private hash (as saved from the OpenCart panel), and Opencart version           6. Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”.          7. The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.
Answer_html:
Integrating Opencart with ShipRocket


Following are the ways to integrate Opencart with ShipRocket. Before you proceed with these steps, please make sure that you have installed the Shiprocket plugin on your Opencart account.


Supported Version: 3.0* 


Next, please download the shiprocket extension from Opencart according to your platform version:


Download Extension Here


Step I – Configuration at Opencart Extension


  1. Login to your Opencart admin panel.



2. Go to Extensions Tab -> Extension Installer. Upload the extension file downloaded from the link given above.



3. Once the file is successfully uploaded. Go to Extensions Tab -> Modules.



4. Add OpenCart Rest API.



5. Once the APIs are installed, click on the Add New button, enter the title as ShipRocket and click Save



6. Now you will get Public Key & Private Key for Opencart. Copy and save them.



Step II – Configuration at ShipRocket panel


1. Log in to your account and go Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.


2. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button.



3. Click on Opencart -> Integrate.



4. Switch “On” the Order and Inventory Sync as per your requirement.


5. Fill in the Parameters i.e Store Url,  public Hash, Private hash (as saved from the OpenCart panel), and Opencart version 



6. Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”.



7. The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.

Question: How Do I integrate Woocommerce with Shiprocket?
Answer: Please follow the steps below to integrate your Woocommerce website with Shiprocket:     Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket account and go Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.    Step 2: Click on the 'Add New Channel' button to add your Woocommerce channel    Step 3: Locate the Woocommerce channel and click on the 'Add' button          Step 4:  Here, enter your Woocommerce store URL and click on 'Connect to Woocommerce'          Step 5: On clicking,  you will be redirected to a page within WooCommerce. Please click on "Approve" to give Shiprocket the required permission to operate          Step 6: Once you approve the connection, it will redirect you to the previous "Channel" page with a consumer key and consumer secret     Step 7: Click on the "Update Channel & Test Credentials" to connect your channel with Shiprocket.        Please Note: Please be ensured that your REST API is enabled in your WooCommerce plugin. To do this,     1. Within your WordPress admin, go to the WooCommerce section.   2. Click on "Settings" and go to the API tab.   3. Check if your REST API is enabled or not. If you don't have an API tab, you need to upgrade your WooCommerce plugin to the latest version.
Answer_html:
Please follow the steps below to integrate your Woocommerce website with Shiprocket:


Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket account and go Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

Step 2: Click on the 'Add New Channel' button to add your Woocommerce channel

Step 3: Locate the Woocommerce channel and click on the 'Add' button



Step 4:  Here, enter your Woocommerce store URL and click on 'Connect to Woocommerce'



Step 5: On clicking,  you will be redirected to a page within WooCommerce. Please click on "Approve" to give Shiprocket the required permission to operate



Step 6: Once you approve the connection, it will redirect you to the previous "Channel" page with a consumer key and consumer secret


Step 7: Click on the "Update Channel & Test Credentials" to connect your channel with Shiprocket.



Please Note: Please be ensured that your REST API is enabled in your WooCommerce plugin. To do this,


1. Within your WordPress admin, go to the WooCommerce section. 

2. Click on "Settings" and go to the API tab. 

3. Check if your REST API is enabled or not. If you don't have an API tab, you need to upgrade your WooCommerce plugin to the latest version.

Question: How Do I integrate Magento(version 1) with Shiprocket?
Answer: Given below are the three main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Magento V1 with your Shiprocket account.   Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Magento with Shiprocket allows you to sync your pending orders from Magento with the Shiprocket account. The process is not fully automatic as you need to manually enter the statuses against which you want to fetch your orders.   Automatic Status Sync – For the Magento orders that are processed via Shiprocket panel, the status will automatically be updated on Magento channel.  Catalog & inventory Sync – All the active products on Magento panel will automatically be fetched into the system, where you can manage your inventory      How to Integrate Magento V1     with Shiprocket  Step A:   Login to Magento admin panel.        2. Go to System -> Web Services      3. Under Web Services, locate SOAP/XML -RPC – Users.          4. Click on “ Add New User”.       5. Under the User Info tab, fill in all required info user name, first name, etc.       6. Click on “ Save User” shown at the top right corner.     7. Go to System -> Web Services      8. Under Web Services locate SOAP/XML -RPC – Roles          9. Click on Add new roles Button.  10. Click on Role Info tab type role name i.e. superadmin       11.  Click on the Role Resources tab, select Resource Access – “All” from drop-down menu, and click “Save Role”.    12. Once again Go to System -> Web Services -> SOAP/XML-RPC – Users.   13. Click on the user name which has been entered. (Please refer to Step A - > part 4)       14. Under the User Role tab, click on the assigned role name i.e. superadmin, which has been entered. ( Please refer to Step A - > part 8)        15. Click on “Save User”.     Step B:    1. Log in to your Shiprocket account.  2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  3. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button.           4. Click on Magento -> Integrate.       5. Enter the Magento order status that you want to fetch in your Shiprocket panel and switch “On” the Order Sync icon. Switch on Inventory Sync, if required.             6. Fill in the Parameters as saved from the Magento Panel       Store URL: The URL of your store.       API Key & API Username: API details your Magento Panel       (As Mentioned in Step A - > part 4)         7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.       8. Green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.
Answer_html:
Given below are the three main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Magento V1 with your Shiprocket account.

  • Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Magento with Shiprocket allows you to sync your pending orders from Magento with the Shiprocket account. The process is not fully automatic as you need to manually enter the statuses against which you want to fetch your orders. 
  • Automatic Status Sync – For the Magento orders that are processed via Shiprocket panel, the status will automatically be updated on Magento channel.
  • Catalog & inventory Sync – All the active products on Magento panel will automatically be fetched into the system, where you can manage your inventory


How to Integrate Magento V1     with Shiprocket

Step A:

  1. Login to Magento admin panel.


2. Go to System -> Web Services 


3. Under Web Services, locate SOAP/XML -RPC – Users.



4. Click on “ Add New User”.


5. Under the User Info tab, fill in all required info user name, first name, etc.


6. Click on “ Save User” shown at the top right corner.


7. Go to System -> Web Services 


8. Under Web Services locate SOAP/XML -RPC – Roles



9. Click on Add new roles Button.

10. Click on Role Info tab type role name i.e. superadmin


11.  Click on the Role Resources tab, select Resource Access – “All” from drop-down menu, and click “Save Role”.

12. Once again Go to System -> Web Services -> SOAP/XML-RPC – Users.


13. Click on the user name which has been entered. (Please refer to Step A - > part 4)


14. Under the User Role tab, click on the assigned role name i.e. superadmin, which has been entered. ( Please refer to Step A - > part 8)



15. Click on “Save User”.


Step B:
 

1. Log in to your Shiprocket account.

2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

3. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button. 



4. Click on Magento -> Integrate.


5. Enter the Magento order status that you want to fetch in your Shiprocket panel and switch “On” the Order Sync icon. Switch on Inventory Sync, if required.

    

 

6. Fill in the Parameters as saved from the Magento Panel
      Store URL: The URL of your store.
      API Key & API Username: API details your Magento Panel
      (As Mentioned in Step A - > part 4)


 7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.


8. Green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.

Question: How do I integrate Shopify as a channel with Shiprocket ?
Answer: Integrating Shopify with Shiprocket     Shopify is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Shopify account. These are the three main synchronizations that you receive when you connect Shopify with your Shiprocket account.      Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Shopify with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all unfulfilled orders from the Shopify panel into the system   Automatic Status Sync – For the Shopify orders that are processed via the Shiprocket panel, the status will automatically be updated as fulfilled on the Shopify channel.  Catalog & inventory Sync – All your active products on Shopify will automatically be fetched into the system. You can use this to manage your inventory.      How to Integrate Shopify with ShipRocket     One-Click Integration:     Integrate your Shopify store with Shiprocket using Shopify auth mechanism. Follow the steps below:     1) Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  2) Here, click on the Add New Channel Button.  3) Locate the Shopify Channel in the list of all channels and click "Integrate."  4) Fill in the required general information and then click the 'Connect to Shopify' button on your screen to continue.          5) You'll be directed to the Shopify seller login page. To log in, enter your Shopify username and password.          6) Once logged in, you'll see a pop-up on your screen asking you to 'Authorize Shiprocket'. To proceed, confirm your account integration details and click 'Authorize'.          7) When you click Authorize, you will be redirected to your Shiprocket account. Please click the 'Edit' button to customize your Shopify channel to your preference.               Custom App Integration:     Private apps are deprecated and can't be created as of January 2022. You can now create a custom app and use the app credentials to integrate with Shiprocket.     Steps to integrate with Shopify custom app:     Step A: Settings at Shopify End     1. Log in to Shopify Admin Panel.  2. Go to Apps.          3. Scroll below to find the ‘Develop apps' for your store’ button          4. Here, click on the ‘Create an app’ button.          5. Go ahead and give your Custom app a recognizable name. (For e.g; Shiprocket).          6. Click on the ‘Create app’ button to proceed.          7. A ‘Configure Admin API scopes’ button is available under the Overview tab. Click on it to see all admin access scopes.          Read Access: Fulfillment Services & Inventory  Read & Write Access: Products, Product Listings, Assigned Fulfillment Orders, Customers, Draft Orders, Orders, Merchant Managed Fulfillment Orders, Order Editing, Store Content, Third-Party Fulfillment Orders.     8. After you've defined the scopes, click the Install App button in the top right corner of the page.             9. Click on Install to get the App credentials (Admin API Access Token, API key, and API secret key) from the API credentials tab             Note: You can only reveal the token once after the API access credentials have been generated. If you want to regenerate the token, simply uninstall the app and reinstall it. The token will be regenerated and can be used for Shiprocket integration.        Step B: Settings in ShipRocket     1. Log in to your Shiprocket. 2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  3. Click on the “Add New Channel” button as highlighted in the image below.          4. Here click on Shopify >> Integrate          5. Enter your website/brand name in the 'Communication Brand Name' section.          6. Upload your brand's logo.      7. Next, enter the Shopify order status that you want to fetch in your Shiprocket panel and turn the toggle on for order sync. (Status to fetch: Unfulfilled)   8. Now, select or create the order status which you want to push on your channel. If disabled, default push status mapping will work on your channel.     9. Enable payment status mapping for your account by turning the toggle on. It will map new and existing payment gateway/status against COD and Prepaid payment status.     10. Next, turn the toggle on if you want to push paid status to your channel.     11. Finally, turn the toggle on if you want to sync your inventory with Shiprocket.     12. At last you need to fill in the API keys and parameters to complete your channel integration.       For Store URL, use: https://yourshopname.myshopify.com (You'll find this URL in the address bar of your Shopify account).    API key- The same API key that was generated following the installation of the custom app.    API Password – The Admin API access token, which was generated after installing the custom app.    Shared Secret- The API secret key is generated after installing the custom app.               13. Click on Save Channel & Test Connection to proceed.        That's all! The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.
Answer_html:
Integrating Shopify with Shiprocket


Shopify is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Shopify account. These are the three main synchronizations that you receive when you connect Shopify with your Shiprocket account.


  • Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Shopify with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all unfulfilled orders from the Shopify panel into the system 
  • Automatic Status Sync – For the Shopify orders that are processed via the Shiprocket panel, the status will automatically be updated as fulfilled on the Shopify channel.
  • Catalog & inventory Sync – All your active products on Shopify will automatically be fetched into the system. You can use this to manage your inventory.


How to Integrate Shopify with ShipRocket


One-Click Integration:


Integrate your Shopify store with Shiprocket using Shopify auth mechanism. Follow the steps below:


1) Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

2) Here, click on the Add New Channel Button.

3) Locate the Shopify Channel in the list of all channels and click "Integrate."

4) Fill in the required general information and then click the 'Connect to Shopify' button on your screen to continue.



5) You'll be directed to the Shopify seller login page. To log in, enter your Shopify username and password.



6) Once logged in, you'll see a pop-up on your screen asking you to 'Authorize Shiprocket'. To proceed, confirm your account integration details and click 'Authorize'.



7) When you click Authorize, you will be redirected to your Shiprocket account. Please click the 'Edit' button to customize your Shopify channel to your preference.




Custom App Integration:


Private apps are deprecated and can't be created as of January 2022. You can now create a custom app and use the app credentials to integrate with Shiprocket.


Steps to integrate with Shopify custom app:


Step A: Settings at Shopify End


1. Log in to Shopify Admin Panel.

2. Go to Apps.



3. Scroll below to find the ‘Develop apps' for your store’ button



4. Here, click on the ‘Create an app’ button.



5. Go ahead and give your Custom app a recognizable name. (For e.g; Shiprocket).



6. Click on the ‘Create app’ button to proceed.



7. A ‘Configure Admin API scopes’ button is available under the Overview tab. Click on it to see all admin access scopes.



Read Access: Fulfillment Services & Inventory

Read & Write Access: Products, Product Listings, Assigned Fulfillment Orders, Customers, Draft Orders, Orders, Merchant Managed Fulfillment Orders, Order Editing, Store Content, Third-Party Fulfillment Orders.


8. After you've defined the scopes, click the Install App button in the top right corner of the page.




9. Click on Install to get the App credentials (Admin API Access Token, API key, and API secret key) from the API credentials tab




Note: You can only reveal the token once after the API access credentials have been generated. If you want to regenerate the token, simply uninstall the app and reinstall it. The token will be regenerated and can be used for Shiprocket integration.



Step B: Settings in ShipRocket


1. Log in to your Shiprocket.
2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

3. Click on the “Add New Channel” button as highlighted in the image below.



4. Here click on Shopify >> Integrate



5. Enter your website/brand name in the 'Communication Brand Name' section.



6. Upload your brand's logo. 


7. Next, enter the Shopify order status that you want to fetch in your Shiprocket panel and turn the toggle on for order sync. (Status to fetch: Unfulfilled)


8. Now, select or create the order status which you want to push on your channel. If disabled, default push status mapping will work on your channel.


9. Enable payment status mapping for your account by turning the toggle on. It will map new and existing payment gateway/status against COD and Prepaid payment status.


10. Next, turn the toggle on if you want to push paid status to your channel.


11. Finally, turn the toggle on if you want to sync your inventory with Shiprocket.


12. At last you need to fill in the API keys and parameters to complete your channel integration.


  • For Store URL, use: https://yourshopname.myshopify.com (You'll find this URL in the address bar of your Shopify account).

  • API key- The same API key that was generated following the installation of the custom app.

  • API Password – The Admin API access token, which was generated after installing the custom app.

  • Shared Secret- The API secret key is generated after installing the custom app.




13. Click on Save Channel & Test Connection to proceed.



That's all! The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.

Question: How do I integrate Unicommerce with Shiprocket?
Answer: You can easily fulfill all your orders and take care of your logistic with one panel using Shiprocket. Given below are the  steps that will help you integrate your Shiprocket account with Unicommerce:  Steps to be performed in Shiprocket Account      Login to your Shiprocket panel, go to Settings -> API from the left menu.  Next, select Configure and click on the Create New API user button. To create an external API, please enter an email id (different from your registered email id), and password. Click on Generate API Credentials button to proceed.      Please refer to the images below:                      Steps to be taken in your Unicommerce Account   Login to your Unicommerce account and Go to settings > Shipping Provider.  2. Next, click on Add Shipping Provider from the top right corner.             3. Now search Shiprocket from the search bar.              4. Go to Settings, enter the shipping provider name, select your desirable serviceability & shipping methods.      We suggest to choose “this facility to selected pincodes” in the Serviceability fields and add both COD and prepaid shipping methods for your courier provider. Also, select "API" in the AWB generation column.           5. Then, click on Connectors, Add API user credentials as Email id & Password of your Shiprocket account.           6. Now go to Tools > select Import           7. Upload the Pincode file that you have downloaded from your Shiprocket panel. Contact our support team if you have any questions.           8. You can also further check the uploaded pincodes. For this, Go to Settings > Serviceability:          That’s it! You are ready to start shipping with Shiprocket.     Now create an order, print invoice and select the courier partner that you would choose for your order. By default, the courier partner with the highest priority is selected.
Answer_html:
You can easily fulfill all your orders and take care of your logistic with one panel using Shiprocket. Given below are the  steps that will help you integrate your Shiprocket account with Unicommerce:

Steps to be performed in Shiprocket Account


  1. Login to your Shiprocket panel, go to Settings -> API from the left menu.
  2. Next, select Configure and click on the Create New API user button. To create an external API, please enter an email id (different from your registered email id), and password. Click on Generate API Credentials button to proceed.


Please refer to the images below:





Steps to be taken in your Unicommerce Account

  1. Login to your Unicommerce account and Go to settings > Shipping Provider.

    2. Next, click on Add Shipping Provider from the top right corner.



3. Now search Shiprocket from the search bar. 



 4. Go to Settings, enter the shipping provider name, select your desirable serviceability & shipping methods. 


We suggest to choose “this facility to selected pincodes” in the Serviceability fields and add both COD and prepaid shipping methods for your courier provider. Also, select "API" in the AWB generation column.



 5. Then, click on Connectors, Add API user credentials as Email id & Password of your Shiprocket account. 



6. Now go to Tools > select Import 



7. Upload the Pincode file that you have downloaded from your Shiprocket panel. Contact our support team if you have any questions. 



8. You can also further check the uploaded pincodes. For this, Go to Settings > Serviceability:



That’s it! You are ready to start shipping with Shiprocket.


Now create an order, print invoice and select the courier partner that you would choose for your order. By default, the courier partner with the highest priority is selected.
