Question: How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket?
Answer: Steps To Integrate Prestashop With Shiprocket      Prestashop is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Prestashop account. Given below are the main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Prestashop with your Shiprocket account.        Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Prestashop with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Pending Orders from Prestashop panel into the system. By default we’ll fetch “Payment Accepted ” and “ remote payment accepted” status orders.        Automatic Status Sync – For the orders processed via Shiprocket panel the status will automatically be updated on Prestashop .        How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket     Step A: Setting at Prestashop End      Login to your Prestashop Admin Panel.   Go to Advanced Parameters -> Webservice.   Make sure the option “Enable PrestaShop’s Web Service” should be marked “Yes”.  Click on Sign (+) to add new API.            Step B: Generating API Key      Enter Key value and click to Generate.   Enter Key Description i.e. (API key, API name, other information)   Enable Status to Yes.   Check all Permissions.   Click on Save.            Step C: Settings in ShipRocket        1. Log in to your Shiprocket panel.      2. Go to Manage –> All Channels from the left menu.     3. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button as highlighted in the image below.             4. Click on Prestashop -> Integrate.             5. Switch “On” the Order Sync icon.        6. Enter Prestashop Store URL & Prestashop API Key (which has been already generated in Step B)             7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.
Answer_html:
Steps To Integrate Prestashop With Shiprocket 


Prestashop is one of the most popular e-commerce platforms. Here, we show you how to integrate Shiprocket with your Prestashop account. Given below are the
main synchronizations which you receive when you connect Prestashop with your Shiprocket account.



Automatic Order Sync – Integrating Prestashop with Shiprocket panel allows you to automatically sync all the Pending Orders from Prestashop panel into the system. By default we’ll fetch “Payment Accepted ” and “ remote payment accepted” status orders.



Automatic Status Sync – For the orders processed via Shiprocket panel the status will automatically be updated on Prestashop .



How to Integrate Prestashop with Shiprocket


Step A: Setting at Prestashop End


  1. Login to your Prestashop Admin Panel. 
  2. Go to Advanced Parameters -> Webservice. 
  3. Make sure the option “Enable PrestaShop’s Web Service” should be marked “Yes”.
  4. Click on Sign (+) to add new API.



 Step B: Generating API Key


  1. Enter Key value and click to Generate. 
  2. Enter Key Description i.e. (API key, API name, other information) 
  3. Enable Status to Yes. 
  4. Check all Permissions. 
  5. Click on Save.



 Step C: Settings in ShipRocket



1. Log in to your Shiprocket panel. 


2. Go to Manage –> All Channels from the left menu.


3. Click on the “Add New Channel” Button as highlighted in the image below.




4. Click on Prestashop -> Integrate.




5. Switch “On” the Order Sync icon.



6. Enter Prestashop Store URL & Prestashop API Key (which has been already generated in Step B)




7. Click Save Channel & Test Connection.

Question: What Is a Pull Order Status Mapper?
Answer: A Pull Order Status Mapper allows you to match your eCommerce channel or website statuses with the Shiprocket's order processing status. For this;     1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  3. Now, click on 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to pull order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.  4. On this page locate the 'Pull Order Statuses' header.  5. You can enter multiple statuses separated by "," . Please refer to the image below:          6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'        Note: By default, we import unfulfilled orders for Amazon. If you are connecting any other channel, please mention all your order statuses which you want to map with Shiprocket's order processing status.
Answer_html:
A Pull Order Status Mapper allows you to match your eCommerce channel or website statuses with the Shiprocket's order processing status. For this;


1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

3. Now, click on 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to pull order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.

4. On this page locate the 'Pull Order Statuses' header.

5. You can enter multiple statuses separated by "," . Please refer to the image below:


 

6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'



Note: By default, we import unfulfilled orders for Amazon. If you are connecting any other channel, please mention all your order statuses which you want to map with Shiprocket's order processing status.

Question: What Is a Push Order Status Mapper?
Answer: A Push Order Status Mapper helps you match your channel or website statuses with the default statuses of Shiprocket. By turning it on, you can select or create an order status which you want to push on your channel. When the Push Order Status Mapper is disabled, default push status mapping will work on your channel.         1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  3. Now, click on 'edit' button for the channel you wish to push order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.  4. Here, you will be able to locate the 'Push Order Statuses' header. Please turn the toggle on.  5. Now, you can either select from the drop-down or create your own custom statuses. Please refer to the image below:  Note: Make sure you only mention the statuses you have on your channel.          6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'.     Your new push order statuses have been mapped.        Note: If disabled, Shiprocket default push status mapping will work on your channel. Please refer to the table below:     Shiprocket  Amazon(ATS)  WooCommerce  Shopify  Magento  Amazon(Self Shipping)  Opencart  Ebay  Kartrocket  BigCommerce  Prestashop  New            Invoiced            Ready to Ship     Processing     Ready to Dispatch    Pickup Scheduled         Pick Up Generated  Awaiting Shipment   Pickup Queued         Pick Up Generated      Pickup Rescheduled           Pick Up Generated    Canceled  Cancel  Cancelled    Canceled  Cancel  Cancelled   Canceled  cancelled  Canceled  Shipped  Shipped  Completed   fulfillment_status=shipped  Complete  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped  In Transit   Completed   fulfillment_status=shipped  Complete  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped  Shipped   Shipped  Delivered  Delivered  Completed    Complete  Delivered  Complete   Delivered  Complete  Delivered     Please know by default we push tracking AWB and fulfilment/complete status for all channels.
Answer_html:
A Push Order Status Mapper helps you match your channel or website statuses with the default statuses of Shiprocket. By turning it on, you can select or create an order status which you want to push on your channel. When the Push Order Status Mapper is disabled, default push status mapping will work on your channel. 



1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

3. Now, click on 'edit' button for the channel you wish to push order statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.

4. Here, you will be able to locate the 'Push Order Statuses' header. Please turn the toggle on.

5. Now, you can either select from the drop-down or create your own custom statuses. Please refer to the image below:

Question: What's a Map Payment Statuses Feature?
Answer: The map payment statuses feature helps you map new and existing payment gateway/statuses of your channel against Shiprocket's COD and Prepaid payment statuses. To enable this:     1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  2. Now, click on the 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to map payment statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.  3. In this page, locate 'Map Payment Statuses' header. Please turn the toggle on to turn on this feature.  4. You can enter multiple statuses separated by ",". Please refer to the image below:          6. Click on 'Update Channel & Test Connection'.
Answer_html:
The map payment statuses feature helps you map new and existing payment gateway/statuses of your channel against Shiprocket's COD and Prepaid payment statuses. To enable this:


1. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.

2. Now, click on the 'Edit' button for the channel you wish to map payment statuses. It will redirect you to a new page.

4. You can enter multiple statuses separated by ",". Please refer to the image below:

Question: What is a custom channel and how do I use it?
Answer: A custom channel can be created to manage offline/Store orders or to manage orders from channels that are not integrated with Shiprocket.     How to Add a Custom Channel     Step 1: Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu. On the following page, click the Add New Channel button.          Step 2: You will see a list of all the channels that can be integrated with Shiprocket. Now select Custom -> Click Integrate          Step 3: Fill in the Channel Name field -> Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”          The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.          (Note: Orders do not come into the system automatically via any channel and no inventory is updated to the Custom channel. User has to import orders manually for Custom Channel via “Bulk import Order Sheet”)
Answer_html:
A custom channel can be created to manage offline/Store orders or to manage orders from channels that are not integrated with Shiprocket.


How to Add a Custom Channel


Step 1: Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu. On the following page, click the Add New Channel button.



Step 2: You will see a list of all the channels that can be integrated with Shiprocket. Now select Custom -> Click Integrate



Step 3: Fill in the Channel Name field -> Click “Save Channel & Test Connection”



The green icon indicates that the channel has been successfully configured.



(Note: Orders do not come into the system automatically via any channel and no inventory is updated to the Custom channel. User has to import orders manually for Custom Channel via “Bulk import Order Sheet”)

Question: How do I integrate my Zoho website with Shiprocket?
Answer: You can now integrate your Zoho website with Shiprocket. This integration is really useful for Zoho sellers who want to automate their order fulfillment process.     To connect your website, please follow the steps below:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.     2. Go ahead and click on the "Add New Channel" button placed at the top-right corner of your screen.     3. Here, click on the "Zoho" channel. On the new page, click on the "Connect to Zoho" button.      4. You'll be diverted to the Zoho login page. Log in to your Zoho account by entering your username and password.    5. Question: How do I integrate my Store Hippo account with Shiprocket?
Answer: It's time to focus more on growing your business by automating the shipping process. Use the following instructions to instantly import all your orders into your Shiprocket account:     A step-by-step guide to integrate your Store Hippo account with Shiprocket:        1. Generate an "Access Key"     a) Log in to your Store Hippo account.  b) Go to "Advanced Settings" to create an access key.     2. Integrate Store Hippo with Shiprocket     a) Log in to your Shiprocket account.  b) Here, go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu.  c) Click on "Add New Channel" from your top-right corner. A new screen will open where you can find the list of all the channels that can be integrated with ShipRocket.  d) Click on the ‘Add’ option under Store Hippo.    e) Here, turn the toggle on to pull your order statuses in Shiprocket.   f) Next, enter your "Store URL" and "Access Key".         g) Finally, click on ‘Save Channel and Test Connection’. It's time to focus more on growing your business by automating the shipping process. Use the following instructions to instantly import all your orders into your Shiprocket account:


A step-by-step guide to integrate your Store Hippo account with Shiprocket:

a) Log in to your Store Hippo account.

Question: Channel Integration: How to import the weight and dimensions of each product?
Answer: Shiprocket does not import dimensions for any of your SKU. However, you can easily add shipping weight and dimensions to each product by following the instructions below:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Manage >> Manage Catalog from the left menu.    2. You'll find an 'upload' icon at the top-right corner of your screen. Click on it and download a sample product file.        3. Replace the sample data with your products' information. It includes info like Channel Name, Product Name, SKU Code, Weight, Dimensions, etc.     4. Now, select the updated file using the 'Browse' option and click on 'Upload Products' to proceed.      Note: Adding actual/dead weight to the product file is optional but highly advisable. Shiprocket will take the default weight of your SKU if there's no information present in the product file.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket does not import dimensions for any of your SKU. However, you can easily add shipping weight and dimensions to each product by following the instructions below:


1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and go to Manage >> Manage Catalog from the left menu.

2. You'll find an 'upload' icon at the top-right corner of your screen. Click on it and download a sample product file. 


3. Replace the sample data with your products' information. It includes info like Channel Name, Product Name, SKU Code, Weight, Dimensions, etc. 

4. Now, select the updated file using the 'Browse' option and click on 'Upload Products' to proceed. 


Note: Adding actual/dead weight to the product file is optional but highly advisable. Shiprocket will take the default weight of your SKU if there's no information present in the product file.

Question: How do I integrate Ecwid as a channel with Shiprocket ?
Answer: Follow the steps below to integrate your Shiprocket account with Ecwid:     1. Log in to your Shiprocket account.  2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu. Fill in the required information and then click the 'Connect to Ecwid' button on your screen to continue.          5. You'll be directed to the Ecwid login page. To log in, enter your Ecwid username and password.          6. Once logged in, you'll see a pop-up on your screen asking you to 'Authorize Shiprocket'. Answer_html:
Follow the steps below to integrate your Shiprocket account with Ecwid:

2. Go to Manage >> All Channels from the left menu. Next, click on the Add New Channel button.

3. Next, find the Ecwid channel and click on Integrate.



4. Fill in the required information and then click the 'Connect to Ecwid' button on your screen to continue.



5. You'll be directed to the Ecwid login page. To log in, enter your Ecwid username and password.

Question: How do I recharge my Shiprocket wallet?
Answer: 1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and click "Recharge Wallet" from the top bar.      2. You can enter your preferred amount for recharge, or you can do a quick selection from the options given below. Please keep in mind that if you choose to enter the amount, it must be a multiple of 100, such as 200, 500, 800, 10,000, and so on.   *The minimum recharge amount for a first time recharge is Rs. 200, and post that minimum recharge amount is Rs. 100.     3. Next, enter a coupon code if you have any or choose a coupon from the drop-down menu and click on Apply.     4. Click on Continue to Payment button to go to the next step. Next, select your preferred payment method and click on the Pay button. It will take you to your chosen payment gateway where you can complete your transaction.
Answer_html:
1. Log in to your Shiprocket account and click "Recharge Wallet" from the top bar.

2. You can enter your preferred amount for recharge, or you can do a quick selection from the options given below. Please keep in mind that if you choose to enter the amount, it must be a multiple of 100, such as 200, 500, 800, 10,000, and so on. 

*The minimum recharge amount for a first time recharge is Rs. 200, and post that minimum recharge amount is Rs. 100.


3. Next, enter a coupon code if you have any or choose a coupon from the drop-down menu and click on Apply.


4. Click on Continue to Payment button to go to the next step. Next, select your preferred payment method and click on the Pay button. It will take you to your chosen payment gateway where you can complete your transaction.

Question: How to calculate my shipping rate?
Answer: Follow the below mentioned steps to easily calculate your shipping rates:     Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.     Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.             Step 3: Now, select your shipment type. Forward shipment is when an order is being delivered from you to the customer’s address. Whereas, Return shipment is when a customer buys a product but is not happy with it and initiates a return and now, the shipment is returning back to the pickup address.            Step 4: Enter your Pickup area pincode which can be your office, home or maybe warehouse address.     Step 5: Enter the delivery area pincode which will be your end customer’s address.       Step 6: Enter the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and packaging. It should always be in Kg.      Step 7: We always recommend you add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you a more accurate rate of your shipment.      Step 8: Select your Shipment Payment Type.      Step 9: Enter the Value of your shipment. You can also secure your high-value shipments above 5,000/- with Shiprocket Secure to safeguard your shipment from any loss or damage.     Step 10: Select yes or no accordingly to acknowledge dangerous goods. Dangerous Goods are items that may endanger the safety of an aircraft or persons on board it as there are potential adverse effects of temperature, pressure and humidity variations.     Step 11: Now, click the calculate button to view the shipping rates of your shipment.           On the left side of your courier rate result, check your order details including your pickup pincode, delivery area, shipment value, payment type, and applicable weight in Kg.     Check the serviceable list of couriers, their estimated delivery dates, rating, chargeable weight, shipment rate, and applied COD charges here if you have opted for cash on delivery payment type.      Click on create shipment button and you will be directed to the quick shipment form page where you can fill in the remaining information of your shipment and can save yourself from a lot of hassles.
Answer_html:
Follow the below mentioned steps to easily calculate your shipping rates:

 

Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.

 

Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.

 

 

 

Step 3: Now, select your shipment type. Forward shipment is when an order is being delivered from you to the customer’s address. Whereas, Return shipment is when a customer buys a product but is not happy with it and initiates a return and now, the shipment is returning back to the pickup address.  

 

 

Step 4: Enter your Pickup area pincode which can be your office, home or maybe warehouse address.

 

Step 5: Enter the delivery area pincode which will be your end customer’s address.  

 

Step 6: Enter the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and packaging. It should always be in Kg. 

 

Step 7: We always recommend you add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you a more accurate rate of your shipment. 

 

Step 8: Select your Shipment Payment Type. 

 

Step 9: Enter the Value of your shipment. You can also secure your high-value shipments above 5,000/- with Shiprocket Secure to safeguard your shipment from any loss or damage.

 

Step 10: Select yes or no accordingly to acknowledge dangerous goods. Dangerous Goods are items that may endanger the safety of an aircraft or persons on board it as there are potential adverse effects of temperature, pressure and humidity variations.

 

Step 11: Now, click the calculate button to view the shipping rates of your shipment. 

 

 

On the left side of your courier rate result, check your order details including your pickup pincode, delivery area, shipment value, payment type, and applicable weight in Kg.

 

Check the serviceable list of couriers, their estimated delivery dates, rating, chargeable weight, shipment rate, and applied COD charges here if you have opted for cash on delivery payment type. 

 

Click on create shipment button and you will be directed to the quick shipment form page where you can fill in the remaining information of your shipment and can save yourself from a lot of hassles.

Question: What do we mean by shipment forward charges and RTO charges?
Answer: Forward shipment and RTO charges are incurred on shipments, shipped through different courier partners.     Shipment forward charges: When an order is being delivered from seller to the customer’s address it is called a forward delivery and shipping charges incurred for the same shipment are called forward charges.     RTO backward charges: When a courier partner is unable to deliver the shipment to the end customer, it is marked as Return To Origin (RTO) i.e return the shipment back to the pickup address. The charges incurred for shipping the parcel back to the seller’s pick up address are called RTO backward charges.     To know about the details of forward and RTO charges for your shipments, you can refer to the rate calculator in the panel. To access the rate calculator-   Login to the Shiprocket panel  Go to Tools and click on Rate Calculator from the left menu.
Answer_html:
Forward shipment and RTO charges are incurred on shipments, shipped through different courier partners.


Shipment forward charges: When an order is being delivered from seller to the customer’s address it is called a forward delivery and shipping charges incurred for the same shipment are called forward charges.


RTO backward charges: When a courier partner is unable to deliver the shipment to the end customer, it is marked as Return To Origin (RTO) i.e return the shipment back to the pickup address. The charges incurred for shipping the parcel back to the seller’s pick up address are called RTO backward charges.


To know about the details of forward and RTO charges for your shipments, you can refer to the rate calculator in the panel. To access the rate calculator-

  • Login to the Shiprocket panel
  • Go to Tools and click on Rate Calculator from the left menu.

Question: Explaining shipping zones: How shipment zones affect order fulfillment and rates?
Answer: Courier companies have divided all serviceable pin codes into multiple shipping zones. Each shipping zone has multiple sets of pin codes and a definite definition. Your shipping metrics like Freight (Forward & RTO) Charges and Delivery Time depends on the shipping zone in which your selected pin codes falls.    How courier companies define shipping zones in Shiprocket:    Zone A (Within City) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same city.    Zone B (Within State/region) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same state/region.    Zone C (Metro to Metro) - If both Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in metro cities    Zone D (Rest of India) - If any or both pickup and delivery pin codes are in India. This excludes any pin code of North East region and J&K region.    Zone E - If one or both cities are in North East states, J&K, Kerala and Himachal Pradesh.
Answer_html:
Courier companies have divided all serviceable pin codes into multiple shipping zones. Each shipping zone has multiple sets of pin codes and a definite definition. Your shipping metrics like Freight (Forward & RTO) Charges and Delivery Time depends on the shipping zone in which your selected pin codes falls.

How courier companies define shipping zones in Shiprocket:

Zone A (Within City) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same city.

Zone B (Within State/region) - If Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in the same state/region.

Zone C (Metro to Metro) - If both Pickup and Delivery pin codes are in metro cities

Zone D (Rest of India) - If any or both pickup and delivery pin codes are in India. This excludes any pin code of North East region and J&K region.

Zone E - If one or both cities are in North East states, J&K, Kerala and Himachal Pradesh.

Question: I want to send my shipment outside India. How do I check the international shipping rate in Shiprocket?
Answer: Follow the below mentioned steps to easily calculate your international shipping rates:     Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.     Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” option from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.          Step 3: Now choose international from top.           Step 4: Add your Pickup area pincode from where you want your shipment to get picked.     Step 5: Add your destination country where you wish to deliver your shipment.      Step 6: Input the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and all packaging. It should always be in Kg.      Step 7: We always recommend you to add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you more accurate rate of your shipment.      Step 8: Now, Click the calculate button to view the shipping rates of your shipment.              On the left side of your courier rate result, check your order details including pickup pincode, delivery pincode and the applicable weight in Kg.      You can check the serviceable list of couriers, ratings, and shipment rate here.
Answer_html:
Follow the below mentioned steps to easily calculate your international shipping rates:


Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.


Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” option from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.



Step 3: Now choose international from top. 



Step 4: Add your Pickup area pincode from where you want your shipment to get picked.


Step 5: Add your destination country where you wish to deliver your shipment. 


Step 6: Input the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and all packaging. It should always be in Kg. 


Step 7: We always recommend you to add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you more accurate rate of your shipment. 


Step 8: Now, Click the calculate button to view the shipping rates of your shipment. 




On the left side of your courier rate result, check your order details including pickup pincode, delivery pincode and the applicable weight in Kg. 


You can check the serviceable list of couriers, ratings, and shipment rate here.

Question: How to check the applied COD charges?
Answer: Follow the listed below steps to check applied COD charges:     Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.     Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.           Step 3: Now, select your shipment type. Forward shipment is when an order is being delivered from you to the customer’s address. Whereas, Return shipment is when a customer buys a product but not happy with it and initiates a return and now, the shipment is returning back to the pickup address.             Step 4: Enter your Pickup area pincode which can be your office, home or may be warehouse address.     Step 5: Enter the delivery area pincode which will be your end customer’s address.       Step 6: Enter the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and packaging. It should always be in Kg.      Step 7: We always recommend you add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you a more accurate rate of your shipment.      Step 8: For payment type, select COD.      Step 9: Click on the calculate button and check the results.      Step 10: Go to the Shipment Rate column and hover on the info icon to check the bifurcation of Freight and COD charges.           For COD shipments, a fixed COD charge or COD% of the order value whichever is higher will be taken while calculating the COD fee.     Example: For a shipment weighing 0.5 Kg from New Delhi to Chennai, a courier partner charges a fee of Rs. 36 and COD % at 2.50%. Then the value of your shipments can be calculated as below-       Order Value    Rs. 750    COD % (2.5%)    Rs. 18.75    COD Fixed Charges    Rs. 36    Volumetric Weight    10x10x10/5000 = 0.02kg       *All Values shown are for illustration purpose only.
Answer_html:
Follow the listed below steps to check applied COD charges:


Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.


Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” from the side menu and select Rate Calculator.




Step 3: Now, select your shipment type. Forward shipment is when an order is being delivered from you to the customer’s address. Whereas, Return shipment is when a customer buys a product but not happy with it and initiates a return and now, the shipment is returning back to the pickup address.  




Step 4: Enter your Pickup area pincode which can be your office, home or may be warehouse address.


Step 5: Enter the delivery area pincode which will be your end customer’s address.  


Step 6: Enter the Actual Weight of your shipment. Actual weight is the final weight of your shipment including the product and packaging. It should always be in Kg. 


Step 7: We always recommend you add the dimensions of your shipment as volumetric weight defines the space a shipment occupies and therefore gives you a more accurate rate of your shipment. 


Step 8: For payment type, select COD. 


Step 9: Click on the calculate button and check the results. 


Step 10: Go to the Shipment Rate column and hover on the info icon to check the bifurcation of Freight and COD charges. 



For COD shipments, a fixed COD charge or COD% of the order value whichever is higher will be taken while calculating the COD fee.

 

Example: For a shipment weighing 0.5 Kg from New Delhi to Chennai, a courier partner charges a fee of Rs. 36 and COD % at 2.50%. Then the value of your shipments can be calculated as below-

 

Order Value

Rs. 750

COD % (2.5%)

Rs. 18.75

COD Fixed Charges

Rs. 36

Volumetric Weight

10x10x10/5000 = 0.02kg


*All Values shown are for illustration purpose only.

Question: What are the necessary steps to be fulfilled for hassle free COD remittance?
Answer: To get a hassle-free COD remittance, ensure the following:   Bank details are updated in your Shiprocket panel in which you want the amount to get remitted.  Your Shiprocket wallet balance is always positive [only for prepaid sellers].  There is no freight invoice pending for more than 30 days.
Answer_html:
To get a hassle-free COD remittance, ensure the following:

  1. Bank details are updated in your Shiprocket panel in which you want the amount to get remitted.
  2. Your Shiprocket wallet balance is always positive [only for prepaid sellers].
  3. There is no freight invoice pending for more than 30 days.

Question: I want to check how much COD is pending to be remitted?
Answer: In ShipRocket, you can easily view the COD amount that is pending to be remitted. For this;     1. Go to the Billing tab and click on the COD Remittance tab. The top 5 sections as shown in the image below gives you the snapshot of your COD remittance amount till date with Shiprocket.            COD Available: Total COD amount yet to remit.  Last COD remitted: COD amount remitted most recently  Total COD Remitted ( In last 30 days): COD amount that has been remitted in the last 30 days  Total Reversal Amount: We took back the COD amount due to some specific reasons  Remittance Initiated: We have initiated the COD amount. It will be remitted in the next COD cycle
Answer_html:
In ShipRocket, you can easily view the COD amount that is pending to be remitted. For this;


1. Go to the Billing tab and click on the COD Remittance tab. The top 5 sections as shown in the image below gives you the snapshot of your COD remittance amount till date with Shiprocket.



  1. COD Available: Total COD amount yet to remit.
  2. Last COD remitted: COD amount remitted most recently
  3. Total COD Remitted ( In last 30 days): COD amount that has been remitted in the last 30 days
  4. Total Reversal Amount: We took back the COD amount due to some specific reasons
  5. Remittance Initiated: We have initiated the COD amount. It will be remitted in the next COD cycle

Question: I want to upgrade my Shiprocket plan. How do I do it?
Answer: ShipRocket offers a range of plans which fit any requirement that a user might have. If you wish to upgrade your plan, follow the steps given below:     1. Go to your left menu bar and click on the Billing tab     2. Now, click on Current Plan Details. Here you can see different plans which are available with ShipRocket.       3. Every Shiprocket plan has something different to offer. Select your plan and click on the Activate button.    4. Select your ideal duration and click on 'Pay Now'.     On successful payment, your Shiprocket plan gets upgraded to the selected plan and all the benefits are unlocked.
Answer_html:
ShipRocket offers a range of plans which fit any requirement that a user might have. If you wish to upgrade your plan, follow the steps given below:


1. Go to your left menu bar and click on the Billing tab

2. Now, click on Current Plan Details. Here you can see different plans which are available with ShipRocket.


3. Every Shiprocket plan has something different to offer. Select your plan and click on the Activate button. 


4. Select your ideal duration and click on 'Pay Now'.


On successful payment, your Shiprocket plan gets upgraded to the selected plan and all the benefits are unlocked.

Question: What is Shiprocket Postpaid? How do I activate it?
Answer: The Postpaid plan is an effective way for the seller to get more transparent reconciliations, uninterrupted shipping, and benefit from faster COD remittance process. It gives the seller more power over their money and enables them to utilize it for shipping while their COD remittance is processing.     Benefits of Postpaid     1. Dynamic Shipping Limit - With the Postpaid feature, a seller gets a daily dynamic shipping limit based on his/her COD delivered shipments.      2. No worries about low balance or inability to recharge    3. Convenience of auto-recharge        How to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid?     1. Go to the Settings from the left menu and click on Postpaid under the COD Payments section.             3. Turn the toggle on to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid.      4. After opting for the Postpaid setting, you’ll be required to upload the image of your signature and accept the Agreement.     5. Click on Submit to proceed.
Answer_html:
The Postpaid plan is an effective way for the seller to get more transparent reconciliations, uninterrupted shipping, and benefit from faster COD remittance process. It gives the seller more power over their money and enables them to utilize it for shipping while their COD remittance is processing.


Benefits of Postpaid


1. Dynamic Shipping Limit - With the Postpaid feature, a seller gets a daily dynamic shipping limit based on his/her COD delivered shipments. 


2. No worries about low balance or inability to recharge

3. Convenience of auto-recharge

 


How to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid?


1. Go to the Settings from the left menu and click on Postpaid under the COD Payments section.




3. Turn the toggle on to switch from Prepaid to Postpaid. 


4. After opting for the Postpaid setting, you’ll be required to upload the image of your signature and accept the Agreement.


5. Click on Submit to proceed.

Question: How many times do I get freight invoices in a month?
Answer: We bill our customers twice in a month, therefore you would receive freight invoices at the mid and end of every month.
Answer_html: We bill our customers twice in a month, therefore you would receive freight invoices at the mid and end of every month.

Question: What happens if I don't pay my invoice?
Answer: If a Freight invoice is pending:     Here, we hold 1.5x of your COD remittance. We will transfer the pending remittance to your bank account as soon as you clear your invoice.      If a SaaS invoice is pending:     If your invoice is still overdue after the last date, you get 10 extra days to clear your invoice. After this, your account will be suspended. You can then downgrade to our Lite plan or renew your existing plan as required.       If you have any further query, you can call our customer support team at +91-9266623006.
Answer_html:
If a Freight invoice is pending:


Here, we hold 1.5x of your COD remittance. We will transfer the pending remittance to your bank account as soon as you clear your invoice. 


If a SaaS invoice is pending:


If your invoice is still overdue after the last date, you get 10 extra days to clear your invoice. After this, your account will be suspended. You can then downgrade to our Lite plan or renew your existing plan as required.  


If you have any further query, you can call our customer support team at +91-9266623006.

Question: Why there is a weight discrepancy pop up on my screen?
Answer: Weight discrepancy arises when there's a difference between the weight given by the seller and the courier company. During this period, Shiprocket put the additional amount of difference on-hold. This pop up acts as a notification which tells you to take the appropriate action. You can either accept the discrepancy or raise a dispute.
Answer_html: Weight discrepancy arises when there's a difference between the weight given by the seller and the courier company. During this period, Shiprocket put the additional amount of difference on-hold. This pop up acts as a notification which tells you to take the appropriate action. You can either accept the discrepancy or raise a dispute.

Question: If I do not agree with the charged weight, what are the next steps to follow?
Answer: If you do not agree with the charged amount against your order's weight, you can raise a dispute for it at Shiprocket. This is called a weight discrepancy and it arises when the courier partner charges a higher amount for your shipment based on the weight.     At Shiprocket, the amount for your order is charged based on its dead weight or volumetric weight, whichever is higher.        To raise a dispute:   Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy.  Under the tab Actions, you can find the option of Dispute Discrepancy.  Click on it to raise a dispute. A new form will pop up. Fill in the information required in it and then click submit.       Once you raise a dispute, you will need to select a category and a sub-category along with photographs of your shipment.  After this, Shiprocket will take a maximum of 7 working days to resolve your dispute.     If there is a discrepancy, you will be notified as soon as you log in to your Shiprocket dashboard. If you do not respond within 7 working days, Shiprocket Auto Accepts the discrepancy and deducts the additional amount charged from your Shiprocket wallet.         You can also view your dispute history by clicking on the Show History option under the Action column of the Weight Reconciliation tab.       You can see the amount on hold separately from your wallet balance as you hover over your wallet in the ShipRocket dashboard.
Answer_html:
If you do not agree with the charged amount against your order's weight, you can raise a dispute for it at Shiprocket. This is called a weight discrepancy and it arises when the courier partner charges a higher amount for your shipment based on the weight.


At Shiprocket, the amount for your order is charged based on its dead weight or volumetric weight, whichever is higher.



To raise a dispute:

  • Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy.
  • Under the tab Actions, you can find the option of Dispute Discrepancy.  Click on it to raise a dispute. A new form will pop up. Fill in the information required in it and then click submit.


  • Once you raise a dispute, you will need to select a category and a sub-category along with photographs of your shipment.
  • After this, Shiprocket will take a maximum of 7 working days to resolve your dispute.

If there is a discrepancy, you will be notified as soon as you log in to your Shiprocket dashboard. If you do not respond within 7 working days, Shiprocket Auto Accepts the discrepancy and deducts the additional amount charged from your Shiprocket wallet.



You can also view your dispute history by clicking on the Show History option under the Action column of the Weight Reconciliation tab.


You can see the amount on hold separately from your wallet balance as you hover over your wallet in the ShipRocket dashboard.

Question: Explain the different types of weight terminology used in the platform?
Answer: Different types of weight terminology used in the platform are mentioned below:-   Entered Weight:  It is the weight that the seller enters into the panel while processing an Order. (Note: The system takes 0.5 Kg as the minimum default weight for the shipment)  Volumetric Weight: It is weight calculated based on the dimensions ( L, B, H) entered for an order. This weight is calculated as (LxBxH)/5000 (for most of our courier partners) which measures the amount of space that an order will take in the carrier. The base factor to calculate the volumetric weight might vary for different courier partners.  Applied Weight: It is higher of two weights entered by the user i.e entered and volumetric weight on which the shipping charges are calculated.  Charged Weight: The weight for which you are charged by the courier company.       Shiprocket allows you to notice the final charged weight in the weight reconciliation tab.   For your convenience, there is an option to export the weight reconciliation sheet for your reference. The download icon at the top right corner is highlighted in the image below. To do so-   Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy.  Click on the Export option on the right side of the screen to download the report for all your orders.
Answer_html:
Different types of weight terminology used in the platform are mentioned below:-

  • Entered Weight:  It is the weight that the seller enters into the panel while processing an Order. (Note: The system takes 0.5 Kg as the minimum default weight for the shipment)
  • Volumetric Weight: It is weight calculated based on the dimensions ( L, B, H) entered for an order. This weight is calculated as (LxBxH)/5000 (for most of our courier partners) which measures the amount of space that an order will take in the carrier. The base factor to calculate the volumetric weight might vary for different courier partners.
  • Applied Weight: It is higher of two weights entered by the user i.e entered and volumetric weight on which the shipping charges are calculated.
  • Charged Weight: The weight for which you are charged by the courier company. 


Shiprocket allows you to notice the final charged weight in the weight reconciliation tab.

 For your convenience, there is an option to export the weight reconciliation sheet for your reference. The download icon at the top right corner is highlighted in the image below. To do so-

  1. Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy.
  2. Click on the Export option on the right side of the screen to download the report for all your orders.

Question: What are the packaging tips to reduce weight errors in shipping?
Answer: Packaging tips can help you reduce weight errors in shipping. Some of these are-      The size of your package must be such that it exactly fits the product.  Make sure your packaging is well in contrast to the weight of your products.  Measure the dimensions of the package, instead of the product.   Keep a similar line of packaging for a similar category of products.  Choose a light weight packaging material.                     ARTICLE PROPERTIES
Answer_html:
Packaging tips can help you reduce weight errors in shipping. Some of these are-


  • The size of your package must be such that it exactly fits the product.
  • Make sure your packaging is well in contrast to the weight of your products.
  • Measure the dimensions of the package, instead of the product. 
  • Keep a similar line of packaging for a similar category of products.
  • Choose a light weight packaging material.


ARTICLE PROPERTIES

Question: How to calculate the volumetric weight of my shipment?
Answer: Determine the volumetric weight of a box:      Divide the cubic size* of the package by 5,000* (in cm) to determine the volumetric weight in kilograms. Increase the fractions of weight to the next full kilogram.      Note: *Calculate cubic size: Multiply the length of the package by its width and height (each rounded up to the nearest whole centimetre).        Determine the volumetric weight of a cylinder:      Calculate the volume by multiplying the diameter (length) of the cylinder with its width. Then, multiply that number by the height of the package to get volume.     Next, divide the volume by 5000*(in cm) to determine the volumetric weight of your shipment.      Conversion Factor:     Volumetric Divisors:             Couriers::ARAMEX         => 6000,          Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE => 4500,          Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE_LIGHT => 4500,          Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE_MIN => 4500,          'default'                => 5000
Answer_html:
Determine the volumetric weight of a box: 


Divide the cubic size* of the package by 5,000* (in cm) to determine the volumetric weight in kilograms. Increase the fractions of weight to the next full kilogram. 


Note: *Calculate cubic size: Multiply the length of the package by its width and height (each rounded up to the nearest whole centimetre).



Determine the volumetric weight of a cylinder: 


Calculate the volume by multiplying the diameter (length) of the cylinder with its width. Then, multiply that number by the height of the package to get volume.


Next, divide the volume by 5000*(in cm) to determine the volumetric weight of your shipment. 


Conversion Factor:


Volumetric Divisors:


        Couriers::ARAMEX         => 6000,

        Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE => 4500,

        Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE_LIGHT => 4500,

        Couriers::FEDEX_SURFACE_MIN => 4500,

        'default'                => 5000

Question: How long does it take to resolve my order weight dispute?
Answer: Once you raise a weight dispute, it gets forwarded to our weight experts at Shiprocket. Therefore, it takes a minimum of 7 days to get back to you with a resolution.
Answer_html: Once you raise a weight dispute, it gets forwarded to our weight experts at Shiprocket. Therefore, it takes a minimum of 7 days to get back to you with a resolution.

Question: Why is my amount on-hold?
Answer: When a weight discrepancy raised against a shipment, we put your wallet amount on-hold. The on-hold amount is the additional charge that the courier has applied against the discrepancy. By reserving this amount, we make sure that no one will use this amount until the dispute is resolved.
Answer_html: When a weight discrepancy raised against a shipment, we put your wallet amount on-hold. The on-hold amount is the additional charge that the courier has applied against the discrepancy. By reserving this amount, we make sure that no one will use this amount until the dispute is resolved.

To download a report for weight discrepancy:    Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy.     To download the weight discrepancy report, click the download icon in the upper-right corner of your screen.
Answer_html:
Yes, you can download all the weight discrepancy order report. Weight Discrepancy takes place when the weight mentioned by the user is different from the weight calculated by the carrier service.


To download a report for weight discrepancy:

  • Go to Weight Panel from the left menu and select Weight Discrepancy. 

  • To download the weight discrepancy report, click the download icon in the upper-right corner of your screen.

Question: Can I see all Shiprocket rates in one place?
Answer: Yes, of course you can!      Follow the listed below steps to see all Shiprocket rates in one place:     Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.     Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” option from the side menu and select Rate Card.     Step 3: Here at the Rate Card, you can easily view all Shiprocket rates.       Here, you will find an elaborated list of all available couriers at Shiprocket. You can also apply filters here to find a more concise list of couriers that perfectly meets your shipping needs.     You can also compare the shipping rates here on different plans.
Answer_html:
Yes, of course you can! 


Follow the listed below steps to see all Shiprocket rates in one place:


Step 1: Log in to your Shiprocket Account.


Step 2: Navigate to the “Tools” option from the side menu and select Rate Card.


Step 3: Here at the Rate Card, you can easily view all Shiprocket rates.


Here, you will find an elaborated list of all available couriers at Shiprocket. You can also apply filters here to find a more concise list of couriers that perfectly meets your shipping needs.


You can also compare the shipping rates here on different plans.

Question: How to compare different Shiprocket plans rates while using filters?
Answer: On the Rate Card, you will find all courier partners in a list segregated as per their shipment modes. If you wish to compare the different Shiprocket plans, you can easily do it right from the rate card by clicking on the drop-down menu shown in the below-mentioned image.           As shown in the above mentioned image, select any of the plans from lite, basic, advanced, and pro for which you wish to check the rates and the rest of the courier details.      Filters are added to the Rate card for your convenience so that you can easily shortlist couriers based on their parameters and your preferences.     You will find four different filters in the Rate Card:     1. Courier: Here, you can apply the courier filter to shortlist your preferred couriers depending on their names.        2. Mode: This filter enables you to find suitable couriers depending on your applied shipping modes. It can be air, surface, or hyperlocal. This will help you to save time and energy too as you don’t have to go through the entire list. Instead, you can apply filter for your preferred shipping modes which will help you to get a concise list of couriers.              3. Weight: The weight filter is to help you find a concise list of couriers depending on the weight of your shipment. This way, you will be able to save yourself from the pain of going through the entire rate card.        4. Sort By: This filter enables you to sort your couriers by weight. This will provide a clearer view of your preferred courier partners, particularly if you ship in specific weight categories.                The result displayed will be according to the plan you selected and the filters you applied.      Similarly, you can check for the rest of the plans and compare them.
Answer_html:
On the Rate Card, you will find all courier partners in a list segregated as per their shipment modes. If you wish to compare the different Shiprocket plans, you can easily do it right from the rate card by clicking on the drop-down menu shown in the below-mentioned image. 



As shown in the above mentioned image, select any of the plans from lite, basic, advanced, and pro for which you wish to check the rates and the rest of the courier details. 


Filters are added to the Rate card for your convenience so that you can easily shortlist couriers based on their parameters and your preferences.


You will find four different filters in the Rate Card:


1. Courier: Here, you can apply the courier filter to shortlist your preferred couriers depending on their names. 


2. Mode: This filter enables you to find suitable couriers depending on your applied shipping modes. It can be air, surface, or hyperlocal. This will help you to save time and energy too as you don’t have to go through the entire list. Instead, you can apply filter for your preferred shipping modes which will help you to get a concise list of couriers. 




3. Weight: The weight filter is to help you find a concise list of couriers depending on the weight of your shipment. This way, you will be able to save yourself from the pain of going through the entire rate card. 


4. Sort By: This filter enables you to sort your couriers by weight. This will provide a clearer view of your preferred courier partners, particularly if you ship in specific weight categories.





The result displayed will be according to the plan you selected and the filters you applied. 


Similarly, you can check for the rest of the plans and compare them.

Question: What is Forward, Reverse and Document in the Rate Card?
Answer: The followings are the courier types available on the Rate Card screen:     Forward Courier Type: Forward courier type in which we deliver your shipment from your end to your consumer/customer/buyer.      Reverse Courier Type: Reverse courier type in which we manage the reverse movement of your shipment from your end user to you.      Document Courier Type: These couriers specialise in shipping lightweight shipments weighing up to 0.5kg such as documents, mobile phone bills, insurance bills, bank statements, annual general reports, pamphlets, direct mailers, invitation cards, and so on.
Answer_html:
The followings are the courier types available on the Rate Card screen:


Forward Courier Type: Forward courier type in which we deliver your shipment from your end to your consumer/customer/buyer. 


Reverse Courier Type: Reverse courier type in which we manage the reverse movement of your shipment from your end user to you. 


Document Courier Type: These couriers specialise in shipping lightweight shipments weighing up to 0.5kg such as documents, mobile phone bills, insurance bills, bank statements, annual general reports, pamphlets, direct mailers, invitation cards, and so on.

Question: What is Minimum Weight?
Answer: The lowest weight the courier can charge on any shipment is referred to as the minimum weight.
Answer_html: The lowest weight the courier can charge on any shipment is referred to as the minimum weight.

Question: How to create Multi-users?
Answer: Follow the listed below steps to create multi-users for your account:      Step 1: Go to the settings option from the left menu.      Step 2: Click on the ‘Manage Users’ option from the User Role Management category.     Step 3: If you are adding users for the first time, then you will have to start adding users by filling out this form.           Step 4: Enter the Full Name and email ID of the user. Select modules that they can access and choose if you want to show the buyer’s personal information to this user or not. Buyer’s personal information means their name, and contact details like email address, mobile number, and address which you can manage to show or not to that specific user.      Step 5: Click on Add User button and now, you can view your users in the list.      Step 6: If you wish to edit the user role of already added users in your account, go to the ‘Settings’ option available in the left menu. Click the ‘Manage Users’ option available in the User Role Management Menu Block.           Step 7: Select Edit User and start editing the user role accordingly.           Step 8: Click on the update button.
Answer_html:
Follow the listed below steps to create multi-users for your account: 


Step 1: Go to the settings option from the left menu.


Step 2: Click on the ‘Manage Users’ option from the User Role Management category.


Step 3: If you are adding users for the first time, then you will have to start adding users by filling out this form. 



Step 4: Enter the Full Name and email ID of the user. Select modules that they can access and choose if you want to show the buyer’s personal information to this user or not. Buyer’s personal information means their name, and contact details like email address, mobile number, and address which you can manage to show or not to that specific user. 


Step 5: Click on Add User button and now, you can view your users in the list. 


Step 6: If you wish to edit the user role of already added users in your account, go to the ‘Settings’ option available in the left menu. Click the ‘Manage Users’ option available in the User Role Management Menu Block. 



Step 7: Select Edit User and start editing the user role accordingly. 



Step 8: Click on the update button.

Question: What are the available plans in Shiprocket and which one would be the most suitable for my shipping needs?
Answer: Shiprocket offers several plans to our users based on their business and shipping needs:        LITE: We recommend this plan for sellers who ship not over 60 shipments in a month. It’s a FREE plan with 0-month minimum sign up period. The shipping rate starts from ₹26.27/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST). Choose this plan if you are a social seller or a newbie in the world of e-commerce.      BASIC: Get this plan if you ship between 60-100 shipments in a month. This would be a good plan to buy if you also sell on different channels like Amazon, Shopify, etc. You get 2 channels integration at a monthly price of Rs. 1000. In the basic plan, shipping rates start from ₹24.58/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST).      ADVANCED: This plan is for someone who ships between 100-300 shipments in a month. Also, choose this plan if you have around 10000 SKUs in your inventory. Other than that, we offer all 7 channel integration in our Advanced plan. The per month price of the Advanced Plan is 2000/month and the shipping rate starts from ₹22.88/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST).      PRO: The Pro Plan is for sellers who ship between 300-1000 shipments in a month. It’s a great plan for sellers who have a large inventory as we offer around 25000 SKUs in this plan. Also, you will get all 7 channel integration and your own Key Account Manager to help you out. The per month price of the Pro Plan is 3000/month and the shipping rate starts from ₹20.34/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST).       ENTERPRISE: This is an exclusive plan for sellers who ship over 2500 shipments per month. It is a completely unique plan that is not available to everyone on our panel. If you are interested in this plan, we would request you contact our seller support team at +91-9266623006.      Click Here to view a detailed comparison of each plan as this will help you to select the right plan as per your shipment needs.
Answer_html:
Shiprocket offers several plans to our users based on their business and shipping needs:


 

LITE: We recommend this plan for sellers who ship not over 60 shipments in a month. It’s a FREE plan with 0-month minimum sign up period. The shipping rate starts from ₹26.27/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST). Choose this plan if you are a social seller or a newbie in the world of e-commerce. 

 

BASIC: Get this plan if you ship between 60-100 shipments in a month. This would be a good plan to buy if you also sell on different channels like Amazon, Shopify, etc. You get 2 channels integration at a monthly price of Rs. 1000. In the basic plan, shipping rates start from ₹24.58/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST). 

 

ADVANCED: This plan is for someone who ships between 100-300 shipments in a month. Also, choose this plan if you have around 10000 SKUs in your inventory. Other than that, we offer all 7 channel integration in our Advanced plan. The per month price of the Advanced Plan is 2000/month and the shipping rate starts from ₹22.88/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST). 

 

PRO: The Pro Plan is for sellers who ship between 300-1000 shipments in a month. It’s a great plan for sellers who have a large inventory as we offer around 25000 SKUs in this plan. Also, you will get all 7 channel integration and your own Key Account Manager to help you out. The per month price of the Pro Plan is 3000/month and the shipping rate starts from ₹20.34/0.5 kg (exclusive of GST).  

 

ENTERPRISE: This is an exclusive plan for sellers who ship over 2500 shipments per month. It is a completely unique plan that is not available to everyone on our panel. If you are interested in this plan, we would request you contact our seller support team at +91-9266623006. 

 

Click Here to view a detailed comparison of each plan as this will help you to select the right plan as per your shipment needs.

Question: Can I upgrade and downgrade my plan at any time?
Answer: Yes, you can easily upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time.      Follow the listed below steps to upgrade your plan:      Step 1: Click on the Billing option from the left menu.          Step 2: Click on the current plan details from the header menu to view your current active plan.           Step 3: Go through each plan before deciding to get one and you can decide depending on the plan duration too.          Step 4: Scroll down to check out the plans comparison to make the best decision as per your requirement.           Step 5: Once you have decided, click on the Activate button to get your preferred plan.              Step 6: After this, you'll be required to choose the duration of the plan. You can also enter a coupon code here if you have any.          Step 7: Click on Pay now. You'll be redirected to a payment page where you can proceed with your payment.     To Downgrade your plan:     If you wish to degrade your plan, you need to contact our seller support team via email and they'll be able to help you out. You can also create a support ticket from your Shiprocket panel.
Answer_html:
Yes, you can easily upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. 


Follow the listed below steps to upgrade your plan: 


Step 1: Click on the Billing option from the left menu.



Step 2: Click on the current plan details from the header menu to view your current active plan. 



Step 3: Go through each plan before deciding to get one and you can decide depending on the plan duration too.



Step 4: Scroll down to check out the plans comparison to make the best decision as per your requirement. 



Step 5: Once you have decided, click on the Activate button to get your preferred plan. 




Step 6: After this, you'll be required to choose the duration of the plan. You can also enter a coupon code here if you have any.



Step 7: Click on Pay now. You'll be redirected to a payment page where you can proceed with your payment.


To Downgrade your plan:


If you wish to degrade your plan, you need to contact our seller support team via email and they'll be able to help you out. You can also create a support ticket from your Shiprocket panel.

Question: What is Courier Priority and How to set courier priority?
Answer: Courier priority enables you to set a priority list of courier partners based on cost, courier rating, and delivery speed or the custom courier priority of your choice. If you want us to decide, then choose the Recommended by Shiprocket option.     These factors will help you choose the best courier partner to surpass your customers’ expectations.     Follow the listed below steps to set courier priority:     Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.          Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Priority’ option.           Step 3: Now, choose the one that best fits your needs. You can select the Best Rated, Cheapest, Fastest, Custom, or go with Recommended by Shiprocket.      Fastest is the courier priority where you will find the fastest serviceable couriers based on their estimated delivery date.     Cheapest is the courier priority where you will find couriers that comes with lower shipping rates.      Recommended by Shiprocket is the courier priority where you enable us to decide the best for you depending on your shipping needs.     Custom is the one where you have the option to customize your courier priority as per your shipping needs and preferences.      Best Rated is the courier priority where you will find the list of couriers that are best rated based on their pickup performance, delivery performance, and ratings shared by the customers and other sellers.               Step 4: Click on the button ‘Save Courier Priority’.      Step 5: If you wish to customize your courier priority, click on the Custom option available over there.            Step 6: Drag and drop the couriers in the list in your priority order.          Step 7: Now, Click on the button ‘Save Courier Priority’ to save your customized courier priority.
Answer_html:
Courier priority enables you to set a priority list of courier partners based on cost, courier rating, and delivery speed or the custom courier priority of your choice. If you want us to decide, then choose the Recommended by Shiprocket option.


These factors will help you choose the best courier partner to surpass your customers’ expectations.


Follow the listed below steps to set courier priority:


Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.



Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Priority’ option. 



Step 3: Now, choose the one that best fits your needs. You can select the Best Rated, Cheapest, Fastest, Custom, or go with Recommended by Shiprocket. 


Fastest is the courier priority where you will find the fastest serviceable couriers based on their estimated delivery date.


Cheapest is the courier priority where you will find couriers that comes with lower shipping rates. 


Recommended by Shiprocket is the courier priority where you enable us to decide the best for you depending on your shipping needs.


Custom is the one where you have the option to customize your courier priority as per your shipping needs and preferences. 


Best Rated is the courier priority where you will find the list of couriers that are best rated based on their pickup performance, delivery performance, and ratings shared by the customers and other sellers.  




Step 4: Click on the button ‘Save Courier Priority’. 


Step 5: If you wish to customize your courier priority, click on the Custom option available over there.  



Step 6: Drag and drop the couriers in the list in your priority order.



Step 7: Now, Click on the button ‘Save Courier Priority’ to save your customized courier priority.

Question: How to set Courier Rules?
Answer: Courier Rules is a great feature for those who want to split their courier assignment based on specific conditions. This saves you from a lot of hassles. Give it a try!     Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.          Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Rules’ option available over there.           Step 3: Now click on the Add New Rule button to start adding your courier rules.             Step 4: If you haven’t added any rule yet, then you can also add new rules by clicking on the button ‘Add New Rule’.           Step 5: Fill in your shipping rule name. Next, define your shipment conditions from the drop-down list.        Payment Mode    Weight    Zone Wise    Order Value    State    Pincode    City    Dangerous Goods    Product SKU    Channel ID            Step 6: Click on the Proceed button to move further.      Step 7: Drag and drop couriers to set your courier priority list and then, click save to add your new rule.     Available couriers are the list of couriers which can get assigned if serviceable and are eligible for your applied courier rule.     Restricted couriers are those you do not wish to use for this courier rule.                  Step 8: You can activate and deactivate each specific courier rule that you have already added with the help of the toggle button.           Note: Courier rules cannot be changed or deleted. If you are no longer using a courier rule, you can deactivate it.
Answer_html:
Courier Rules is a great feature for those who want to split their courier assignment based on specific conditions. This saves you from a lot of hassles. Give it a try!


Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.



Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Rules’ option available over there. 



Step 3: Now click on the Add New Rule button to start adding your courier rules.




Step 4: If you haven’t added any rule yet, then you can also add new rules by clicking on the button ‘Add New Rule’. 



Step 5: Fill in your shipping rule name. Next, define your shipment conditions from the drop-down list. 


  • Payment Mode

  • Weight

  • Zone Wise

  • Order Value

  • State

  • Pincode

  • City

  • Dangerous Goods

  • Product SKU

  • Channel ID



Step 6: Click on the Proceed button to move further. 


Step 7: Drag and drop couriers to set your courier priority list and then, click save to add your new rule. 

  • Available couriers are the list of couriers which can get assigned if serviceable and are eligible for your applied courier rule. 

  • Restricted couriers are those you do not wish to use for this courier rule.





Step 8: You can activate and deactivate each specific courier rule that you have already added with the help of the toggle button. 



Note: Courier rules cannot be changed or deleted. If you are no longer using a courier rule, you can deactivate it.

Question: How to Activate or Deactivate Couriers?
Answer: You can activate and deactivate a courier as per your shipping needs.      Activating a courier means that this specific courier will be available in your courier options when you are looking for the best courier that can fulfill your shipping needs.      Deactivating a courier means that this very specific courier will no longer be available in the courier options when you are scheduling the pickup of your shipment. You can deactivate couriers if you feel that any specific courier is not relevant to your shipping needs. This will save you from hassle as your courier list will get shortened and you will be able to find the best courier as per your shipping needs.      Follow the listed below steps to activate your preferred courier:     Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.          Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there.           Step 3: Click on the Deactivated option available in the header menu to view the list of deactivated couriers.           Step 4: Click on the Activate button available against your preferred courier.          Follow the listed below steps to Deactivate your preferred courier:     Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.          Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there.           Step 3: Click on the Activated option available in the header menu to view the list of activated couriers.          Step 4: Click on the Deactivate button available against the courier.
Answer_html:
You can activate and deactivate a courier as per your shipping needs. 


Activating a courier means that this specific courier will be available in your courier options when you are looking for the best courier that can fulfill your shipping needs. 


Deactivating a courier means that this very specific courier will no longer be available in the courier options when you are scheduling the pickup of your shipment. You can deactivate couriers if you feel that any specific courier is not relevant to your shipping needs. This will save you from hassle as your courier list will get shortened and you will be able to find the best courier as per your shipping needs. 


Follow the listed below steps to activate your preferred courier:


Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.



Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there. 



Step 3: Click on the Deactivated option available in the header menu to view the list of deactivated couriers.


 


Step 4: Click on the Activate button available against your preferred courier.



Follow the listed below steps to Deactivate your preferred courier:


Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.



Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there. 



Step 3: Click on the Activated option available in the header menu to view the list of activated couriers.



Step 4: Click on the Deactivate button available against the courier.

Question: How to block and unblock ODA and RTO pincodes?
Answer: ODA stands for Out of Delivery Area. These are remote areas where the majority of courier partners refuse to deliver orders. This results in RTO and poor customer experience.     RTO stands for Return to Origin. The process of sending back an order to its origin in case of a failed delivery is called RTO.      In Shiprocket, you can block ODA and RTO pincodes by:       Courier: Block all ODA pincodes of the specific courier partner.    Account: Block all ODA pincodes specific to your account for the respective courier partner.    Custom: Block ODA pincodes as per your preference by manually entering the pincodes.        Follow the listed below steps to block and unblock ODA and RTO pincodes:      Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.          Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there.           Step 3: Click on the All option available in the header menu to view the list of all couriers.          Step 4: Now, click on the marked option to open the details of that particular courier.           Step 5: From this window, you can easily block and unblock RTO and ODA Pincodes.
Answer_html:
ODA stands for Out of Delivery Area. These are remote areas where the majority of courier partners refuse to deliver orders. This results in RTO and poor customer experience.


RTO stands for Return to Origin. The process of sending back an order to its origin in case of a failed delivery is called RTO. 


In Shiprocket, you can block ODA and RTO pincodes by:


  • Courier: Block all ODA pincodes of the specific courier partner.

  • Account: Block all ODA pincodes specific to your account for the respective courier partner.

  • Custom: Block ODA pincodes as per your preference by manually entering the pincodes. 


Follow the listed below steps to block and unblock ODA and RTO pincodes:


Step 1: Click on the ‘Settings’ option from the left menu.



Step 2: Navigate to the courier category and click on ‘Courier Selection’ option available over there. 



Step 3: Click on the All option available in the header menu to view the list of all couriers.



Step 4: Now, click on the marked option to open the details of that particular courier. 



Step 5: From this window, you can easily block and unblock RTO and ODA Pincodes.

Question: What if no courier rule is applicable?
Answer: If no courier rule is applied to your shipment then your orders will proceed further with the default courier priority setting in your account.      By default Recommended by Shiprocket is the courier priority that is set in your account, where you enable us to decide the best for you depending on your shipping needs.
Answer_html:
If no courier rule is applied to your shipment then your orders will proceed further with the default courier priority setting in your account. 


By default Recommended by Shiprocket is the courier priority that is set in your account, where you enable us to decide the best for you depending on your shipping needs.
